loans.name: Moshera Group

texts.en:
The Moshir group consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER.

Najiba is a 34-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a, Yemen.  She works hard to offer a good life for her family.  She has some money to buy a home appliance for her kitchen but it is not enough, so she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB.  She hopes to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy a home appliance for her kitchen.

loans.name: Yola

texts.es: La Sra. Yola tiene 26 años tiene un hijo que tienen la edad de 6 años, ella se dedica a la confección de chamarras ella vive en la localidad de Batallas donde también se encuentra su taller, ella se dedica a esta actividad hace ya varios años,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Yola  utilizara este préstamo para compra de maquina over para la confección de sus chamarras, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es falta de capital de trabajo, La Sra. Yola enfrenta retos en su negocio que son seguir mejorando la calidad de la confección de las prendas de vestir y también un reto es la distancia de la localidad a la ciudad de El Alto donde tiene que trasladar sus prendas terminadas para la venta y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir aumentando  su  capital de trabajo su deseo para su negocio es crecer y confeccionar variedad de prendas de vestir.
texts.en:
Yola, 26, has one son aged 6. She makes chamarras, similar to ponchos, for a living and lives in the town of Batallas, which is where her workshop is located. She has worked in this trade for several years and this loan is her first cycle within the institution.

Yola will use the loan to buy an overlocking sewing machine for sewing her chamarras and she is requesting the loan as she does not earn enough from her work. 

Yola faces challenges in her business, such as continuing to improve the quality of her products and overcoming the challenge of the distance between her home and the city of El Alto, where she must take her finished products to sell them. She is going to use the profits to continue increasing her output. Her wish is to expand her business and make a variety of items of clothing.

loans.use: to buy an overlocking sewing machine.

loans.name: Al-Fares Group

texts.en:
Fares-Al-Hodeidah is a four women group from Al-Hodeida, Yemen.  They applied for a loan of 60,000 YER from AMB to purchase women's clothing, perfumes, and incense.

The group’s leader, Heleima, is a 31-year-old married woman with three children.  She completed elementary school but did not continue because she got married at a young age.  Her husband's monthly income is not enough to cover all living expenses, especially food and rent.  Therefore, she wants to start a small business to help her husband.  She wants to sell women's clothing, perfumes, and incense door-to-door.  She asked for a loan in the amount of 15,000 YER.  Heleima hopes that this business will make a profit and improve her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy clothing, perfumes, and incense.

loans.name: Al-Rhma Group

texts.en:
Al-Rhma Group is made up of five women who live in the same neighborhood in Sana`a, Yemen. They requested a combined loan of YER 180,000 as financial support with the aim of expanding their businesses. 

Suadh is 38 years old, married, with three children, some of whom attend school. She is a tailor. This business allows her to meet her needs without much difficulty. She obtains her supplies at a market in the city. She requested a loan of YER 40,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to buy sewing items, to expand her business. The extra income generated as a result of this loan will help in easing the payment of school fees.

loans.use: to buy sewing items, to expand her business.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.es: Sra. Lucia tiene 36 años y es casada con 4 hijos que son de las edades de 1, 10, 12 y 17 años,  ella se dedica al comercio de chuño, Quinua, tunta y kaya estos son cereales deshidratados, su tienda se encuentra en la comunidad de Cullucachi de la ciudad de El Alto, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Lucia  va a usar este préstamo de para compra por cargas Quinua, chuño y caya por su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es incremento de capital de trabajo ya que esta época tiene mucha venta, la Sra. Lucia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son la competencia, ella va a utilizar los beneficios es seguir incrementando su mercadería, la Sra. Lucia es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz por la oportunidad que le brindan en la otorgación del crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia is 36 years old, married with four children who are 1, 10, 12, and 17 years old. She works selling freeze dried potatoes, quinoa, and the dehydrated grains known as tunta and kaya. 

Her store is located in the community of Cullucachi in the city of El Alto. This is her second loan from the institution.

Lucia is going to use this loan to buy a load of quinoa, freeze dried potatoes and dehydrated grains for her business. Her reason for asking for this loan is to increase her working capital as this is a season of high sales.

Lucia faces challenges in her business such as competition. She is going to use the loan proceeds to continue buying merchandise.

Lucia is a hardworking person who feels happy for the opportunity given to her by the granting of this loan.

loans.use: to buy quinoa, freeze dried potatoes and dehydrated cereals to sell

loans.name: Irene

texts.es: Sra. Irene tiene 47 años y es casada con 6 hijos que son de las edades de 25, 23, 21,18,13 y 10 años,  ella se dedica a la artesanía ella elabora canastillas de la planta de tocoro,  ella realiza sus trabajos en su mismo domicilio que se encuentra en la comunidad de Palcoco camino Condoriri, es un trabajo muy moroso ya que todo lo realiza manualmente,   este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Irene va a usar este préstamo para la compra de tocoro para la fabricación de canastillas ya que tiene mucha demanda por su negocio,  la Sra. Irene enfrenta retos en su negocio que son generar mejores ingresos y  va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir mejorando su producción.
texts.en: Irene, 47, is married and has six children who are 25, 23, 21, 18, 13 and 10 years of age.  She’s a craftswoman; she makes little sedge baskets at home located in the community of Palcoco on the way to Condoriri.  It’s very painstaking work because it must all be done by hand.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Irene will use the loan to buy sedge to make the little baskets since demand for her crafts is high.  The business challenge Irene faces is generating higher income and she will use profits to continue improving production.

loans.use: to buy crafts-making supplies.

loans.name: Nefi

texts.es: El Sr. Nefi tiene 21 años el se dedica   a la ventra y crianza de ganado vacuno, el tiene su terreno y casa en  la localidad de Vinto Chico de la ciudad de Cochabamba, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, el Sr. Nefi va a usar este préstamo para la compra de material de construcción ya que desea hacer refaccionar los ambientes donde se encuentra su ganado, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de estos materiales, la Sra. Nefi enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de su ganado,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de ganados para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Nefi, 21, works buying and selling cattle.  He has his land and his house in Vinto Chico in the city of Cochabamba.  This loan is his first sequence in the institution and Nefi will use it to buy building materials to repair the corrals he keeps his cattle in.  His reason for requesting this loan is lack of capital to buy said materials.  The business challenge Nefi faces is improving his quality of life and he will use profits to improve the quality of his cattle’s feed.  He wants to have a farm where he can raise large herds of cattle to improve his economic stability.

loans.use: to repair the animal corrals.

loans.name: José Armando

texts.es:
José tiene 33 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy joven él quedo solo con su padre; debido a que su madre murió. Desde entonces, aprendió a trabajar en la agricultura, sembrando maíz y fríjoles. Además, trabajo como cuidador de ganado para una familia y este trabajo aún lo desempeña. Se levanta a las tres de la mañana para ir a ordeñar las vacas, para llegar al lugar donde esta el ganado debe caminar por unos cerros. José es un hombre emprendedor, que además a aprendido el trabajo de albañilería y la elaboración de hamacas. En su hogar ha instalado una granja de pollos de engorde, todos los días él trabaja muy fuerte y su esposa le apoya en el cuido de los pollos y en la elaboración de hamacas.

Para comprar los insumos y el concentrado para sus pollos, lo hace en un lugar que esta a un kilómetro de su casa, llega ahí caminando, pues no hay transporte para ese lugar. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 17 quintales de concentrado para crecer 200 pollos, lamina, madera para ampliar la granja y el resto para comprar insumos para elaborar hamacas. Con la inversión, ampliara su granja, la hará más cómoda y crecerá mejor a los pollos, además rotara cada semana sus pollos, supliendo la demanda de los negocios a los cuales les vende; obteniendo mejores ingresos para su familia. Su sueño, es mejorar su vivienda, ponerle ladrillo al piso ya que es de tierra y construirle dos habitaciones para sus hijos.
texts.en:
José, 33, is married and has three children.  From a young age he was left alone with his father when his mother died.  Since then, he learned how to work in agriculture growing corn and beans.  He also worked taking care of cattle for a family and still works at this job.  He gets up at 3 in the morning to milk the cows and to get to the place where the cattle are he must walk over some hills.  José is an enterprising man who also learned how to work in construction and how to make hammocks.  He has a chicken farm at home and he works hard every day; his wife helps him care for the chicks and to make the hammocks.  In order to buy feed and supplies for his chicks, he must go to a place that’s a kilometer away from his house and he must walk there since there is no transportation available to that place.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 17 quintals of feed concentrate to make 200 chicks grow; he will also buy metal sheeting and lumber to expand the farm and will use the rest to buy supplies to make hammocks.  With this investment, he will expand the farm making it more comfortable and the chicks will grow better.  Also, he’ll be able to rotate the chicks weekly supplying demand from the businesses he sells them to earning higher family income.  His dream is to improve his house, install brick flooring since it’s currently dirt and to build two bedrooms for his children.

loans.use: to buy 17 quintals of chicken feed, building supplies to expand the farm and supplies to make hammocks.

loans.name: Punte Killman - 32 Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PUNTE KILLMAN – 32 está  compuesto por ocho integrantes siete mujeres y un varon,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Martha tiene 40 años con 7 hijos, ella se dedica al servicio del  lavadora de autos que se encuentran en uno de los puentes donde lavan autos de la ciudad de Cochabamba,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra. Martha va a usar este préstamo para compra de instrumento y materiales como valdes aspiradora y tela para el secaco de autos  que le hacen falta para su negocio del lavado de autos,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es compra de material de trabajo al mayor, la Sra. Martha enfrenta retos en su negocio que son competencia ya que hay muchas personas que lavan autos por los puentes y va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y su deseo para  su negocio es tener más puestos  de lavados  de autos, la Sra. Martha se siente feliz y agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse y mantener a su familia.
texts.en: The “Punte Killman-32” communal bank has 8 members; seven women and one man.  The bank president is Martha, 40.  She has seven children and has a car wash business at one of the bridges in the city of Cochabamba where cars are washed.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Martha will use the loan to buy equipment and supplies like buckets, a vacuum cleaner and rags to dry the cars that she needs for her car wash business.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to be able to buy supplies at wholesale.  The business challenge Martha faces is competition because there are many people who wash cars near the bridges and she will use profits to improve her quality of life.  He wish for her business is to have more car wash stands.  Martha feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided by granting the loan since this is the only activity she has that makes it possible for her to support herself and her family.

loans.use: to buy equipment and supplies.

loans.name: Ignacia

texts.es: La Sra. Ignacia tiene 48 años y es casada con 1 hijo que tiene la edad de 8 años,  ella se dedica a la elaboración de riquísimos postres ya sea horneado y también helados, se dedica a esta actividad hace ya bastante tiempo ella vende sus productos en la localidad de El Torno, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, la Sra.  Ignacia va a usar este préstamo para la compra de insumos como harina, polvo de hornear  y esencia para la elaboración de sus postres, la Sra. Ignacia enfrenta retos en su negocio que son salir de la pobreza y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar su calidad de vida y la  de su familia, su deseo es tener una pastelería donde pueda ofrecer sus postres y jugos naturales.
texts.en: Ignacia, 48, is married and has an 8-year-old son.  She works making very delicious desserts; some are baked and some are cold.  She’s been in this activity for some time now and she sells her products in El Torno.  This loan is her first sequence in the institution and Ignacia will use this loan to buy ingredients like flour, baking powder and flavoring agents to make her desserts.  The business challenge Ignacia faces is to rise out of poverty and she’ll use profits to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  Her wish is to own a pastry shop where she can sell her desserts and natural juices.

loans.use: to buy yeast, flour and flavoring agents.

loans.name: Félix

texts.es:
Félix tiene 52 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Sus hijos están estudiando y don Félix se dedica a la agricultura desde los ocho años, su padre fue quien le enseño y desde hace seis años se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos; estos los vende vivos y a veces los destaza (vende la carne). 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar animales para engordarlos y venderlos vivos o destazarlos; la otra parte para preparar el terreno que tiene para sembrar, la cosecha ya la tiene lista; pero no la vende porque el maíz no tiene buen precio. Su deseo es fortalecer su negocio de venta de carne de ganado y cerdos ya que es muy conocido en el lugar en donde vive por su negocio.
texts.en:
Félix, 52, has a spouse and two children.  His children are attending school and Félix has worked in agriculture for the last 8 years.  His father taught him and for the last six years he’s been raising pigs and cattle that he then sells live; he sometimes butchers them and sells the meat.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy animals to fatten up and sell live or butchered.  The other part of it is to prepare the soil he has for planting; he’s already gathered the harvest but hasn't sold it because the price of corn isn't good.  His wish is to strengthen his beef and pork selling business since he’s very well-known where he lives because of his business.

loans.use: to buy animals to fatten up and then sell either live or butchered and also to prepare the soil.

loans.name: Maira Arely

texts.es:
Maira tiene 28 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a su mamá, un hermano y su hija de cuatro años. Tiene dos años de dedicarse a la compra y venta de ganado, quien le enseño este oficio fue su hermano quien lo aprendió de su padre. 

Los animales los compra, en la comunidad y los engorda por un periodo entre dos y seis meses, luego los lleva al tiangue para venderlos que esta ubicado a veinticinco kilómetros de su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres terneras y dos terneros.  Los cuales espera vender más adelante a buen precio; para brindarle mejor salud, vestuario, alimentación a su hija y a su madre.
texts.en:
Maira, 28, is single living with her mother, a brother and her four-year-old daughter.  She’s been working for two years buying and selling cattle.  Her brother taught her this occupation; he learned it from their father.  She buys the animals in the community, fattens them up for a period of two to six months and then takes them to the livestock exchange located 25 kilometers from home to sell them.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three female and two male calves that she hopes to sell later on at a good price to provide better health, clothing and food for her daughter and her mother.

loans.use: to buy three female and two male calves.

loans.name: Marta Orquidea

texts.es:
Marta tiene 21 años de edad, es soltera, vive junto a sus padres y sus tres hermanos.  Hace un año instalo una venta de ropa en un local que alquila, recientemente le ha agregado cortes de cabello, tintes, uñas, etc. servicios de cosmetología. Las compras las realiza en la capital del país, viaja dos veces al mes a 150 kilómetros de distancia. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando  a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una silla para realizar los cortes de cabello, entre otras herramientas y equipo para el servicio de salón de belleza. Su sueño, es ampliar el negocio y aperturar otro más para ser líder en la zona.
texts.en:
21-year old Marta is single and lives with her parents and three siblings. A year ago she started a business selling clothing from rented premises and recently added other services: haircuts, colours, nails, cosmetics etc. She buys the products in the capital city, 150 kilometres   away. She travels there twice a month. 

The loan Marta is seeking from Fundación Campo is to buy a special seat for doing hair cuts as well as other tools and equipment for her beauty salon. Her dream is to expand the business and open another salon and thus become the leading beauty salon in the area.

loans.use: buy a special seat for hair cuts as well as other tools and equipment for her beauty salon

loans.name: Reynalda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Doña Reynelda está casada esposo es comerciante, tienen 3 hijos todos estudian en la universidad por lo tienen que trabajar aun mas para poder cubrir los gastos universitarios de sus hijos ya que los costos son mayores comparados a la escuela secundaria, ella en conjunto con su esposo continúan laborando para su cafetín ubicado en un colegio y la pulpería en su casa negocio que tiene 11 años de apoyarle, solicita el crédito para invertir en su negocio y asi lograr mantenerlo por lo que necesitara comprar granos básicos, lácteos, productos enlatados, carnes huevos y entre otros para tener siempre lo que el cliente busca, todo esto gracias a los financiamientos de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en:
Reynelda is married. Her husband is a businessman. They have three children. All of them are university students so they have to work even more in order to be able to cover the university expenses for the children, which are higher compared to secondary school. 

She, together with her husband, continue working in the cafe located at a school and at the home based grocery store which has supported her for 11 years. She is asking for a loan to invest in her business and to be able to maintain it because she would need to buy basic grains, dairy, canned items, meat, eggs, and others in order to always have what the client is looking for. For all of this she thanks the Kiva and Afodenic backers.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, dairy, canned items, meat, eggs, and other items.

loans.name: Sandra Cristina

texts.es:
Sandra tiene 24 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se encarga de realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a vender fresco, yuca, etc. Y ropa de manera ambulante. Su esposo trabaja en la policía nacional civil del país. Para comprar la ropa y los productos para elaborar las ventas tiene que viajar unos 26 kilómetros hasta llegar a la ciudad. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ropa y yuca, entre otras cosas que necesita para vender. Con el préstamo, ella ampliara su negocio, lo que le permitirá recibir mejores ingresos y satisfacer las necesidades de su familia, como la alimentación, vestuario, educación, etc. Lo que ella desea es que su negocio crezca y construir una casa.
texts.en:
Sandra, 24, lives with a partner and has 2 children.  She is in charge of the housework, and she also has a business selling beverages, manioc, and clothing in the street.  Her husband works in the national police force.  In order to buy clothing and products to make the food that she sells, she has to travel 26 kilometers to the city.

Sandra is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy clothing, manioc, and other items that she needs to make her sales.  With this loan, she will expand her business, and this will allow her to obtain more income and satisfy the needs of her family for food, clothing, education, etc.  

Sandra wants her business to grow, and to build a house.

loans.use: to buy clothing, manioc, and other products to make her sales

loans.name: Vista Verde Group

texts.es:
La Sra. Marìa Herminia tiene 57 años de edad, es soltera. Ella forma parte del grupo de mnombre "Vista verde", el cual está formado por siete socios, los cuales se unieron para poder lograr sus metas planteadas en cuanto al crecimiento de sus negocios.
La Sra. Marìa Herminia, se dedica a la venta de ropa en base a pedidos que le hacen sus familiares, amigos y vecinos, procura con el poco capital que tiene atender a sus clientes para que queden satisfechos con las prendas de vestir que les vende. Ella necesita el crèdito para poder atender pedidos y que al aumentar sus clientes le hace falta invertir un poco mas de capital en su negocio.
Una de sus metas es poder tener un puesto de venta de ropa en un mercado o a lo mejor instalar un bazar en una zona comercial.
texts.en:
Marìa Herminia is a 57-year-old, single woman. She belongs to the group "Vista Verde" (Green View), which is made up of seven members who came together in order to achieve their stated goals of growing their businesses. Marìa Herminia makes a living selling clothing. She fills orders from her relatives, friends, and neighbors. She uses the little capital she has to keep her customers satisfied with the garments they buy through her.

Marìa Herminia needs this loan so that she will be able to fill more orders and increase her client base. She requires more working capital for her business. One of her goals is to have her own clothing shop in a market or, even better, a bazaar in a shopping district.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business.

loans.name: Mujeres Exitosas Group

texts.es: Este es el grupo “Mujeres Exitosas” conformada por 09 socias trabajadoras  que han demostrado durante el tiempo que participan con  el Programa- Prosperidad responsabilidad y solidaridad con sus compañeras. Flora una de las integrantes tiene 57 años y es soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de ropas para bebes. Este negocio le ha permitido apoyar a sus sobrinos con sus estudios ya que se encuentran a su cargo.   Habilitar un espacio donde pueda ofrecer sus productos es su mayor deseo. Su último crédito los destino para la compra de prendas para bebes. Flora se encuentra ubicada en la parte posterior es la primera del lado izquierdo viste polo rosado. El grupo “Mujeres Exitosas” se siente feliz y agradece a Kiva por la ayuda brindada.
texts.en:
This is the "Mujeres Exitosas" (Successful Women) group, made up of nine hardworking women that have demonstrated responsibility and solidarity with their other members during their time together in the Prosperity Program. 

Flora, a member of this group, is a 57-year-old, single woman. She is pictured above in the back row. She is the first woman from the left, wearing a pink polo shirt. Flora makes a living selling baby clothes. The business has allowed her to support the nieces and nephews in her care in their studies. Her biggest dream is to open a shop from which to sell her products. Flora will use her loan to buy baby clothes.

The Successful Women group is very happy and grateful for the help Kiva has offered them.

loans.use: to buy baby clothes

loans.name: Rosa Argentina

texts.es: La señora Rosa casada mujer que se ha esforzado mucho con el apoyo de su marido para que hoy en día sus hijos sean profesionales mayores de edad que no dependen de ella, esto gracias a tantos sacrificios como desvelo, pero así tuvo fuerzas para también continuar como responsable de tan bonita labor social lo cual es apoyar a los niños desamparados, actualmente solicita el crédito para poner el piso de su casa de cerámica por lo que necesitara comprar cemento, cerámica y pagar la mano de obra así ella va paso a paso tratando de mejorar su vivienda para sentirse más cómoda junto con su familia y todo esto es posible gracias al apoyo de Kiva y Afodenic.
texts.en: Rosa is a married woman who has worked very hard, with support of her husband, so that her children could become professionals. Now they are grown and very independent, thanks to her sacrifices to take the best care of them. She also had the strength to continue with her beautiful job in social work serving underprivileged children. Now she is requesting a loan in order to install a ceramic floor for her house. To do this, she needs to buy cement, ceramic tiles, and to pay the wages of the workers who will install it. Rosa is working little by little to improve her house so that her family will be more comfortable, which she says is made possible thanks to the support of Kiva and Afodenic.

loans.use: to buy ceramic tiles, cement, and to pay labor.

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es:
Saturnina tiene 43 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene cuatro hijos. Ella desde que era una niña trabaja realizando los oficios domésticos y actualmente se dedica a la venta de pupusas, licuados, etc. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar insumos para elaborar, pupusas, licuados, tacos, entre otros alimentos más. Con la inversión, ella incrementará la producción de alimentos, por lo tanto sus ingresos se verán incrementados, satisfaciendo la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Saturnina is 43 years old. She has a partner and four children. Since she was a young girl she has handled household chores and currently she works selling stuffed tortillas and smoothies, etc.

She is requesting a loan through Fundación Campo in order to buy supplies to make stuffed tortillas, smoothies, tacos, and other food items. With the investment she can increase the production of food, so her income will be increased, meeting the demand of her customers.

loans.use: to buy supplies to make stuffed tortillas, smoothies, tacos, and other food items.

loans.name: Reyna Isabel

texts.es: Doña Reyna para ayudarse económicamente ha optado por alquilar cuartos y en su casa vende productos básicos como arroz frijoles azúcar, carne y pollo lo cual le van muy bien, sus hijos ya están grandes y trabajan, con la ayuda de su esposo ha salido adelante hoy en día ella solicita apoyo de crédito por cuarta ocasión para seguirle haciendo mejoras a sus cuartos de alquiler a como lo ha vendido haciendo con los prestamos anteriores, en esta ocasión comprara 3 puertas para ponerle a los dormitorios para que sus clientes se sientan seguros en sus habitaciones, los planes futuros de doña Reyna es poner una planta de dos pisos para ofrecer unos apartamentos grandes y cómodos.
texts.en:
Sra. Reyna rents out rooms in order to earn a living. She also sells basics like rice, beans, sugar, meat and chicken from her house. The business is doing well. Her children are now adults and have jobs. With help from her husband, Reyna has made progress.

Now she is seeking a loan for the fourth time to continue making improvements to the rooms she rents out as she has done with the previous loans. This time she plans to buy three doors to put on the bedrooms so that her guests feel safe in their rooms. Reyna’s future plans include adding two more floors so she can offer large and comfortable apartments to her guests.

loans.use: buy three doors

loans.name: Pucacruz  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Pucacruz es un banco comunal que se encuentra constituido por 10 mujeres luchadoras, trabajadoras que se dedican a laborar en diferentes actividades como es la crianza de animales, la agricultura y algunas laboran en  la ciudad, su virtud es la alegría con la que ven la vida y sus ánimos de superación, mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos. Viven por el sector que lleva el mismo nombre del banco comunal que pertenece a la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia ha tenido un crecimiento importante gracias al comercio que crece día a día, su estructura arquitectónica es una mezcla de lo antiguo y lo moderno, cuenta con varios lugares para visitar y disfrutar de la naturaleza.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. María Rosario, está realizando su segundo crédito en este banco comunal.

Doña María Rosario tiene 44 años, es una mujer casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 10 hijos de 25, 22, 19, 15, 14, 11, 9, 7, 4 y 2 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son solteros pero viven independientes, sus dos siguientes hijos estudian, trabajan y le ayudan económicamente, su quinto hijo estudia en el colegio, cuatro están estudiando en la escuela y su ultimo hijo ya está en guardería. Su esposo labora como albañil, la casa en la que viven es  propia.

La Señora María Rosarioi tiene una tienda desde hace 22 años, en la cual trabaja de domingo a domingo sin horario fijo. Cría cerdos, cuyes, borregos y en especial ganado del cual obtiene la leche y con esta realiza quesos. También se dedica a la agricultura y lo que cosecha es solo para el consumo de su hogar. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de víveres para su tienda. 

Sus metas son de agrandar su tienda y mejorar su casa.
texts.en:
“Pucacruz” is a communal bank composed of ten hardworking, tenacious women who work in different activities like raising livestock and agriculture and some work in the city.  Their virtue is the joyous way they perceive life and their desire for self-improvement; they retain the culture and traditions of their peoples.  They live in a sector with the same name as the communal bank that belongs to El Valle Parish in Cuenca.  This parish has grown considerably thanks to commerce that increases daily.  Its style of architecture is a mixture of the old and the modern; it has several places to visit and to enjoy nature in.

One of the group members is María Rosario who is taking out her second loan in this communal bank.  She’s 44-year-old, married and has had ten children who are 25, 22, 19, 15, 14, 11, 9, 7 and 2 years of age.  Her two oldest children are single but live independently, the next two attend school, work and help out economically, her fifth attends secondary school, four are in elementary school and her youngest is in child care.  Her husband works in construction and they own the house they live in.

María Rosario has had a store for the last 22 years where she works Sunday to Sunday with no fixed schedule.  She also raises pigs, guinea pigs and sheep and especially dairy cattle she gets milk from to make cheese.  She also works in agriculture but what she grows is only for home consumption.

She will use the loan to buy food items for her store.  Her goals are to expand the store and make home improvements.

loans.use: to buy foodstuffs.

loans.name: Luis Concepcion

texts.es: Don Luis es un señor de 55 años de edad, casado la esposa trabaja de empleada domestica fuera del país debido al alza de desempleo en la actualidad, el trabaja como guarda de seguridad en una empresa de mariscos tiene 5 hijos todos son mayores de edad y trabajan, el solicita crédito para iniciar la reconstrucción de su casa de concreto ya que esta es de madera muy deteriorada y laminas de zinc para eso necesita comprar cemento, piedrines, bloques, arena, hierro, zinc, perlines para vivir en un techo digno y seguro junto a su familia.
texts.en:
Luis, 55, is a married man.  His wife works abroad as a domestic employee because of the current rise in unemployment.  He works as a security guard for a shellfish company.  He has five children, all adults who work.

He's requesting the loan to begin rebuilding his house of concrete because it's made of very deteriorated wood and corrugated sheet metal.  He needs to buy cement, gravel, cinder blocks, sand, rebar, corrugated sheet metal, and wooden beams so he and his family can live in a decent and safe house.

loans.use: to buy cement, gravel, cinder blocks, sand, rebar, corrugated sheet metal, and wooden beams

loans.name: Davaajav

texts.en:
Mr. Davaajav, 49, lives with his wife and son in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides on a plot of land in their own house which was built with loan funds. Mr. Davaajav's wife has been sewing deel (Mongolian traditional costume) at home for fourteen years. His second son lives on his own, and his youngest son now studies at university. Mr. Davaajav himself has been running a transportation business using his own truck since 2008. 

He is requesting a loan of 3,000,000 MNT to increase his wife’s business capital by purchasing cotton, silk, and other textiles. During the Mongolian traditional holiday known as White Moon, demand for Mongolian traditional costume is high; thus, it is a golden opportunity for making money. As a result, the family can generate more income for their children’s education. Mr. Davaajav and his wife value their children’s education highly; they are invested in their elder son’s education while he studies in China.

loans.use: to purchase cotton, silk, and other textiles.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to continue to improve and expand her retail business by purchasing additional inventory (foods, soft drinks, etc.)

loans.name: Al-Hanan Group

texts.en:
Al-Hanan group consists of four women from AL-Hodeida , Yemen. They asked for a loan of YER 170,000 to purchase a barbecue machine for chicken.

Aisha, 54 years old, is the leader of the group. She is illiterate.  Aisha has been selling sweets in front of her house for more than 15 years. Now she has a cafeteria in a deaf-and-mute school. She sells sandwiches, sweets and soft drinks. She likes this business because she thinks it offers humanitarian assistance for these students.  

Aisha doesn’t have enough money to buy products for her business, therefore she asked for a loan in the amount of YER 50,000 to buy products such as sandwiches, sweets and soft drinks.   Aisha hopes that this would attract more clients and help her to earn more money.

loans.use: to buy products such as sandwiches, sweets and soft drinks.

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John is a 57-year-old man with four children all attending school and living in Kamwenge, Uganda. He is a parish chief, and at the same time has a live-stock and banana plantation. 

His main hardship is the low pay however he is inspired to to work with the communities and institutions due to his love for development. John intends to use the loan to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to pay school fees for his children.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Gabriel

texts.en: Gabriel is a 26-year-old man living in Kamwenge, Uganda.  He operates a retail shop and also supplies produce for an additional income. He has a vision of improving his standard of living and own a wholesale shop in his community despite the hardships of poor roads and high transportation costs. Gabriel is requesting for a loan to buy soda and sugar to sell.

loans.use: buy soda and sugar to sell

loans.name: Tungalag

texts.en:
Mrs. Tungalag, 61 years old, lives with her three sons and one grandson in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. Six years ago, she retired from work and just one year later began her house rental business. The house she rents out has three separate rooms and every room is rented by one household. She has a plan of expanding her house by adding one more room and this one room will generate income just like other three rooms. Now whole family resides at her elder son’s apartment. 

She is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. The automobile will be used by her elder son for transportation and taxi service.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas for her son to use as a taxi

loans.name: Samdankhorol

texts.en: Mr. Samdankhorol, 47 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. His wife teaches at a kindergarten and he himself has been providing taxi services since 2008. He has accumulated a vast amount of experience in taxi service in the past five years. His three sons all study at university. He is requesting a loan of 4000000 MNT to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas. The automobile will be used by his eldest son for transportation and taxi service purposes. The borrower thinks that way his son can be independent and fend for himself. Also the borrower is a very hardworking individual who cares deeply about his sons’ education.

loans.use: to purchase an automobile which runs on natural gas

loans.name: Otgonbaatar

texts.en:
Mr. Otgonbaatar, 39 years old, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been running a second-hand clothing sales business since 2006. His wife helps in her husband’s business. With every passing day the family’s living standard is improving, due to their hard work and determination. Their 10-, 9-, and 7-year-old children study at school.

Otgonbaatar is requesting a loan of 3,600,000 MNT to purchase a large quantity of second-hand clothes. As a result of this purchase, he will be able to run his business without worrying about inventory shortage. The borrower is a very hard-working individual who strives for a better life.

loans.use: To purchase a large quantity of second-hand clothes.

loans.name: Al-Wafa'a Group

texts.en:
Al-Wafa'a is a group of four women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. They have requested a 240.000 YER loan from AMB to purchase clothing, perfume and incense to resell.

Khadija, 29 years-old, is a single woman and the leader of the group. She is a secondary school graduate. She has been selling women's clothes, perfume and incense for about 7 years. She started up her business when her father supported her with part of his monthly salary. This allowed her to buy a small amount of clothing and perfume. Although she is still young, Khadija is very ambitious. She wants to buy more products and target new clients, so she has applied for a loan in the amount of 60.000YER . Khadija looks forward to improving her living conditions and open a saving account in the AMB.

loans.use: to pay for clothing, perfume and incense

loans.name: Pc 1 Dayamber Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le 26/12/2011 est composé de femmes issus du même village ,partageant de bonnes relations sociales et unies par de liens culturel. 
Fatim est  est choisie comme emprunteur en vedette de ce groupe. Elle est mariée, âgée de 50 ans et mère de trois garçons. Elle debout a l’extrême gauche de la photo habillé  en grand boubou jaune et bleu.
Fatim s'active dans le commerce de produits divers elle dispose d'une bonne expérience professionnelle . 
Avec son nouveau crédit de 50000 francs cfa elle va acheter du riz du sucre et du lait qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son village.
Les bénéfices générés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaire et scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group, created on December 26, 2011, consists of women who come from the same village.  They share good social relationships and are united by cultural ties.

Fatim is the group's featured borrower.  She is 50 years old, married, and the mother of three boys.  In the photo she is standing on the left-hand side, wearing a large yellow and blue boubou.

She is actively involved in the sale of various goods and is an experienced seller.

Her new loan of 50,000 CFA francs will help her to buy rice, sugar and milk, which she will sell for retail in her village.

With the profits from her business, she is able to take care of her children's nutritional and educational needs.

loans.use: to buy various products such as rice, oil, milk and sugar.

loans.name: Voern's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural area of the Moung Russey district in Cambodia’s Battambang province, Voern is a 57-year-old, married father of five children.  Three of his children are dependent, two are still in school while the remaining one is too young for school.  To support the family, Voern and his wife have been involved in rice farming and sesame planting for ten years. He earns about 22,000 KHR each day and saves approximately 15,000 KHR after paying his daily expenses. 

Voern, a third-time borrower, is leading a group of five.  He completely paid back the previous loans, and it has enabled him to better support his family as well as his current business.  Now he is leading his group to ask for a loan.  As the leader, he is going to use his portion to buy fertilizer for his cultivated land.  He hopes to increase his crop yield so he can sell it for a good price in order to improve his standard of living and keep his children in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for his cultivated land.

loans.name: Joseph

texts.en:
Joseph is a 53-year-old, divorced man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda.

He operates a spare parts' retail business. With the proceeds of his sales he has been able to buy land and to pay his children's school fees.

Even so, he hopes to expand his business, yet he has insufficient capital to do so. As a result, Joseph is seeking this loan to buy motorcycle spare parts to re-sell for profits.

loans.use: to expand and improve his business by purchasing motorcycle spare parts for re-sale purposes.

loans.name: Khouch's Group

texts.en:
Khouch, 39 years old, is a villager in the Prey Chhor district in Cambodia’s Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of two children, both of whom are dependent on her and are still in school.

To support her family, Khouch farms rice, while her husband works a construction worker in the local area to earn additional income for the family. Having been in their businesses for 15 years, she and her husband are able to earn approximately 35,000 KHR per day from their current businesses to meet their family’s needs.

Khouch has been with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for two loan cycles. Notably, she successfully repaid the prior loans, which enabled her to buy construction materials for her husband’s business and to support her children’s education.

Now she is leading her group of four to ask for another loan. Khouch, who is the group's leader, will use her portion of the requested loan to buy fertilizer and rice seeds for her farmland. She hopes that her crop yield will be substantial this year and will be sold for a good price, which would enable her to improve her family’s living conditions and to keep her children in school.

loans.use: To expand and improve her farming business by purchasing fertilizer and rice seeds

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Pen's Group

texts.en:
Pen is a 47-year-old married mother who lives in a rural village in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district. She earns a living by running a small business at home as a shoemaker. She has been in this business for more than 10 years and earns around 40,000 KHR per day to meet her family’s needs. Pen has five children, one of whom is dependent on her and still in school. Lack of working capital to support her business is her main challenge.

Pen’s group consists of two female members who have been with VisionFund for four cycles. She has successfully paid back the past loans which have helped her relieve her family’s burden and improved her living condition. Now she is leading her group in asking for a loan. Pen, who is the leader, will use her portion to buy material for producing shoes such as plastic and thread etc. She hopes that this loan will enable her to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy material for producing shoes such as plastic and thread

loans.name: Ren

texts.en:
Ren, 47 years old, lives in Cambodia, in a rural village of Battambang province’s Bavel district. She is married and is the mother of five children.

She and her husband have been farming rice on four-hectares of farmland for the last 14 years to support their family. Each day, they are able to earn approximately 40,000 KHR through their hard work.

This will be Ren’s fifth request for a loan from Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. The prior loans have enabled her to expand her farming business. Now she is applying for another loan, which would be used to harvest rice and to buy pesticides for her farmland. She hopes to harvest her rice timely and fruitfully so as to provide better living conditions for her family.

loans.use: To further expand her farming business by harvesting rice and purchasing pesticides

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Living in a rural village of the Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Kunthea is 39 years old and married with four children, three of whom are dependent on her and still in school. She sells fish while her husband works for others for a fee. Together, they have been engaging in business for ten years. Kunthea is able to earn about 68,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 30,000 KHR each day after daily expenses.
 
This is the sixth loan for Kunthea with VisionFund. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family and provide enough food. Now she is requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR to buy a proper food cabinet for her family's use. She hopes this loan will enable her to keep enough household supplies for her family to use.

loans.use: to buy a proper food cabinet for her family's use

loans.name: Fatima

texts.en: Ms Fatima is a 44-year-old married woman. According to Fatima, she faced many problems during her early married life. Her husband is a laborer. He was not able to cover the expenses for his family. Fatima took the initiative to start her business by taking a loan from Kashf foundation six years ago. Now, she is very satisfied and has requested a repeat loan of 30000 PKR to buy spools of thread as well as packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material. Her embroidery patterns are very popular in her street, so she intends to use the profits for her children’s well-being and education. Fatima shared her dream of running a training center for girls from her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so they can help her expand her business, and to also earn money for themselves. Fatima is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her valuable work.

loans.use: to buy spools of thread as well as packs of sequins, pearls and glittering material.

loans.name: Al-Thqa Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Thqa and is made up of four men, who belong to the same savings group. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. This group is requesting financial assistance from Kiva partner AMB in order to raise their level of activity. They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER. Khldon is the group's representative. He is a 32-year-old married man and has two children. He lives in a rented house. He is employed in a market, working hard for 12 hours each day to improve his living conditions. He is requesting a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances. He hopes to own a house and run a clothing store.

loans.use: to buy home appliances.

loans.name: Saba

texts.en:
Ms Saba is a 21-year-old, unmarried lady. She explains that her father’s income is insufficient to meet the family's living expenses. In other words, she knows that her father cannot provide for the family on his salary alone.

As a result, Saba works hard to contribute to the family income. Specifically, she started her boutique clothing business nine months ago. She has become famous on her street for providing stylish clothes.

In order to satisfy customer demand, she needs to purchase bundles of clothes, spools of threads, packs of buttons, and laces in various colors. For such goods, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan in the amount of 25,000 PKR. With the loan proceeds, she expects to be better able to cater to her customers' wants and needs over time. She aspires to save money to expand her business in the near future.

loans.use: to satisfy customer demand and to expand her business by purchasing various clothing materials (e.g., bundles of clothes, spools of threads, packs of buttons, and laces in various colors).

loans.name: Geram Group

texts.en:
Geram group consists of five women from Al-Hodeida, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the total amount of 100,000 YER from AMB to purchase women's clothing, perfumes, incense, and vegetables.

Zahra, 25 years old, is a married woman with four children. She is illiterate and lives with her husband and their children in a small house. Her husband works very hard to provide his family with everything they need, but what he earns is really not enough (rather, it is just enough for their house's rent). Therefore, one year ago, Zahra decided to work and to help her hardworking husband. Specifically, she is a door-to-door clothes and cosmetics' seller.

To date, she has earned good profits, and she now wants to expand her business and to start selling vegetables in the street, which would enable her to earn more money. As a result, she applied for a loan in the amount of 20,000 YER for her business. Zahra is very ambitious and loves her family very much. Going forward, she wants to educate her children and to improve their living standards.

loans.use: to expand their businesses by purchasing women's clothing, perfumes, incense, and vegetables for re-sale purposes

loans.name: Awa's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois est composé de femmes issues du même village et unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Fatou est la responsable, elle est âgée de 39 ans mariée et mère de 3 enfants dont 2 filles et un garçon.
Elle s'active dans le commerce depuis longtemps et dispose d'une bonne expérience . 
Avec son nouveau crédit de 90000 francs cfa elle va se payer des paires de chaussures du lait de toilette et du parfum qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son village.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettent de prendre en charge d'une part les frais de scolarité de ses enfants et d'autres part les besoins alimentaires de sa famille.
texts.en:
This group, formed during the first loan cycle of the local village loan group, comprises women who come from the same town and are united by good social and professional relationships.
Fatou is the group leader; she is 39 years old, married, and has three children - two daughtes and one son.
She has been involved in commerce for a long time, and has good experience in the field.
With her new loan of 90,000 FCFA, she is going to buy pairs of shoes, lotion, and perfume, which she is going to sell at retail in her town.
The profits realized from her business allow her to take care of her children's school fees and also provide for her family's nutritional needs.

loans.use: To buy cosmetics and shoes for resale.

loans.name: Soda's Group

texts.fr:
Ce  groupe composé de 21 femmes a été crée depuis le cycle un du banc villageois. Il regroupe des femmes du même village unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles. 
Leur responsable Sob est âgée de 50,mariée et mère de 5 enfants .
Elle est debout à l’extrême droite de la photo habillée en vert blanc. Sob s'active dans le commerce par la vente de tissus divers. Son nouveau crédit de 80000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer de tissus Khartoum wax qu'elle va revendre au  détail au niveau de son village.
Les bénéfices réalisés par son activité lui permettront de de prendre en charge les besoins financiers alimentaires et scolaires de ses enfants .
texts.en:
This group, comprising 21 women, was formed during the loan cycle of a local village loan fund. It consists of women from the same town who are united by good social and professional relationships.
Their leader, Sob, is 50 years old, married, and has five children.
She is dressed in white and green, standing all the way on the right in the photo. Sob runs a business selling various fabrics. Her new loan of 80,000 FCFA will allow her to buy "Khartoum wax" fabric, which she is going to sell at retail in her town.
The profits earned through her business will allow her to take care of her children's financial, nutritional, and educational needs.

loans.use: To buy fabric to resell.

loans.name: Pc 1 Kounoune Ngalap Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe composé de 42 femmes a été depuis le 26 décembre 2011. Les membres qui le composent sont unis par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Astou est leur responsable, elle est âgée de 34 mariée et a un enfant qui lui est confié.
Elle est accroupi a gauche de la photo la main levée habillée en gris couvert d'un écharpe gris.
Astou fait de l'embauche ovine depuis bientôt 10 ans et dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 
Son nouveau crédit de 90000 franc cfa lui permettra de se payer deux moutons qu'elle va élever et revendre plus tard. 
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent d'aider son marie dans la prise en charge alimentaire de sa petite famille mais également de renforcer ses épargnes au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group, comprising 42 women, was created on 26 December 2011. The group members are united by good social and professional relationships.
Astou is their leader; she is 34 years old, married, and has one child in her care.
She is crouched on the left in the photo, dressed in grey with a grey scarf, and has her hand raised.
Astou has raised sheep for almost ten years, and has gained good experience in this field.
Her new loan of 90,000 FCFA will allow her to buy two sheep, which she is going to raise and re-sell later.
The profits earned will allow her to help her husband in taking care of the nutritional needs of her small family and also to strengthen her savings at the level of the local village loan fund.

loans.use: To buy sheep to raise.

loans.name: Al-Safara Al-Handia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Safara Al-handia. It consists of five members. All of them are friends and from Sana`a, Yemen. They are hard-working and professional in their business.  The members took a loan of YER 250,000. 

Lutf is the leader of this group. He is a 32-year-old married man who lives Sana'a, Yemen. He is an employer in the embassy of India located in Sana`a. He enjoys working and serving the needs of his family. He applied for a loan of YER 50,000 YER from AMB to buy a fridge to use in his house. He hopes to run a business store to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: buy a refridgerator for home use

loans.name: Carlos Ariel

texts.es:
Carlos tiene 25 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene un hijo. Él tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la albañilería, anteriormente realizaba trabajos agrícolas. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar materiales para la Construcción de una habitación y el corredor de su casa; como es albañil no pagara la mano de obra. Con la inversión, ampliara su vivienda y le dará más seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Carlos is 25 and has a partner and 10-year-old son. He used to farm, but he now is a bricklayer. He will use the loan he is applying for through Fundación Campo to buy materials to build a room and hallway for his house. Since he is a bricklayer, he will not pay for labor. The investment will expand his house and make his family safer.

loans.use: to buy materials to build a room and hallway for his house.

loans.name: José Mauricio

texts.es:
José tiene 27 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene dos hijos. Él tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la crianza de ganado de engorde para repasto. Aprendió con su padre, cuando era muy joven; debido a que por sus escasos recursos económicos no pudo estudiar ya que el trabajo era la única fuente de ingresos para subsistir. 

Para comprar el ganado, él tiene que caminar dos kilómetros a pie sobre las faldas de un cerro, donde vive para luego abordar un camión de los que llevan gente al tiangue, el viaje dura una hora de ida y otra de vuelta. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres novillos de engorde en repasto; para luego venderlos y así estar negociando. Con la inversión, estará vendiendo más seguido los animales y sus ingresos serán mejores, para comprar el alimento para su familia. Su deseo, es ahorrar para construir su casa de ladrillo, debido a que vive en una casa de bahareque con lodo.
texts.en:
José is 27 and has a life partner and 10-year-old son. He raises grazing livestock, a trade he learned as at early age from his father. He was not able to get an education due to lack of funds, since work was the only income source he had to support himself. 

To buy livestock he must walk two kilometers to the foot of a hill near his home and then take a bus to the market, a two-hour round trip. The loan he is requesting from Fundación Campo will be used to buy three grazing steers to fatten and sell; he is now negotiating. He expects to sell more animals and increase his income to feed his family with this investment. He wants to save to build a brick house, as the one they live in is made of mud and straw.

loans.use: to buy three grazing steers to fatten.

loans.name: Rosa Amelia

texts.es: Doña Rosa una mujer trabajadora comerciante que tiene su propio cafetín en un mercado, se esfuerza a diario para poderse ganar el pan de cada día al lado de su esposo que trabaja como cadete de taxi, ella ha utilizado sus créditos para invertir en su pequeño negocio que poco a poco ha sacado adelante y en esta ocasión desea mejorar el entechado de su cocina ya que se le mete el agua cuando llueve, ella se quiere preparar antes que llegue el invierno lo cual no falta mucho por lo que necesita comprar laminas de zinc y cuartones de madera ya que su presupuesto no le da para comprar perlines, en sus planes futuros espera construir el porche de la casa para que su esposo pueda meter el taxi ya que ellos pagan a diario por parqueo en las noches y les sale muy caro.
texts.en: Rosa’s a hardworking merchant; she has her own snack bar in a market.  She strives daily to earn her daily bread as does her husband who is a taxi driver.  She’s used loans to invest in her small business and gradually move it forward and this time she wants to improve her kitchen’s roof because when it rains water leaks in.  She wants to get ready before winter arrives which will be shortly which is why she needs to buy metal sheeting and wood beams since her budget is insufficient to buy roofing purlins.  Her future plan includes building a porch at home so that her husband can store the taxi since they currently have to pay parking fees for it every night and this is very expensive.

loans.use: to buy metal sheeting and wood beams for roofing.

loans.name: Sara Dolores

texts.es:
Sara tiene 40 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de comida; en la mañana vende desayunos como frijoles, huevos, plátanos, lácteos, en el almuerzo vende pollo guisado, pollo frito, carne asada, pescado, rellenos, entre otros platillos y por la tarde vende cenas típicas. Su venta esta ubicada en un lugar estratégico en el centro de la ciudad, su mamá fue quien le enseño este oficio y es quien le ayuda en el negocio desde hace más de 15 años. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos quintales de arroz, dos quintales de frijoles, dos quintales de azúcar, 50 libras de pollo, 50 libras de carne, $100 dólares de verduras como lo son: güisquil, papas, repollo, tomates, cebollas, chiles, etc. Y mobiliario para su comedor, debido a que el que posee esta deteriorado. Con la inversión, tendrá más variedad de comida a la vista, y con los ingresos que reciba ahorrar para comprar un terreno para construir su casa y para instalar ahí su negocio ya que en la actualidad vive de alquilado.
texts.en:
Sara is 40, single, and has two children. She prepares and sells food. In the morning, she sells breakfast: beans, eggs, plantains, and milk products. For lunch, she offers stews, fried chicken, seafood, stuffed chiles, and other dishes. In the afternoon, she prepares traditional dinners. Her business is strategically located in the city. Her mother taught her the profession and has helped her run the business for more than 15 years. 

She is applying for a loan to Fundación Campo to buy 200 lbs. of rice, 200 lbs. of beans, 200 lbs. of sugar, 50 lbs of chicken, 50 lbs. of beef, and $100 of vegetables (chayote, potato, cabbage, tomato, onion, and chile) and to replace her old dining room furniture. The investment means she can offer more variety on her buffet. She will save her earnings to buy land where she will build a house and set up her business; now she is renting.

loans.use: to buy 200 lbs. of rice, 200 lbs. of beans, 200 lbs. of sugar, 50 lbs of chicken, 50 lbs. of beef, and $100 of vegetables (chayote, potato, cabbage, tomato, onion, and chile) and to replace her old dining room furniture.

loans.name: Evelyn Arely

texts.es:
Evelyn tiene 20 años de edad, esta acompañada. Ella se dedica a la venta de celulares, accesorios para teléfonos como son estuches, cargadores, protectores, también vende recargas de las diferentes compañías telefónicas, ya tiene un año de poseer este negocio; lo aprendió de sus padres pues ellos tienen un negocio similar. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 20 celulares de diferentes marcas, 5 docenas de cargadores para diferentes celulares, 5 docenas de protectores, 5 docenas de estuches, entre otros más.  Con la inversión, aumentara su inventario, tendrá disponibles más diversidad de modelos, debido a que hay clientes que buscan modelos exclusivos y por falta de dinero no los puede adquirir. Al disponer de más productos, venderá más y sus ingresos serán mejores, con los que espera abrir una nueva sucursal en otro lugar.
texts.en:
Evelyn is twenty years old and has a partner.  She makes a living selling mobile phones, phone accessories like cases, chargers, and screen protectors.  She also sells calling cards for different wireless companies.  She has been doing this for over a year and learned from her parents because they have a similar business.

The loan she is seeking from Fundación Campo is to purchase twenty mobile phones of different brands, five dozen chargers, five dozen screen protectors, five dozen cases, and other items.  With this investment she will be able to increase her inventory and will have a wider variety of products available to her customers.  At the moment, her customers want exclusive models but she does not have the money to fulfill their needs.  Once she can display more products, she will sell more and her revenue will increase.  With this extra revenue she hopes to open a new location.

loans.use: to purchase twenty mobile phones of different brands, five dozen chargers, five dozen screen protectors, five dozen cases, and other items.

loans.name: Josefa Antonia

texts.es:
Josefa tiene 28 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Ella se dedica a administrar su negocio de transporte colectivo de pasajeros en conjunto con su esposo. Este negocio lo aprendieron de unos familiares que son empresarios. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una camionada de arena, 500 ladrillos, 10 bolsas de cemento, 3 quintales de hierro, una camionada de piedra y para pago de mano de obra para construir una cocina. De esta manera, estará segura, debido a que en la temporada lluviosa se moja la cocina y debe esperar a que pare la lluvia para cocinar, ya que esta construida de bahareque y lamina. Entre sus metas esta seguir con el mejoramiento de su vivienda, construyéndole dos habitaciones para sus hijos y brindarles la educación.
texts.en:
Josefa, 28, is married and has two children.  She works managing her collective passenger transportation firm with her husband.  They learned this business from some relatives who are businessmen.  

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a truckload of sand, 500 bricks, ten sacks of cement, 3 quintals of iron rods, a truckload of gravel and to pay labor costs to build a kitchen.  In this way, she’ll be secure because during the rainy season her kitchen gets wet and she has to wait until it stops raining in order to cook because it’s currently built of reeds, daub and metal sheeting.  Among her goals is to continue making home improvement, to build two bedrooms for her children and to provide them with schooling.

loans.use: to buy building supplies and pay labor costs.

loans.name: Reina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Reina tiene 39 años de edad, es soltera. Ella se dedica a vender tamales de elote, yuca, enchiladas, pasteles, refrescos, entre otros antojitos desde hace unos 10 años. Esta actividad la aprendió de sus padres que también desempeñaban este oficio; su padre es caficultor y su madre comerciante en pequeño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres camionadas de arena, tres camionadas de piedra, 5 quintales de hierro, 50 bolsas de cemento, 4 puertas, 4 ventanas y pago de mano de obra para construir su vivienda. Con la inversión, construirá su casa de ladrillo, debido a que la que posee es de adobe, poco a poco piensa seguir mejorándola e instalar los servicios básicos como agua potable, aguas negras y energía eléctrica.
texts.en:
Reina, 39, is single.  She’s worked selling corn tamales, manioc, enchiladas, cakes and soft-drinks, among other fast-food snacks for about 10 years.  She learned this activity from her parents who were also in this occupation.  Her father is a coffee grower and her mother is a small retailer.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy three truckloads of sand, three truckloads of gravel, 5 quintals of iron rods, 50 sacks of cement, 4 doors, 4 windows and to pay labor costs to build her house.  With this investment, she’ll build a brick house because her current one is adobe.  She plans to gradually improve it and install basic utilities like potable water, sewage disposal and electricity.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Abigail

texts.es:
Abigail tiene 23 años de edad, es soltera. Se dedica a la venta de productos de la canasta básica, como: maíz, fríjol, aceite, huevos, refrescos y por la tarde vende atole. También, vende productos por catálogos como lociones, cremas, productos de belleza. Esta actividad la aprendió de unos familiares que son comerciantes ya tiene unos cinco años de dedicarse a eso.  

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 10 quintales de maíz, 10 quintales de azúcar, 10 quintales de arroz, 10 quintales de fríjol, 5 cajas de aceite, 10 cartones de huevo, 10 fardos de productos comestibles. Su inventario será mayor, por lo que tendrá más mercadería disponible para ofrecer a sus clientes y sus ingresos serán también mayores. Con esos ingresos espera instalar una mini cafetería y empezara a construir su casa y también continuara con sus estudios universitarios.
texts.en:
Abigail, 23, is single.  She works selling basic staples like corn, beans, oil, eggs and soft-drinks and in the evenings she sells ‘atole’ [cornmeal-based hot beverage].  She also sells products like lotions, creams and beauty products via catalog.  She learned this activity from some family members who are merchants and she’s been doing this for about five years.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy 10 quintals of corn, 10 quintals of sugar, 10 quintals of rice, 10 quintals of beans, 5 cases of oil, 10 flats of eggs and 10 bundles of foodstuffs.  Her inventory will be larger and she’ll have more products to offer her customers so her income will also be higher.  She hopes to use income to open a snack bar and to start building her house; she will also continue with her university studies.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: Magda De Los Angeles

texts.es: Magda tiene 43 años de edad es casada su esposo trabaja en una empresa de mariscos con, sus ingresos apoya en los gastos del hogar continúan con el negocio de compra y venta de cerdos destazados, sus créditos los utiliza para el negocio y ahora quiere comprar 18 cerdos, esto para cubrir encargos de sus clientes, este negocio le ha ayudado a salir adelante con su familia mejorando sus condiciones de vida, ella espera siempre el apoyo de financiamiento para no dejar caer el negocio y seguir siempre adelante.
texts.en:
Magda is a 43-year-old married woman. Her husband works for a seafood company, and with his earnings supports the household and continues to buy and sell pigs for butchering. They have used loans for their business and now they would like to buy 18 pigs, which their customers have requested of them.

This business has helped them improve the living conditions for their family, and she hopes to always have enough financial support in order to not allow the business fall apart and always continue forward.

loans.use: to buy 18 pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Segundo Martin

texts.es: El señor Segundo Martin, es habitante del municipio de Masaya, junto a su familia trabaja mucho ya que el desea superarse en la vida, labora como Analista en una Institucion, actualmente quiere realizar algunas mejoras en su casa ya que esta presenta ciertas deteriorizaciones, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara Materiales de Construccion como: Arena, Cemento, Bloques, Hierro. Agradece la confianza y el apoyo que Afodenic y fondos Kiva le han brindado.
texts.en:
Segundo Martín lives in the town of Masaya with his family.  He works a lot because he wants to improve himself in life.  He works as an analyst in an institution.

Currently he wants to make some improvements on his house because there's some deterioration.  With this new loan he'll buy construction materials such as sand, cement, cinder blocks, and rebar.

He's grateful for the trust and support that AFODENIC and Kiva Funds have placed in him.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Felix Ruben

texts.es: El señor Félix Rubén, Habita en la comarca San Antonio Sur, junto a su esposa e hijos , Gracias al apoyo que Afodenic en conjunto a Fondos Kiva  le han brindado a podido cumplir uno de sus sueños, tener su casa Propia, el labora para una Institución y su dificultad es que no puede completar de una sola vez el dinero para comprar los Materiales que utilizara, con este nuevo financiamiento comprara: Cemento, Arena, Hierro, Bloques para terminar de hacer las paredes de su casa.
texts.en:
Félix Rubén lives in the San Antonio Sur region with his wife and children.  Thanks to the support that AFODENIC and Kiva Funds have given him he has been able to achieve one of his dreams, to have his own house.  He works for an institution and his problem is that he can't get all the money together to buy the materials he'll use.

With this new loan he'll buy cement, sand, rebar, and cinder blocks to finish making the walls of his house.

loans.use: to buy construction materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sell citrus and ornamental plants

loans.name: Jose De Los Angeles

texts.es: El señor Jose habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, junto a su esposa e hijos, el trabaja como carpintero y albañil, su esposa es comerciante el quiere superarse en la vida y darle un buen futuro a sus hijos. con este nuevo credito comprara materiales de construccion como: Cemento, Bloques, Arena, Hierro etc. para asi cumplir con uno de sus sueños terminar su casa, Agradece el Apoyo que Afodenic le ha brindado en conjunto a Fondos Kiva
texts.en: Jose lives with his wife in Ticuantepe along.  He works as a carpenter and mason; his wife is a merchant and he wants to succeed in life and provide a good future from his children.  He will use the money from this new loan to buy building materials such as cement, cinder blocks, sand, iron bars, etc. so that he can achieve his greatest dream to finish building his home.  He is grateful for the support that Afodenic and Kiva have provided.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Francis Verónica

texts.es: La señora Francis habita en el municipio de Ticuantepe, su esposo es Taxista desde hace varios años, sus hijos estan pequeños todavia asisten al colegio, ellos sueñas con tener su casa bien acondicionada y mejorar de vida, su dificultad es que no pueden recaudar de una sola vez el dinero para ir realizando las remodelaciones necesarias, con este nuevo credito que Afodenic y Fondos Kiva le han otrogado podra comprar los materiales necesarios para continuar con sus sueños.
texts.en: Francis lives in Ticuantepe.  Her husband has been a taxi driver for several years and her children are still small and attend school.  They want to have a well-built home of their own and a better quality of life.  Her challenge is not being able to round up all the money to do the necessary remodeling to her home all at once.  She will use the money from this loan through Afodenic and Kiva to buy the necessary supplies to make continue working toward her dreams.

loans.use: to buy building materials.

loans.name: Erika Viviana

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal 9 De Julio se reúne cada quince días en Cantón Montecristi, conocido por su rica cultura pre colonial y por su artesanía que es reconocida a nivel nacional e internacional. Lugar de los famosos sombreros de paja toquilla.

En este lugar vive la señora Erika, tiene 20 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de un año de edad. Su esposo trabaja en una fábrica en Manta.

Ella es una muy buena madre y esposa que se dedica al comercio, vende zapatos por catálogos y productos de Esika, Lebel, y Sayson (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta para lo cual sale a recorrer la ciudad tres días de la semana, ella enseña su revista y realiza los pedidos los mismos que luego entrega a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva 2 años en este negocio y  le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar zapatos, cremas, perfumes y otros cosméticos. Este es su segundo ciclo en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su hijo.
texts.en:
The “9 De Julio” communal bank meets every two weeks in Montecristi, known for its rich pre-colonial culture and arts, known nationally and internationally.  This is the place of the famous straw hats.

Erika lives here.  She is 20 years old, is in a common law marriage, and has a one year old son.  Her husband works at a factory in Manta.

She is a good mother and wife who sells shoes via catalog.  She also sells Esika, Lebe, and Sayson brand products (perfumes, creams, costume jewelry, and other things) door to door.  She travels around the city three days a week, shows her catalogs, takes orders, and then delivers on credit and collects each week.  She’s been doing this for two years and things are going very well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy shoes, creams, perfumes, and other cosmetics.  This is her second cycle in the communal bank.  She likes it because of the quick loans with few requirements.

Her dream is to give a better life to her son

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: La Florida  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal La Florida está constituido por 5 socias y 1 socio quienes viven por el sector de la ciudadela la Católica en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su arquitectura colonial resalta en toda la ciudad, esta bañada por 4 ríos, su gastronomía cautiva el paladar de todos quienes la visitan. Su gente es de un corazón cálido al igual que todas las socias de este grupo quienes son mujeres trabajadoras, luchadoras que con su trabajo diario mejoran la estabilidad económica  de sus hogares y sacan adelante a sus familias.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Ruth, es una socia de un gran carisma, alegre y gentil que forma parte del banco comunal La Florida desde hace 2 años, le gusta el banco comunal por el compañerismo y la unión del grupo, vive por el centro de la ciudad de Cuenca.
 
La Señora. Ruth tiene 48 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 27 y 26 años que trabajan y le ayudan economícamente. Su esposo labora como empleado privado, la casa en la que viven es de propia.
 
Doña Ruth trabaja de lunes a sábados desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 7 de la noche en un salón de comida que es un negocio en sociedad con su hermana, en sus tiempos libres se dedica a cuidar de su nieta. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en su negocio ya que va a comprar mesas, sillas y víveres.

Su meta es agrandar mucho más su negocio.
texts.en:
The “La Florida” communal bank is made up of five ladies and one gentleman who live in the “la Católica” area of the city of Cuenca.  This city has been a World Heritage site since December of 1999.  Its colonial architecture is all over the city and it’s bathed by four rivers.  Its food captures the pallet of all who visit.  Its people have warm hearts and all the members of this group are hardworking people who improve the economic stability of their homes and move their families ahead.

Ruth is one of the group’s members and has great charisma, happiness, and gentility.  She’s been a member of “La Florida” for two years.  She likes the communal bank because of the camaraderie and unity of the group.  She lives in the center of Cuenca.
