Ruth is 48 years old, married, and has two children, ages 27 and 26.  Both work and help her financially.  Her husband works for a private company and they live in a home of their own.

Ruth works Monday through Saturday from 7:00 am to 7:00 pm in a restaurant that she runs with her sister.  She cares for her granddaughter in her spare time.

She will use the money from this loan to buy tables, chairs, and food.

Her goal is to expand her business much more.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Lucila Angelita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Lucila, tiene 50 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen tres hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad, uno de ellos aún vive con ella. Su esposo es agricultor.

Doña Lucila es una muy buena madre y esposa que se dedica al comercio, vende ropa interior por catálogos y productos de Avon y Yanbal  (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), su forma de venta es puerta a puerta ya que sale tres días a la semana  a enseñar su revista y hacer los pedidos los mismos que luego entrega a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, ella lleva más de 15 años en este negocio y le va muy bien.

Este crédito es para comprar ropa interior, cremas, perfumes y cosméticos. Lleva 7 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y sin tantos requisitos.
 
Su sueño es seguir en su negocio ya que le encanta lo que hace.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Pedro De Pueblo" meets every fifteen days in the Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana parish area, a place with honest people who are dedicated to work in the countryside and to livestock.  It has beautiful country landscapes and kind people.

Lucila lives in this place.  She is fifty years old, is married, and through this relationship, she has three children who are of age.  One of her children still lives with her.  Her husband is a farmer.

Lucila is a very good mother and wife and makes a living in trade.  She sells undergarments through catalogs, as well as Avon and Yanbal products (perfumes, creams, imitation jewelry, and other items).  Her form of selling is going door-to-door.  Three days a week, she shows her magazine to clients and fills orders that are later paid by credit.  She collects payments every eight days.  She has been in this business for more than fifteen years and it is going very well.  

This loan is to buy undergarments, creams, perfumes, and cosmetics.  She has taken seven loans through this communal bank and likes it because the loans are quick and do not have many requirements.

Her dream is to continue with her business, since she loves what she does.

loans.use: to buy undergarments, creams, perfumes, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Mercedes Monserrate

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 77 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvo 8 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes, con ella vive una niña de crianza la cual tiene 8 años y estudia en escuela. 

Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad,  después de la muerte de su esposo se dedica a la costura, confecciona ropa para damas y niños pero lo que más elabora son carteras y monederos  tejidas en lana, ella en cualquier parte donde se encuentre elabora estos productos los mismos que una vez confeccionadas las entrega en ciertos bazares en Santa Ana y Portoviejo,  lleva más de 40 años dedicada a esta actividad la misma que le permite salir adelante sin depender de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar lanas para elaborar sus carteras y materiales de costura.  Lleva 7 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos.
 
Sus sueños son tener salud y darle a su pequeña lo mejor.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Pedro De Pueblo" meets every 15 days in the Pueblo Nuevo parish of the Santa Ana canton. It is a place of beautiful country landscapes and kind, honest people devoted to farm work and ranching. 

Mercedes lives here. She is 77 years old. Several years ago, her husband passed away, but from that relationship she had 8 children who are now independent adults. A child whom she is raising now lives with her who's 8 years old and is attending school. 

Several years ago, Mercedes learned dressmaking in an academy of her locality. After the death of her husband, she works as seamstress. She makes clothing for ladies and children, but what she makes the most are handbags and purses of knitted wool. Wherever she makes these products, once they are made, she delivers them to certain bazaars in Santa Ana and Portoviejo. She has been doing this for more than 40 years and it allows her to go on without depending upon her children.

This loan is to buy wools to make handbags with and sewing materials. She is in her 7th loan cycle with the communal bank and she likes it because of the help that the loans provide her.

Her dreams are to be of good health and provide the best for her little one.

loans.use: to buy wool and sewing materials.

loans.name: Ana Margarita

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Ana, tiene 55 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tiene dos  hijos los mismos que  ya son mayores de edad e independientes, en sus casa viven dos nietos que los tiene desde pequeños y que son como sus hijos y estudian en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella junto al esposo se dedican al comercio, ellos los días domingos se dedican a la venta de carne de res y de cerdo, los domingos que es el día de feria en la localidad instalan una mesa en las afueras de su casa donde venden sus productos a las personas que acuden en este día a proveerse de alimentos. Ellos compran las reses y los cerdos, los llevan a los centros de faenamiento para luego vender la carne, llevan más de 20 años con este negocio el mismo que les permite salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar carne de cerdo y de res para la venta del domingo.  Lleva 6 ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios que les brinda la institución. 

Su sueño es tener una tienda de víveres.
texts.en:
The “San Pedro de Pueblo” Communal Bank meets each 15 days in Pueblo Nuevo parish in Santa Ana canton. Here the residents are honest and dedicated to country tasks and cattle raising, with beautiful rural landscapes and kind people.

Ana lives in this area. She is 55 years old, married, and from this union there are 2 children, both now adults and independent. Two grandchildren have lived in her house since they were small and they are like her own children and are studying in school. Her husband is a merchant.

Ana and her husband are both merchants. On Sundays they sell beef and pork. Sunday is market day in the locality. They place a table outside their house where they sell their products to people who come to provision themselves with food. Ana and her husband buy the cattle and pigs, take them to be slaughtered, then sell the meat. They have been operating this business for over 20 years, and it has enabled them to advance.

This loan is for purchasing pork and beef to sell on Sundays. Ana has belonged to her communal bank through 6 loan cycles. She likes the institution for the benefits it offers.

Ana's dream is to have her own grocery store.

loans.use: buy pork and beef for her meat business.

loans.name: Martha Yicenia

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Martha, tiene 60 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos, tres de ellos ya son mayores de edad y el menor tiene 17 años de edad el mismo que estudia en un colegio de la localidad y es quien aun vive en su casa. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella y esposo hace varios años y con lo que tenían instalaron una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí además de toda clase de víveres también ellos venden ropa, artículos de bazar y productos Avon (perfumes, cremas, bisutería entre otras cosas), ella atiende en su tienda y dos  o tres días de la semana sale a vender sus productos de Avon y algo de ropa, también se desplaza a los campos lugares donde tiene buena clientela, allí entrega a crédito y que cobra cada ocho días, mientras ella hace sus recorridos su marido se encarga de atender su tienda la misma que tienen por más de 10 años y la cual les ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para su tienda, productos de bazar y cosméticos Avon. Lleva dos años en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por los beneficios y ayuda que le brinda la institución. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The communal bank "San Pedro de Pueblo" meets every 15 days in Pueblo Nuevo parish in the canton of Santa Ana.  This is a place where the people are honest, and they mainly work in agriculture and animal husbandry.  It is a place with beautiful countrysides and friendly people.

This is where Martha, 60, lives.  She is married and has 4 children.  Three of her children are adults, and the youngest is 17 years old, studies at a local school, and still lives with her.  Martha's husband is a merchant.

For a number of years now, Martha and her husband have had a small grocery store that is set up in their house.  In this store, they sell all types of groceries, and they also sell clothing, housewares, and Avon products (perfumes, creams, accessories, and other products).  Martha tends to the store, and 2 or 3 times a week she goes out to sell her Avon products and clothing.  She also travels to the countryside to places where she has a good customer base.  She sells her products on credit and collects every 8 days.  While Martha goes out to sell, her husband is in charge of tending to the store.  They've had the store for more than 10 years, and with it they have been able to get ahead.

This loan will be used to buy groceries for the store, housewares, and Avon cosmetics.  Martha has been with her communal bank for 2 years, and she likes it because of the benefits and the support that the institution provides her. 

Martha's dream is to continue to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy groceries, housewares, and Avon cosmetics

loans.name: Euligio Feliciano

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive 4el señor Eulogio, tiene 48 años de edad, está casado y de esta relación tienen cuatro hijos todos ya son mayores de edad, los tres mayores estudian en universidad y el menor en  colegio. Su esposa es ama de casa.

Don Eulogio se dedica a la agricultura y cría de chanchos y ganado en general, que en la actualidad necesita del crédito porque tiene varias hectáreas  listas para sembrar maíz, maní y arroz, él junto con sus hijos ya prepararon el terreno y ahora solo esperan el crédito para poder comprar las semillas, los insecticidas y fertilizantes, siembra sus cultivos en la época invernal y el resto de año se dedica a la venta de animales, leche y quesos que su mujer prepara. 

Este crédito es para semillas, fertilizantes  e insecticidas para obtener una muy buena cosecha. Lleva cinco ciclos en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le brindan los créditos. 

Su sueño es que sus hijos sean muy buenos profesionales.
texts.en:
The 'San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo' community bank meet once every two weeks in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo, in Santa Ana canton.  The locals are decent people who make a living by farming and raising livestock.  The people are friendly and the countryside is beautiful.

This is where Eulogio lives.  Eulogio is 48 years old, married, and has four adult children.  His three eldest are studying at university and his youngest is in school.  His wife is a housewife.

Eulogio's business is farming and raising pigs and other livestock.  He needs this loan because he has several hectares of land ready to plant corn, peanuts and rice.  He and his children have already prepared the land and now the only thing they are waiting for is a loan with which to buy the seeds, insecticides and fertilizers they need to sow their crops over the winter season.  The rest of the year, Eulogio sells animals, milk and cheese that his wife prepares.

Eulogio will use this loan to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides so that he can obtain a very good harvest.  He has been a member of his community bank for five loan cycles and he likes the help that they provide through their loans.

Eulogio's dream is for his children to become very good professionals.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizers and insecticides

loans.name: Areida Celeste

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Areida, tiene 62 años de edad, hace varios años su esposo falleció pero de esa relación tuvieron 5 hijos los mismos que ya son mayores de edad e independientes. 

Doña Areida Hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad y hoy para salir adelante sola sin depender de nadie tiene un taller de costura  donde confecciona todo tipo de ropa, lo que más le gusta confeccionar es ropa de damas y de niñas. Ella también tiene un pequeño local en la parte baja de su casa en la cual en las mañanas vende leche y queso,  lleva más de 30 años dedicada a la costura lo cual es algo que le encanta y a la venta de leche y quesos es un negocio que ella continuo después de la muerte de su querido esposo. Es así como ella sale  adelante sin depender de sus hijos.

Este crédito es para comprar leche, quesos y materiales de costura.  Esta desde el inicio  en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan los créditos. 

Sus sueños son seguir adelante y tener buena salud.
texts.en:
The "San Pedro de Pueblo Nuevo" communal bank gathers together every 15 days in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo of the canton of Santa Ana. It's a place of decent people who are dedicated to working in agriculture and cattle raising. It has a charming rural landscape and friendly people.
That's where Areida lives. She's 62 years old. Her husband passed away several years ago, but she has five children from that relationship. Her children are independent adults.
Several years ago, Areida studied dressmaking in a local school. Nowadays, in order to get ahead on her own and not depend on anyone else, she owns a dressmaking shop where she manufactures all types of garments. She enjoys making women's and girls' clothing the most. She also owns a small store in the lower floor of her house where she sells milk and cheese every morning. She has worked in sewing for over 30 years, and it is something that she loves. The milk and cheese sales is a business that she kept going after her beloved husband's death. That's how she gets ahead without depending on her children.
This loan is to purchase milk, cheese and sewing supplies. She has been in the communal bank from the very beginning and she likes it because of the help she gets with loans.
Her dream is to make progress and to enjoy good health.

loans.use: to purchase milk, cheese and sewing supplies.

loans.name: Lelis Teresilda

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Lelis, tiene 47 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen tres hijos, dos de ellos ya mayores de edad y una chica de 15 años la cual estudia en colegio y es la que aún vive con ellos. Su marido es agricultor.

Doña Lelis tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, la cual le ha sido de mucha ayuda ya que su esposo  no gana mucho en el trabajo del campo y en ocasiones solo saca para los animales de corral que tienen, en su tienda  además de víveres también vende frutas, legumbres, bebidas, helados y ciertos artículos de bazar, ella trabaja todos los días pero los días que más ventas realiza son los fines de semana ya que es cuando más personas salen de los campos a proveerse de víveres para el consumo de la semana. Ella tiene más de 12 años con su negocio el cual le da lo necesario para los gastos del hogar.

Este crédito es para comprar víveres para surtir aún más su tienda. Lleva cuatro ciclos  en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que le brindan  los créditos ya que gracias a estos ha mejorado su tienda. 

Su sueño es seguir aumentando su negocio.
texts.en:
The 'San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo' community bank meets once every two weeks in Pueblo Nuevo parish, in Santa Ana canton.  The locals are decent people who earn a living by farming and raising livestock.  The people are friendly and the countryside is beautiful.

This is where Lelis lives.  Lelis is 47 years old, lives with her partner, and has three children from her relationship.  Two of her children are already adults but her youngest [daughter] is 15 years old, attends school, and still lives with her parents.  Lelis' husband is a farmer.

Lelis has a small grocery store in her home which has been a great help to her as her husband doesn't earn a lot of money from his farm work and sometimes only grows enough to feed the farmyard animals that they keep.  In addition to basic food products, Lelis also sells drinks, iced treats, fruit, vegetables and other miscellaneous items in her store.  She works every day but makes most of her sales on the weekend as this is when people come from the fields to stock up with food to eat during the week.  Lelis has been in her business for more than 12 years and it allows her to cover her household expenses.

Lelis will use this loan to buy basic food products so that she can further stock her store.  She has been a member of her community bank for four loan cycles and likes it because of the loans which have allowed her to improve her store.

Lelis' dream is to continue expanding her business.

loans.use: to buy food products

loans.name: Elsa Janeth

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Elsa, tiene 24 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre  y de esta relación tienen un hijo de cinco años de edad el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su marido es agricultor y ganadero.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que para ayudar a  su marido realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su trabajo,  él se dedica a la agricultura y este es el tiempo para aprovechar el invierno, su esposo con la ayuda de tres personas más están arreglando los terrenos para sembrar maíz y arroz ya que sus tierras son aptas para este tipo de cultivos. Él también por las mañanas se dedica a la venta de leche, de madrugada ordeña sus vacas y luego va a entregar la leche por la localidad.

Este crédito es para comprar semillas, fertilizantes  e insecticidas para obtener una muy buena cosecha. Lleva seis ciclos en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque así ella puede ayudar a su marido con la dura carga del hogar. 

Su sueño es darle lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The “San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo” communal bank meets every fifteen days in Pueblo Nuevo Parish in Santa Ana Canton, a place of honest people who are dedicated to working in the fields and in animal husbandry; it has beautiful scenery and kind people.

Elsa, 24, lives here.  She’s in a free union and has a five-year-old son who attends school.  Her husband’s a farmer and also raises cattle.

She is a very good wife who in order to help her husband is taking out this loan so he can use it in his work.  He works in agriculture and this is the time to take advantage of winter.  Her husband with help from three people is preparing the soil to plant corn and rice since his land is apt for these types of crops.  He also works selling milk in the morning.  He milks his cows at dawn and then sells the milk throughout the location.

This loan is to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide in order to obtain a very good harvest.  She’s been in the communal bank for six cycles and likes it because she can help her husband carry the heavy load their home is.  Her dream is to give her family the best.

loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer and insecticide.

loans.name: Cesar Jampier

texts.es:
Cesar es un joven de 18 años de edad, el cual tiene un carácter jovial a pesar de las adversidades. La vivienda donde habita Cesar se encuentra ubica en la ciudad de Quilmana, ubicada al sur de la capital de nuestro país, la cual se caracteriza por tener un clima cálido y se desarrolla la agricultura, en especial se cultiva el maíz, frejol, entre otros. Debido a sus pocos recursos económicos el solo pudo estudiar hasta el tercer grado de secundaria, pero le hubiera gustado poder tener una carrera universitaria.

Día a día Cesar trabaja en una empresa como empleado, el labora alrededor de 9 horas al día, y con el fruto de su trabajo puede apoyar a sus padres con los gastos del hogar; él cree que está saliendo adelante en su trabajo porque es responsable y honrado.

Cesar está muy agradecido con los prestatarios Kiva ya que gracias a la ayuda que le han brindado el podrá realizar mejoras en su vivienda, especialmente cambiar el techo de su vivienda ya que actualmente es de esteras y caña, con esta mejora podrá tener una mejor calidad de vida y poder seguir luchando para poder hacer realidad su más grande sueño:” Tener una casa propia y poder estudiar una carrera universitaria”.
texts.en:
Cesar is a young man of 18 years of age, which has a jovial character despite the adversities. The dwelling where Cesar inhabit is located in the town of Quilmaná, located to the South of the capital of the country, which is characterized by a warm climate and its agriculture, especially by its corn, beans, among others. 

Due to lack of economic resources, he could only study up to the third grade of secondary, but he would have liked to have a college degree. Every day Cesar works in a company as an employee, he works about 9 hours a day. With the fruits of his labor can help his parents with the home expenses. He believes he is doing well in his work because it is honest and responsible.

Cesar is very grateful with the Kiva borrowers since thanks to their help he will improve his home, especially the ceiling of his home since it is currently made of bamboo leaves and bamboo. With this improvement, he will have a better quality of life and will be able to continue fighting to realize his biggest dream; "Having his own home and to study a university career".

loans.use: to change ceiling of his home since it is currently made of bamboo leaves and bamboo (esteras y caña)

loans.name: Maritza Manuela

texts.es:
EL Banco Comunal San Pedro De Pueblo Nuevo se reúne cada quince días en la parroquia Pueblo Nuevo del Cantón Santa Ana, lugar de gente honesta y dedicada a las faenas del campo y a la ganadería, con bellos paisajes campestres y gente amable.

En este lugar vive la señora Maritza, tiene 29 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de cinco años de edad el mismo que estudia en escuela. Su esposo es comerciante.

Ella es una muy buena esposa que realiza el crédito para que su marido  lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica a la compra y venta de ganado, de chanchos y reses. Dos días a la semana él recorre los campos para comprar estos animalitos que luego llevarlos a revender en Santa Ana o Portoviejo donde tiene sus clientes que semana a semana le compran.  Es así como él  salen adelante con su familia.

Este crédito es para comprar chanchos y vacas para la venta del fin de semana. Esta desde el inicio en el  Banco Comunal y le gusta porque con los créditos puede financiar el negocio de su marido.

Su sueño es comprar un camión para llevar los animales ya que les toca alquilar el transporte.
texts.en:
The Communal Bank San Pedro De Bueblo Nuevo meets twice a month in the parish of Pueblo Nuevo in the canton of Santa Ana, a place of honest people working in the fields and with livestock, with beautiful country landscapes and friendly people.

Maritza lives in this place. She is 29 years old, married, and they have together a 5 year old son who goes to school. Her husband is a merchant.

She is a good wife who is requesting a loan for her husband to use in his business. He works buying and selling cattle and pigs. Two days a week he walks through the fields to buy these animals and later he takes and resells them in Santa Ana or Portoviejo where he has customers who buy week to week. It is this way he is able to support his family.

This loan is to buy pigs and cows for weekend sale. She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because with the loans she is able to finance her husband’s business.

Her dream is to buy a truck to transport the animals as they have to hire transport now.

loans.use: to buy pigs and cows

loans.name: Batjargal

texts.en:
Mr. Batjargal, 38, lives with his wife and three children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The family resides in their own house on a plot of land. Their children study at high school. Mr. Batjargal has been running a house wares business for eighteen years. He and his wife operate their business in shifts at an outdoor market. In 2011, due to an electrical hazard, their house burned down completely, and, in 2012, the family devoted their whole earnings to build a new house. Now the family lives in their new house and works enthusiastically. 

Mr. Batjargal is requesting a loan of 2,500,000 MNT to purchase house wares in large quantity. This will help him and his wife to run their business without worrying about inventory shortage. Mr. Batjargal is a very hardworking individual whose goals for the near future include purchasing an automobile.

loans.use: to purchase house wares in large quantity.

loans.name: Kimlorn's Group

texts.en:
A rural villager located in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district, Kimlorn is 55 years old and a married mother of four children. One of her children is dependent on her and still in school. Kimlorn is a rice farmer and a pig-raiser who has been involved in these businesses for 10 years. She is able to earn up to 24,000 KHR per day and manages to save about 18,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Kimlorn has been with VisionFund for two cycles and fully repaid the loans while the other member has been with VisionFund for one cycle. Kimlorn has used the previous loans to relieve her family’s burden and improve their livelihood. Now she is leading her group of two to ask for a loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy pig feed and use a portion of it to spend on labor costs for harvesting rice. She hopes to fatten her pigs in a healthy way and also hopes to increase her crop yield so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy pig feed

loans.name: Meas

texts.en:
Meas, a mother of eight children, is 53 years old. She resides in the Bovel district of Battambang Province, Cambodia. Meas still has one child to take care of who is still in school. 

Meas makes a living via rice cultivation and planting oranges, which she has been involved with for 15 years. The current business earns her about 30,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs. 

This is the third loan cycle for Meas with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. She has used the past loans, which she has fully paid back with success, to keep up the good progress of her business as well as her living conditions. 

Now Meas is applying for a loan of 4,000,000 KHR to buy a tractor to help her in the rice field. She hopes this loan will enable her to increase her crop yield, so as to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to buy a tractor to help her in the rice field.

loans.name: Suvd-Erdene

texts.en:
Mrs. Suvd-erdene, 30 years old, lives with her husband and four children in Ulaanbaatar, capital city of Mongolia. She has been running a business selling hand watering carts at an outdoor market. Her husband, a welder, makes the hand carts his wife sells. Usually people living in the ger district area, which has no water supply system, purchase these hand carts to transport water barrels.

Suvd-erdene's family lives in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) and just began building their house. But due to a lack of finance, the house is not completed. She is requesting a loan of 2,000,000 MNT to purchase large amounts of iron and rubber. As a result, she can generate more income, which will be used to finish the house. The completed house will definitely provide the family with comfort and warmth.

loans.use: to purchase large amounts of rubber and iron

loans.name: Voert's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural village in the Ek Phnom district of Cambodia, Voert is 37 years old and married, with three children, all of whom are still in school. The family’s main sources of income come from Voert's and her husband's wages as laborers for others in their village. They supplement the income by catching fish. Engaging in this business for several years, Voert can earn about KHR 30,000 per day to meet her family’s needs.

Voert has been with VisionFund Cambodia for three cycles and completely paid back the past loans. The other member of Voert's Group has been with VisionFund Cambodia for two cycles. 

Now, Voert is leading her group of two to ask for a new loan. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a boat for her fish-catching business. She hopes to catch more fish and sell them for a good price, to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy a boat for her fish-catching business.

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom, 43 years old, is a villager residing in a rural area of Battambang province’s Ek Phnom district, Cambodia. She is married and has six children, three of whom are school-aged children. To support the family, Mom works weaving mats, while her husband works as a construction worker to earn additional income. Mom and her husband have been doing this work for 20 years, earning about 32,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.
 
Mom has been with VisionFund for six loan cycles, and she completely paid back the past loans. She has successfully used the past loans to better support her family. Now she is forming a group of three, to ask for a new loan. Mom, who is the leader, will use her portion of the new loan to buy construction materials for her husband’s business. She hopes to realize more income from his current business, so as to improve her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy construction materials for her husband’s business

loans.name: Mom's Group

texts.en:
Mom is 51 years old, married, and has seven children.  She is originally from a village of the Ek Phnom District where rice farming is a common way to make a living. Mom and her husband have been involved in corn planting for five years. She earns about 36,000 KHR per day.
 
Mom is the leader of her group of two who are requesting loans from VisionFund, which she will use to pay for labor costs in planting corn.  Mom has been with VisionFund for six cycles while the second group member has been with VisionFund for seven cycles. She hopes to grow her corn timely and fruitfully so as to sell it for a good price.

loans.use: to pay labor costs in planting corn.

loans.name: Adel

texts.en: Adel is a 42-year-old married man. He has four children who all live all in Sana`a, Yemen. His children are studying in school. He dreams to see his children grow up well. Adel is a teacher who is described as a kindly man for his students. He intends to buy home appliances for his house, but the amount he has is not enough to buy what he needs. So he has applied for a loan of 300,000 YER from AMB to buy a fridge, washing machine and television, etc. Adel dreams of studying for a master's in his specialization and improve his living standards.

loans.use: to buy a fridge, washing machine and television, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy additional women's clothes for her business.

loans.name: Abtehal Group

texts.en:
This group is called Abtehal Group which consists of four women who live in Aden, Yemen. They applied for a combined loan of YER 140,000 from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank (AMB) to support different type of businesses. 

Basma works hard to offer a good life for her family. She is a 27-year-old, married woman and has two children who live in Aden. She is the bread-winner who has sold mobile recharge cards, door-to-door, for four years. 

Basma would like to improve her business, so she applied for a loan of YER 50,000 from AMB to buy more mobile recharge cards for sale, to get more profit. She hopes to enroll her children in private school.

loans.use: to buy more mobile recharge cards for sale.

loans.name: Al-Anfal Group

texts.en:
Al-Anfal  group consists of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a 160,000 YER loan from AMB to buy potatoes,four and cooking oil and to renovate houses.

Dina, 25 years old and a married woman with three children, is the leader of the group. She is illiterate. She is a good mother.  She loves her husband  and children very much and wants to do her best to see them happy. She knows that her husband's income can't cover all their needs, so she thought of starting up a small business. She has a food stall. She has been selling boiled and fried potatoes besides "zalabia" for a year. She wants to sell more food and therefore she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER from AMB to buy a quantity of potatoes, flour and cooking oil. Dina hopes to make more profits to be able to send her children to school and provide them with everything the need to be successful and have a better future.

loans.use: to buy a quantity of potatoes, flour and cooking oil for her business

loans.name: Om-Adnan Group

texts.en: The Om-Adnan group consists of three women from Aden, Yemen. Each member has her own type of business. They have requested a group loan of 150,000 YER, and they will hold each other accountable for loan repayment. Abtehal is a 34-year-old mother of 4 children. Because most of her children are in school, the income from her previous job was not enough to cover her children's school fees and other important household expenses, and she was unable to dedicate enough time to her kids. Now she has shifted to a more profitable business by selling perfumes and ladies clothes, and she has applied for a loan to start up her new business.

loans.use: to buy perfumes and ladies clothes for resale.

loans.name: Becham Group

texts.en:
Christian is in his mid-30s and married.  He is the chairman of the group, "BECHAM," and is very hard working.  He has been running a poultry business by keeping egg-laying hens.  Christian's business allows him to earn a very good monthly profit.  He works from 6:00 am to 6:00 pm daily.  

This will be Christian's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a shamba (small farm), where he started to build his house.  He also expanded his chicken shed.  Additionally, he has purchased chicken feed for the chickens. 

He has successfully repaid all his loans.  He is requesting a new loan to buy six hundred chicks.  His dream is to buy a vehicle that will allow him to distribute his eggs to his agents.

Christian will share this loan with his group "BECHAM," which has fourteen members.  They will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

loans.use: to buy six hundred chicks.

loans.name: Haqat Group

texts.en: Haqat Group is located at Aden, Yemen and consists of 4 ladies. 30-year-old Miada is a mother of 2 children who works very hard, going door to door selling various products such as cosmetic materials, incense and clothing. A previous loan helped her to start her business, but because she has made only a small profit, she is forced to apply for another loan to keep her business running. She will use this loan to buy ladies and children's clothing for her business.

loans.use: to buy ladies and children's clothing for her business.

loans.name: Al-Widad Group

texts.en:
Al-Widad is a group of five women from Taiz, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the amount of 120,000 YER to purchase women's and children's clothes, perfumes, and incense to offer for sale.

Samr, age 29, is the leader of the group. Although she is illiterate, she does not want the same thing to happen with her four children. She wants them to go to school and become educated, but for her to meet this goal, she needs to obtain more money. Her husband's monthly income is very low, so she wants to start up a small business. She intends to sell women's and children's clothes to earn an income, and for this reason she has asked for a loan in the amount of 30,000 YER. She intends to sell clothing to the households in her neighborhood as a first step.

Samr looks forward to accumulating enough money to build a small house for her family and to ensure better living standards for her family.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing clothes to offer for sale

loans.name: Ebeneza Group

texts.en:
Dorothea, who is in her late 20s is married with one child who goes to school.  She has been running a business of selling charcoal for six years.  She works from 6.00 am to 10.00 pm daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Dorothea's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loan to increase the charcoal stock. She started selling fabrics and sarongs and has successfully paid back the loan. She hopes for a loan to buy more sacks of charcoal, fabrics and sarongs.  Her dream is to one day be able to open a big clothing and cosmetics shop.

Dorothea will share this loan with her loan group "Ebeneza" that has 10 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal, fabrics and sarongs.

loans.name: Al-Hiah Group

texts.en:
Al-Hiah is a group of four women from Taiz, Yemen. They have asked for a loan in the amount of 170,000 YER to purchase clothes and other products for resale.

Mesk, age 51, is the leader of the group. She and her husband have one child. She has a diploma degree. She lives with her husband and child in a rented house. Her husband's income covers only the house rent and food, so Mesk has no choice but to work to help her husband. She sells women's  and kids' clothes, perfumes, make-up, and incense. 

She has asked for a loan of 50,000 YER in order to buy more clothes to offer for sale. This will help her cover the demands of her clients and to target new clients in different quarters in her area. 

Mesk looks forward to improving her family's living conditions and eventually to accumulate enough money to buy a small house.

loans.use: to purchase clothes, perfumes, and incense to offer for sale

loans.name: Al-Khir Group

texts.en: Al-Khir Group consists of 4 ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They have applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. Huda is a 29-year-old married woman who has one child. She lives in Sana`a. She is a hardworking woman who loves her family. She is a housewife, and she intends to apply for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy home appliances for her house. She hopes that this will improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to buy home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Astou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois, il est composé de femmes qui habitent la même localité s'activant dans la transformation des produits halieutiques et unies par de bonnes relations sociales.
Madame Aby est l'emprunteur en vedette. Elle est âgée de 40 ans, elle est mariée et mère de 4 enfants dont 1 fille.
Elle est assise  à l’extrême gauche  avant la dernière personne de la photo habillée d'une robe fleurette.
Aby fait du commerce de produits halieutiques par la le biais de  la transformation de poissons frais .
Avec son nouveau crédit de 105000 francs cfa elle va se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle va revendre au détails et qu'elle va également cuir et revendre au détail.
Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine, les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the local village loan group and comprises women who live in the same area, are active in the processing of fish products, and are united by good social relations.
Ms. Aby is the featured borrower. She is 40 years old, married, and has four children, including one girl.
She is sitting second from the left, in the floral dress.
Aby converts fresh fish into fish products and sells them.
With her new loan of 105,000 FCFA, she is going to buy baskets of fresh fish that she is going to sell at retail and also cook and resell at retail.
She has gained good experience in this field, and the profits earned allow her to take care of the nutritional, educational, and health needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy baskets of fish for resale at retail.

loans.name: Waridi Pendo Group

texts.en:
Deuc is in his late thirties and is married, with one son who still goes to school.  He has been selling music equipment such as DVD Players and renting DVDs and CDs from his music library since 2003.  He works from 8:00 a.m. to 9:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be his thirteenth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a plot, to cover household expenses, to buy missing items in his music equipment stock, and increase the library stock. He has paid back all his loans successfully.  

Deuc hopes for a loan to buy music equipment and DVDs and CDs, as well as to start building his house.

Deuc will share this loan with his loan group "Waridi Pendo" with eleven members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy music equipment and DVDs and CDs, as well as to start building his house.

loans.name: Al-Khir Al-Waytat Group

texts.en:
Al-khir Al-waytat is a group of four women living in Sana'a, Yemen. 

Aisha, age 29, is a member of the group. She is a housewife and the mother of two children. She intends to buy a cupboard and an oven for her house. These are items her family needs that she has been unable to buy due to lack of money. 

She hopes to help improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a cupboard and an oven for her home

loans.name: Rubina

texts.en: Ms. Rubina is 45 years old and a mother of four. She has been tailoring for 8 years. She is noted to be a very hardworking lady who is running her business successfully. She has a very good reputation in nearby communities as she has served people with a variety of good stitching designs. In order to meet with the demands of her customers, she needs to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of threads, packs of needles, buttons, and laces in various colors. Therefore, she applied for a loan of PKR 30,000 from Kashf Foundation. She is in her third loan cycle with good repayment history. Rubina is hopeful that this investment will have a positive impact on her business and that her income will be increased.

loans.use: to purchase a new sewing machine with spools of threads, packs of needles, buttons, and laces in various colors.

loans.name: Fatim's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle un du BV il regroupe des femmes issues d'une même localité. Il regroupe des femmes unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
L'emprunteur en vedette Ngoné est une femme mariée. Elle est âgée de 50 ans et mère de 3 enfants toutes des filles.
Elle est assise à l’extrême gauche de photo habillée en camisole multicolore.
Ngoné fait du commerce par la vente de poissons.
Son nouveau crédit de 65000 francs CFA lui permettra de se payer des paniers de poissons qu'elle va revendre au détail au niveau de son quartier. Elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine pour l'avoir pratiquée depuis longtemps.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charge les besoins alimentaires,scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants.
texts.en:
This group was created during the first cycle of the local village loan fund and comprises women who come from the same area and are united by good social and professional relations.
The featured borrower Ngoné is a married woman. She is 50 years old and has three children, all of whom are girls.
She is sitting all the way on the left in the photo, in the multicoloured dress.
Ngoné runs a business selling fish.
Her new loan of 65,000 FCFA will allow her to pay for baskets of fish that she is going to sell at retail in her area. She has good experience in this field, having been active for a long time.
The profits earned allow her to take care of the nutritional, educational, and health needs of her children.

loans.use: To buy baskets of fish.

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is a 42-year-old married woman and the mother of nine children. She is trying hard to fulfill their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She and her husband have been doing farming for many years. They grow different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market.  Her son also assists her in growing the various crops by watering the soil for good quality production. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Kalsoom applied for a loan of 35,000 PKR. This would help her to grow good quality crops which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds with packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Ghazala

texts.en: Ms. Ghazala is a 33-year-old lady who has been running a business selling decorations for many years. She makes pieces to beautify homes and rooms and then sells them to the people in her community and in the local market. In order to inflate her sales, she needs to purchase paint brushes with packs of paints and good quality clay. For this she applied for a loan of PKR 20,000 from Kashf Foundation. She hopes to boost her net income and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members. Her brother and sisters also assist her in doing this work and are happy with the growth of Ghazala’s business.

loans.use: to purchase paint brushes with packs of paints and good quality clay.

loans.name: Shehnaz

texts.en: Ms Shehnaz is a 38-year-old married woman. She has been successfully running a cosmetic retail business for one year. She sells make-up kits, lipsticks, different types of cleansers, and lotions to the people in her community. She has a good client list and makes enough to lead a decent life. In order to cater to more customers, she needs to purchase various creams and make-up kits with packs of lipsticks and lip glosses. For this she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 20,000. She expects an increase in her earnings through her increased sales. She wishes to spend a part of her profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: To purchase various creams and make-up kits with packs of lipsticks and lip glosses

loans.name: Safietou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle un du banc villageois il est composé de femmes issues du même quartier toutes commerçantes dans le secteur de la vente de  poissons. 
Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Maguatte est l'emprunteur en vedette, elle est âgée de 49 ans mariée et mère de 6 enfants dont 3 garçons.
Elle est debout à l’extrême gauche de la photo habillé en grand boubou teintés la main levée. Maguatte fait du commerce de poissons frais et fumés depuis bientôt dix ans elle dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce domaine. 
Son nouveau crédit de 70000 francs cfa lui permettra de se payer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle  va revendre au détails au niveau du quai de pèche de sa localité.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de prendre en charges les besoins alimentaires scolaires et sanitaires de ses enfants et de renforcer ses épargne au niveau du banc villageois.
texts.en:
This group was formed during the first cycle of the local village loan fund, and comprises women who come from the same area and are all merchants in the fish selling sector.
They are united by good social and professional relations.
Maguatte is the featured borrower; she is 49 years old, married, and has six children, three of whom are boys.
She is standing all the way on the left in the photo, dressed in a large dyed boubou with her hand raised. Maguatte has run a business selling fresh and smoked fish for almost ten years, and has gained good experience in this field.
Her new loan of 70,000 FCFA will allow her to buy baskets of fresh fish, which she is going to sell at retail at the fishing dock in her area.
The profits earned will allow her to take care of the nutritional, educational, and health needs of her children and strengthen her savings in the local village loan fund.

loans.use: To buy fresh and smoked fish for resale at retail

loans.name: Zareena

texts.en:
Ms. Zareena is a 42-year-old married lady. She has been stitching for 20 years. She knows stitching technique very well and by this time she has become famous in her community for her neat work. She has maintained a regular list of customers and makes enough to lead a decent life. In this way she is contributing a lot in the family income. 

Zareena is a mother of three children; two sons and one daughter. She wants to provide her children with a bright and prosperous future. To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she has applied a loan of PKR 30,000. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase spools of threads, packs of buttons, lace, and zippers in various colors. She expects a boost in her earnings and wishes to spend part of the profits on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads, packs of buttons, lace, and zippers in various colors.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr:
Ce groupe a été crée depuis le cycle premier du banc villageois il regroupe des femmes du même  quartier vendeuses de poissons. 
Elles sont unies par de bonnes relations sociales et professionnelles.
Yacine est l'emprunteur en vedette de ce groupe elle  debout à gauche de la photo habillé en camisole teintés la main levée. Elle est âgée de 48 ans et mère de sept enfants dont 4 garçons.
Madame fait du commerce de poissons depuis bientôt  dix ans et  dispose d'une bonne expérience dans ce secteur . Avec son nouveau crédit 100000 francs cfa elle va se procurer des paniers de poissons frais qu'elle  va revendre au niveau du quai de pèche.
Les bénéfices réalisés lui permettent de payer les factures d’électricité et d'eau de sa maison.
texts.en:
This group was formed during the first cycle of the local village loan fund. It comprises women from the same area, all of whom sell fish.
They are united by good social and professional relations.
Yacine is the featured borrower; she is standing on the left in the photo, dressed in a dyed dress with her hand raised. She is 48 years old and has seven children, four of whom are boys.
Ms. Yacine has run a business selling fish for almost ten years and has gained good experience in this field. With her new loan of 100,000 FCFA, she is going to buy baskets of fresh fish, which she will sell at the fishing dock.
The profits earned allow her to pay for electricity and water at her home.

loans.use: To buy fresh fish.

loans.name: Khalid Group

texts.en: The Khalid group is made of 4 members. They live in Sana`a, Yemen. Samira is a 52-year-old and a mother of 7 kids. She is a housewife. Her washing machine is not working and she doesn`t have enough money to buy new washing machine. She has applied for a loan from AMB in order to buy a new washing machine for her house.

loans.use: to buy a new washing machine for her house.

loans.name: Riyadh Group

texts.en:
The Riyadh group consists of five women from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to buy construction supplies.
Safia, a 34-year-old married woman with four children, is the leader of the group. She and her family live in a small, old house. She is expanding her house by building another room. She needs to roof the room, so she asked for a 30,000 YER loan to buy timbers for roof construction. Safia hopes that after completing the room she will be able to renovate the house.

loans.use: to buy wood to roof a room.

loans.name: Al-Hayah Group

texts.en: This group is called Al-Hayah. It consists of four ladies who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB. Amah is a 35-year-old married woman who lives in Sana`a. She is a doctor who is diligent. She said she loves her career and feels compelled to offer humanitarian work for her patients. She intends to furnish her house to live a better life. She applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture for her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture for her house.

loans.name: Ayman Group

texts.en:
The Ayman group consists of three poor women from Taiz, Yemen. They asked for a loan of 120,000 YER from AMB to purchase clothing and cosmetics for resale.
Hamida is a 42-year-old uneducated married woman with six children. She is a door-to-door salesperson. She has been selling women's and kids' clothing, perfumes, and incense for about a year. Her business makes a good profit, so she intends to buy more products to cover the increasing demands from her clients and to target new clients; therefore, she applied for a loan of 40,000 YER. Hamida looks forward to sending her children to schools and universities to be able to make their own futures.

loans.use: to pay for clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Shaker Group

texts.en:
The Shaker group is made up of three women and a man from Taiz, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 150,000 YER from AMB to purchase clothing and cosmetics for resale.
Khawzran is a 30-year-old married woman with four children and the leader of the group. Her family suffers from an inability to pay for essential living expenses because their only income source is Khawzran's husband monthly salary, which is very low. Khawzran intends to help her husband, so she asked for a loan of 40,000 YER to pay for purchasing women's and kids' clothing, perfumes, and incense. She hopes that, with the profit she makes, she will be able to improve her family living standards and open a savings account with AMB.

loans.use: to pay clothing and cosmetics for resale.

loans.name: Salmy Group

texts.en:
This group is called Salmy. It consists of 5 ladies and 2 men who live in Sana`a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 210,000 YER from AMB.
Yasmin is a 20-year-old single woman who is an employed. She makes efforts to improve her living standards. She does potentially deadly work daily. She intends to buy home appliances but she doesn`t have money. She applied for a loan of 30,000 YER from AMB to buy furniture to use for her house.

loans.use: to buy furniture to use for her house.

loans.name: Orlando Emilio

texts.es:
Don Orlando, tiene 50 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven; pues no tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar. Siempre se dedico a realizar labores agrícolas y al cuido de animales; cuando se caso empezó a trabajar con más ganas y con mayor esfuerzo para sostener a su familia. Su padre fue quien le enseño a trabajar, pues le inculco a que se debe trabajar y ahorrar para comprar las cosas que se necesitan y piensa en dejarles a sus hijos animales para que empiecen su vida de manera independiente. 

Para salir a comprar los insumos que necesita, él debe caminar media hora para abordar el autobús, este tarda cuarenta minutos en llegar y luego regresa a su casa; pero para trasladar los insumos debe pagar una persona que le brinde el servicio de carretero.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro toretes para aprovechar el rastrojo que queda del cultivo. Así, él no desperdiciara ese pasto y tendrá animales que pueda venderlos en un futuro y con la ganancia trabajar en la agricultura. Su más grande sueño, es trabajar y ahorrar para dejarle a cada hijo una casa y una vaca para cuando se casen tengan como trabajar.
texts.en:
Orlando, 50, is married and has two children.  He has made a living in agriculture since he was very young because he didn't have the opportunity to study.  He has always done agricultural labor and cared for animals.

When he got married he started working with more desire and greater effort to support his family.  His father taught him to work and instilled in him that he should work and save to buy the things he needs.  He plans to leave animals to his children so they will begin their lives independently.

To go out and buy the supplies he needs he has to walk for half an hour to get the bus.  It takes forty minutes to get there and then he returns home.  To transport the supplies, though, he has to pay for the services of a cart driver.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy four young bulls to make the most of the stubble that remains from the crop.  This way he won't waste that pasture and he'll have animals he can sell in the future, and put the profit back into agriculture.

His biggest dream is to work and save so he can leave a house and a cow to each child when they marry, so they have a way to work.

loans.use: to buy four young bulls

loans.name: José Carmen

texts.es:
Don José, tiene 45 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene tres hijos. Se dedica a la agricultura desde muy joven; en su época los padres no se preocupaban porque fuera a la escuela  y en su caso fue más difícil, pues su padre murió cuando él tenía cinco años de edad y se creció con sus abuelos y fue con ellos que aprendió la agricultura. Cuando se caso nos comenta don José que trabajo con más esmero y dedicación para su familia. Se levanta  a las 4:30 a.m. a dejar unas novillas, luego se toma una taza de café para irse a su trabajo que esta a treinta minutos, trabaja a siete horas y luego regresa a su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos toretes para repasto ya que le queda el rastrojo de la cosecha. Su propósito, es brindar a sus hijos el estudio para que se preparen académicamente y construir su casa de ladrillo, debido a que la que tiene es de bahareque.
texts.en:
José, 45, lives with his wife and has three children.  He has made a living in agriculture from a very young age.  In his youth, parents weren't worried about going to school.  In his case it was more difficult because his father died when José was five years old and he grew up with his grandparents, with whom he learned agricultural work.

José says that when he got married he worked with more care and dedication for his family.  He gets up at 4:30 a.m. to let the young bulls out.  Then he has a cup of coffee to go out to work, which is 30 minutes away.  He works for seven hours, then returns home.

The loan he's requesting from Fundación Campo is to buy two young bulls to graze because there is stubble remaining from the harvest.

His goals are to give his children an education so they're academically prepared and to build his house of brick, because the one he has now is of bamboo.

loans.use: to buy two young bulls for grazing

loans.name: Maria Mercedes

texts.es: Joven señora que habita en el barrio memorial Sandino está casada y tienen 3 hijos de 16, 12 y 8 años dos estudian la primaria y uno está cursando una carrera universitaria, ella trabaja para un restaurante en el área de cocina desde hace muchos años, se esfuerza bastante con su esposo para poder darles a sus hijos lo principal en la vida estudios y alimentación, está solicitando su crédito para infraestructura desea poner las verjas en su casa que todavía le hacen falta para mantenerla más segura ante los delincuentes, así su familia estaría más tranquila en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Maria Mercedes is a young woman who lives in a neighborhood named in memory of Sandino [a national hero]. She is married and has 3 children, ages 16, 12, and 8. Two are in primary school and one is pursuing a career path in the university. Maria has worked in the kitchen of a restaurant for many years. She and her husband work hard together to be able to offer her children the main things in life, education and food.

Maria Mercedes is soliciting an infrastructure loan; she wishes to install iron gates on her house, protection it currently lacks. The house needs this to be more secure from the criminal elements. Then her family can live more tranquilly in their home.

loans.use: buy iron gates and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Manzese A Group

texts.en:
John, who is in his early 30s, is single with one daughter who goes to school.  He has been selling different items such as fruits, vegetables, radios, telephone covers, and door handles for two years now. He works from 8.00 a.m. to 9.00 p.m. daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be John's second loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loan to restock some needed items in his business, covered household expenses and school fees, and paid back his loan successfully.  He wants a loan to buy more fruits, vegetables, radios, telephone covers, and door handles.  His dream is to one day be able to build his own house.

John will share this loan with his loan group, Manzese A, which has 18 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fruits, vegetables, radios, telephones, and housing and door  handles

loans.name: Evelin Del Carmen

texts.es:
Evelin tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene dos hijos.  Desde hace 8 años se dedica a la venta de pescado seco; antes trabajaba en la agricultura junto con sus padres. Pero cuando se caso decidió trabajar en la venta de pescado seco, más cuando nacieron sus hijos, ella tenia que ayudar a su esposo con los gastos del hogar. Una amiga la invito a que conociera como era este negocio. Se levanta muy temprano a preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y esposo, luego deja a sus hijos en la escuela y se va a vender el pescado de manera ambulante. Para comprar el pescado, la señora debe abordar un pick up o sino caminar a pie unos cuarenta y cinco minutos. Luego llega al lugar en donde aborda el autobús que la conduce a la ciudad, después aborda otro que la conduce a la playa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar 300 ladrillos, 6 bolsas de cemento, medio quintal de hierro, para construir una pared y el resto para comprar pescado. Desea construir la pared, pues es de lámina y mejoraría su humilde vivienda, dormirá más tranquila y poseerá más pescado para vender. Lo que más quiere es brindar a sus hijos educación y construir poco a poco una casa de ladrillo.
texts.en:
Evelin is 31 years old, married and has two children.  For the past eight years she has been selling dried fish.  She used to work in agriculture with her parents, but when she married she decided to sell dried fish, especially after her children were born.  She needed to help her husband with the household expenses.  A friend invited her to learn this business.

She gets up very early to prepare breakfast for her children and husband, she drops her children off at school, and goes out to sell fish on foot.  In order to buy the fish, she needs to take a pick up or walk 45 minutes, then she arrives at the place where she boards the bus that takes her into the city, then takes another bus to the beach.

She will use the money from this loan through Fundación Campo to buy 300 bricks, six bags of cement, and iron bars to build a wall and use the rest of the money to buy fish.  She wants to build a metal wall so that it will improve her humble home.  She will sleep more soundly and will also have more fish to sell.  What she wants mostly is to provide an education for her children and build a brick home little by little.

loans.use: to build a wall and buy some fish to sell.

loans.name: Ana Mercedes

texts.es:
La Señora  Ana es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive con sus  3 hijos, es madre  soltera y vive en una comunidad al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una pulpería.
Doña Ana el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de  maíz, leña, cal, arroz, manteca, café, azúcar, frijoles, refrescos, agua, salsas, harina, margarinas, huevos, churros, etc.  Con el préstamo ella espera que las ventas en su negocio aumenten al tener más mercadería  que ofrecer a los clientes y cubrir las necesidades de los mismos y con esto mejorar un poco la situación  económica  de su  familia.
Doña Ana  en unos 3 años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo y  consolidándose  para que se convierta  en un mini supermercado  y  seguir  apoyando a su familia,  para que  sus hijos terminen sus estudios y se conviertan en personas honesta  y responsables.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero  del   2013
texts.en:
Ana is a responsible, hardworking, and honest woman.  She lives with her three children, is a single mother and lives in a southern Honduras community.  She has a general store.

Ana needs this loan to buy corn, firewood, salt, rice, lard, coffee, sugar, beans, water, salsas, flour, margarines, eggs, churros, etc.  She expects that this loan will help her increase her merchandise so that she will have more to offer her customers and cover their needs.  In this way she can improve her family’s financial situation.

Ana expects to continue growing her business and consolidate so that she can convert into a mini supermarket to continue to support her family so that her children can complete their studies so that they can become honest persons of means.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Iris

texts.es:
La señora Iris es una muy buena persona emprendedora, responsable y trabajadora vive con  su hijo en una comunidad al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es compra y venta  de pescado y fabrica de tortillas.
Doña Iris el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de pescado, maíz, leña y cal,  con el préstamo ella espera  el aumento de las ventas debido a que contara con más producto  que ofrecer a los clientes. 
Doña Iris espera cubrir sus necesidades, así mismo desea que su situación y la de su familia mejoren con esta inversión. 
Doña Iris espera  que en 1 año  su negocio este posicionado como  el negocio   más grande y  conocido de su caserío   y poder seguir apoyando a  su hijo  a que se conviertan en personas de bien.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Iris is a good enterprising, responsible, and hardworking woman who lives with her husband in a southern Honduran community.  She buys and sells fish and makes tortillas.  Iris needs this loan to buy fish, corn, firewood, and salt.  She expects to increase her sales because she will have more product to offer her customers.  Iris expects to cover her necessities and hopes that her and her family’s situation improves with this investment.

She hopes that within one year her business will be set up like the biggest and best known in her neighborhood and to be able to continue supporting persons of means.

loans.use: to buy supplies.

loans.name: Deysi Esperanza

texts.es:
Deysi tiene 34 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos, uno de 9 años y unos gemelos de 4 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la venta de pescado desde que se caso, antes se dedicaba al comercio junto con su mamá. Para salir temprano a vender, se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a preparar el desayuno de sus hijos y su esposo, y alistar a su hijo mayor para llevarlo a la escuela y a los gemelos los lleva con su suegra mientras tanto ella se va a vender. Para comprar el pescado, debe abordar un pick up hasta llegar a la ciudad, en donde aborda un autobús que la conduce hasta la playa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar la última cuota de una casa que compro y el resto para comprar pescado seco para vender. Con la inversión terminara de pagar su casa y podrá sacar sus escrituras y estar segura que ya es su casa y comprar más pescado, pues debe de viajar varias veces al mes por no tener suficiente dinero para comprar para todo el mes. Ese dinero que paga de los pasajes se lo puede ahorrar ya que su propósito es que sus hijos se gradúen de la universidad y construir una habitación más a su vivienda.
texts.en:
Deysi is 34 years old, married and has three children, one nine years old and a set of four year old twins.  She has been selling fish since she got married but she used to be a merchant with her mother.  She gets up at 4:00 am so that she can leave early to make her sales.  She prepares her husband’s and children’s breakfasts, prepares her oldest son for school, and takes her twins to her mother in law while she goes out to sell.  In order to buy her fish, she needs to board a pickup truck that takes her to the city where she can board the bus to the beach. 

She is asking for a loan through Fundación Campo so that she can make the final payment on her house that she bought.  She will use the rest of the money to buy dried fish to sell.  This will allow her to finish paying off her house, get the deed, and then feel certain that the house is hers and she will then be able to buy more fish.  She has to travel several times but doesn’t have enough money to buy for the whole month.

She can save the money she pays for the trips because she wants her children to graduate from university and add onto her house.

loans.use: to pay off her house.

loans.name: Marlyn

texts.es:
El joven  Marlyn es una muy buena persona honesto, Responsable y trabajador vive con  su  esposa y su  hijo en un caserío  al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la compra y venta  de  cerdos.
Marlyn el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de cerdos y espera que sus ventas aumenten gracias a  que contara con producto fresco que ofrecer a los clientes y poder así cubrir un poco sus necesidades.
Marlyn desea que su situación de  vida y la de familia mejoren con esta inversión.
Marlyn  espera  que en 2 años  su negocio este posicionado como  el negocio   más grande y  conocido de su caserío   y poder seguir apoyando a  su familia y a su hijo en los estudios para que se convierta en una persona de bien.



Choluteca, Honduras – Enero   2013
texts.en:
Marlyn is a very good and honest person.  He is a responsible hard worker who lives with his wife and son in a southern Honduras settlement.  He buys and sells pigs.

Marlyn needs this loan to buy pigs and he hopes that his sales will increase thanks to him having fresh product to offer his customers and in this way being he is able to cover his needs a bit.  Marlyn wants his family’s life situation to improve with this investment.

Marlyn expects to be positioned as a larger, well known business in two years so that he is able to continue supporting his family and his son in his studies so that he becomes a person of means.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cell phones and clothing.

loans.name: Kelin

texts.es:
La señora Kelin es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  esposo  y   sus  3 hijas en una comunidad al sur de Hondura, su negocio es pulpería. 
Doña Kelin el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de refrescos, carne, maíz, leche, frijoles, manteca, jabón, salsas, pastas, cubitos, especias, sal, pan, etc. Con  el crédito  espera tener más mercadería que ofrecer a sus clientes para  poder cubrir los pedidos que estos le hacen.
Doña Kelin  con los ingresos obtenidos espera que su condición de vida y la de su familia mejore un poco. En el futuro espera que su negocio sea una  pulpería más grande.
Doña Kelin  sueña con ver a sus hijos y nietos graduados y convertidos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero del  2013
texts.en:
Kelin’s a responsible, honest, hardworking woman living with her husband and their three daughters in a community in southern Honduras; her business is a grocery store.  

Kelin needs the loan to buy soft-drinks, meat, corn, milk, beans, lard, soap, sauces, pasta, bouillon cubes, spices, salt, bread, etc.  With the loan she’ll be able to have more merchandise to offer her customers and be able to fill all the orders they place with her.

With income earned, Kelin hopes her and her family’s living conditions will improve a little.  In future, she hopes her business will be a bigger grocery store.  She dreams with seeing her children and grandchildren graduate and become upstanding citizens with better life opportunities.

Choluteca, Honduras – January, 2013

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for her store.

loans.name: José Francisco

texts.es:
José tiene 44 años de edad, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Tiene 20 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, lo aprendió de sus padres quienes se dedicaron esa actividad productiva. Para comprar los insumos agrícolas para su cultivo de maíz, pipían y chile se desplaza en pick up.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar fertilizantes, herbicidas, foliares para su cultivo de maíz y para comprar chile dulce para sembrar 7,000 metros cuadrados de chile. Así, tendrá los insumos que necesita para realizar sus cultivos y obtener sus cosechas para venderlas y recibir un ingreso para su familia. Su deseo es construir una casa mejor ya que la que tiene es de bahareque.
texts.en:
José is a 44-year old man, married and father of two children. He's been working in agriculture for 20 years, an activity that he learned from his parents. In order to buy the farming inputs he needs to cultivate corn, "pipían" (cushaw) and chili, he uses a pick up. 

He will use the requested loan to Fundación Campo to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and foliar sprays for his corn crop, as well as sweet chili to sow 7,000 sqm of chili. This way he will have the inputs he needs to cultivate and harvest the products to later sell and obtain income for his family. His dream is to build a better house, as his current one is made of bamboo canes plastered with mud.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, weed-killer and foliar sprays for his corn crop, and sweet chili to sow 7,000 sqm of chili.

loans.name: Gladys Margarita

texts.es:
Gladys tiene 49 años de edad, es casada y tiene tres hijos. Tiene 10 años de dedicarse a la venta de refrescos naturales, trabajo que aprendió de una amiga. Antes era empleada en una maquila. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para pagar la colegiatura de dos de sus hijos que iniciaran sus estudios en la universidad y la otra parte para comprar fruta para elaborar los refrescos. Con el dinero podrá enviar a sus hijos a la universidad, que si no fuera por eso difícilmente lo haría y al mismo tiempo que comprara fruta para satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Gladys is 49 years old, married, and has three children.  She has been selling natural drinks for ten years, having learned this from a friend.  She used to be an export factory employee.

She will use some of the money from this loan through Fundación Campo to pay tuition for two of her children who are starting university.  She will use the rest of the money to buy fruit to make her drinks.  The money will allow her to send her children to university.  If it was not for this, she would have a hard time doing it and buying fruit to satisfy her customer demand.

loans.use: to pay tuition and buy supplies.

loans.name: Amparo

texts.es:
Amparo tiene 55 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene un hijo. Ella junto a su compañero de vida se dedican a la agricultura, ella aprendió el trabajo gracias a sus padres. Se levanta a las 4:00 a.m. a preparar el desayuno para dejarle a su hijo para que se vaya para la escuela. Luego ella se va con su compañero de vida para el terreno en donde tiene sus cultivos, para llegar ahí debe caminar unos treinta minutos a pie, regresa a su casa hasta el medio día. Para ir a comprar los insumos tiene que caminar veinticinco minutos a pie hasta el lugar en donde aborda el autobús que hace unos treinta minutos en llegar a la ciudad; luego debe pagar a un carretero para que le traslade los insumos hasta la casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres toretes para engordarlos y para pagar una deuda pendiente. Con el préstamo podrá pagar la deuda pendiente, debido a que por la seguía sus cultivos no fueron muy buenos y con los toretes podrá alimentarlos con el rastrojo que le quedo de la cosecha para engordarlos y venderlos después. Su propósito, es continuar trabajando y ahorrar para construir su casa de ladrillo ya que en la que vive es de adobe y no esta en muy buenas condiciones y ayudarle a su hijo para que estudie hasta la universidad.
texts.en:
Amparo is 55 years old, has a partner and a son. Her and her partner make a living as farmers, a profession she learned thanks to her parents.

Every day, she gets up at 4:00 a.m. to prepare breakfast for her son so he can go to school. Then she and her partner go to the land where they grow their crops, which is a thirty minute walk away. She returns home at midday. To buy supplies, she has to walk for twenty-five minutes to the bus stop, and then take a thirty minute bus ride to the city. She then has to pay a cart driver to take the supplies to her home. 

Amparo is requesting a loan from Fundación Campo to buy three bullocks to fatten and to pay an outstanding debt. With this loan, she can pay the debt she incurred due to a drought which caused her crops to fail. She will feed the bullocks with the remains of her failed harvest in order to fatten then up and then sell them. 

Her aim is to continue working and save up to build a brick house, since her current house is made of adobe and isn't in a very good condition. She also wants to help her son so he can study and go to university.
