loans.use: to buy three young bullocks to fatten and to pay an outstanding debt.

loans.name: Rosa Mercedes

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 17, 12 y 7 años los mismos que estudian dos en colegio y el menor en escuela. El marido trabaja de ayudante de construcción.
 
Doña Rosa al ver que su esposo no gana mucho en su trabajo y que su trabajo no es seguro hace 12 años le dijo que le construyera un pequeño galpón en el cual comenzó a criar pollos, con el paso del tiempo ella ha aumentado su granja y en la actualidad tiene hasta 400 pollos por temporada la misma que dura unos dos meses tiempo en el cual los pollos están listos para la venta, entrega a comerciantes que luego los llevan a sus negocios en los diversos mercados de la ciudad.

Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar pollos, alimentos y medicinas para los pollos para que estos tengan un buen desarrollo. Lleva más de un año en el Banco y le gusta por la ayuda que le dan los créditos.
 
Su sueño es darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The "30 de Agosto" Community Bank meets in the parish of Picoaza in the city of Portoviejo. This region is known for being a very commercial area, for its traditional feasts of San Pedro and San Pablo, and for the warmth of its people.

Señora Rosa lives here. She is 34 years old and has a partner with whom she has three children aged 17, 12 and 7. Two of them study at high school and the youngest studies at primary school. Her partner works as a construction assistant.

Twelve years ago, when Rosa saw that her partner did not earn very much and that his job was unstable, she asked him to build her a small shed, in which she started raising chickens. Over time, she has increased the size of her farm and currently has up to 400 chickens per season. The season lasts around two months, after which the chickens are ready to sell. She sells them to traders, who then take them to their businesses in various markets in the city. 

She will use this new loan to buy chickens, chicken medicines and feed so that they develop properly. She has been a member of the community bank for over a year, and she likes it because of the help it provides through loans.

Her dream is to do the very best she can for her children.

loans.use: to buy chickens, chicken medicines and feed.

loans.name: Carmen Karina

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Carmen, tiene 34 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene dos hijos de 7 y 3 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. El marido es policía.
 
Doña Carmen  es una mujer que le gusta valerse por sí misma y ganar sus propios ingresos para sus gastos y para darles lo mejor a sus hijos, ella tiene un local en su casa en el cual vende artículos de papelería, ropa de todo tipo y zapatos, además también ofrece el servicio de internet, trabaja todos los días en sus diversas actividades ya que ella además de vender en su local también vista a sus clientes ya sea con la intención de vender algo nuevo o también para cobrar ya que deja a crédito y cobra cada quince días, lleva 5 años dedicada al comercio y le va bastante bien.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar más mercadería como: pantalones, blusas, camisetas y ropa de niños.
 
Está en el Banco Comunal desde hace 2 años y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos.
Su sueño es seguir aumentado su negocio.
texts.en:
The “30 de Agosto” communal bank meets in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known for being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for its happy people.

Carmen lives here.  She is 34 years old, is in a common law marriage and has two children, ages 7 and 3.  The older attends school.  Her husband is a policeman.

Carmen likes to value herself and earn her own income for her expenses and in this way provide the best for her children.  She has a place in her home where she sells paper goods, all types of clothing and shoes and also provides internet service.  She works every day and besides selling from her place also visits her customers either to try to sell something new or to collect since she also sells on credit and collects every two weeks.  She’s been doing this for five years and things are going well for her.

She will use the money from this loan to buy more merchandise such as pants, blouses, shirts, and clothing for children.

She has been a member of the bank for two years and she like it because of the quick loans.

Her dream is to continue growing her business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Betsy Adelaida

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Betsy, tiene 22 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 5 y 1 años de edad, el mayor estudia en escuela. Su esposo es mecánico automotriz.
 
Doña Betsy es una muy buena madre y esposa que para ayudar a su marido realiza el crédito para que este lo utilice en su trabajo, él tiene un taller de mecánica automotriz en el cual realiza todo tipo de arreglos a carros y motocicletas. Ella por su parte también se dedica a la venta de ropa de todo tipo el cual lo realiza en sus ratos libres, pero actualmente no está vendiendo ya que está un poco enferma y es por esta razón que este crédito es solo para el trabajo del esposo el cual lo invierte en herramientas y ciertos repuestos que utiliza en sus trabajos.

Este crédito es para comprar repuestos atomotrices y  herramientas que necesita para brindar un mejor servicio. Lleva cinco ciclos en el Banco Comunal y le gusta porque los créditos son rápidos y a muy bajos intereses.
 
Su sueño como toda madre darles lo mejor a sus pequeños.
texts.en:
The “30 de Agosto” communal bank meets in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known as being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the happiness of its people.

Betsy lives here.  She is 22 years old, is married and has two children, ages 5 and 1.  The older attends school and her husband works as an automotive mechanic.

Betsy is a very good mother and wife and is asking for this loan to help her husband so that he can use it in his work.  He has an auto shop where he does all kinds of repairs for cars and motorcycles.  She also sells all types of clothing in her spare time, but she is currently not selling because she is a little sick.  This is the reason this loan will only be for her husband, which he will use to buy tools and certain spare parts that he will use on the job.

She has been with the communal bank for five cycles and she likes it because the loans are easy to get and the interest rates are low.

Her dream, like that of all mothers, is to provide the best for her children.

loans.use: to buy tools and spare parts.

loans.name: Angela Ramona

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Angela, tiene 51 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene cuatro hijos todos mayores de edad, una de sus hijas aun vive en su casa además de 4 nietas que estudian en colegio y escuela. El marido es comerciante. 

Doña Angela tiene un negocio de venta de pollos asados, para lo cual ella alquila un local en el centro de Picoaza, allí trabaja todos los días pero en las tardes y noches que es cuando más clientes llegan hasta su local, allí además de vender pollos Asados  también vende aguado de menudencia el cual es muy apetecido por sus clientes,  bebidas, jugos y gaseosas, ella trabaja con la ayuda de su hija, lleva más de 10 años con este negocio el cual le ha permitido salir adelante.

Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar gaseosas, jugos, pollos y víveres necesarios para preparar los alimentos. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque el grupo es muy unido y confiable.

Su sueño es tener un local propio ya que se le va buena parte de sus ganancias en el pago de arriendos.
texts.en:
The “30 de Agosto” communal bank meets in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known as being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the happiness of its people.

Angela lives here.  She is 51 years old, is in a common law marriage and has four adult children.  One of her daughters still lives at home, and also four granddaughters who attend school.  Her husband is a merchant.

Angela has a business where she sells roast chickens.  She rents a location in downtown Picoaza and works there every day in the evenings and nights which is when she has the most customers.  She also sells tripe soup, which her customers enjoy, drinks, juices, and soft drinks.  Her daughter helps her and she has been doing this for ten years and this business has allowed her to come out ahead.

She will use the money from this loan to buy soft drinks, juices, chickens, and ingredients she needs to prepare her food.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because the group is very united and trusting.  Her dream is to have her own location because a good part of her earnings goes to pay rent.

loans.use: to buy ingredients.

loans.name: Consuelo Margarita

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Consuelo, tiene 43 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen un hijo de 12 años de edad el cual estudia en colegio. Su esposo es comerciante. 

Doña Consuelo es una muy buena esposa que para ayudar a su esposo realiza el crédito para que él lo utilice en su negocio, él se dedica al comercio, vende productos para el hogar como: planchas, platos, ollas, licuadoras, entre otros productos, para lo cual todos los días se desplaza a otras ciudades en especial a los campos lugares donde más ventas realiza, él deja a crédito y cobra cada ocho días, lleva más de 20 años dedicado a este tipo de negocio  con lo cual ha sacado adelante a su familia.
 
Este crédito lo va emplear en comprar planchas, licuadoras, ollas, platos, entre otros productos que el vende. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio  y le gusta porque con los créditos ella ayuda a su esposo.

Su sueño es tener un local en el centro de la ciudad.
texts.en:
The “30 de Agosto” communal bank meets in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known as being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the happiness of its people.

Consuelo lives here.  She is 43 years old, married and has a 12 year old son who attends school  Her husband is a merchant.

Consuelo is a good wife and is asking for this loan to help her husband.  He is a merchant and sells household products such as irons, plates, pots, blenders, and other things.  Each day he travels to other towns and to the country where he makes the most sales.  He sells on credit and collects every week.  He’s been doing this for 20 years and gets his family ahead with this business.

He will use this loan to buy irons, blenders, pots, plates, and other products that he sells.  [Consuelo] has been in the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because she can help her husband.

Her dream is to have her own shop in the city center.

loans.use: to buy inventory.

loans.name: Rosa Ines

texts.es:
El Banco Comunal 30 de Agosto se reúne en la parroquia Picoaza de la ciudad de Portoviejo. Lugar conocido por ser una zona muy comercial, por sus fiestas tradicionales de San Pedro y San Pablo y por la alegría de su gente.

En este lugar vive la señora Rosa. Tiene 39 años de edad, mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene tres hijos de 15, 12 y 10 años, los dos mayores estudian en colegio y el menor en escuela. Su marido es chofer particular.

Doña Rosa es una mujer muy independiente que le gusta valerse por sí misma y así obtener sus propios ingresos, para ello  se dedica a la venta de todo tipo de ropa, su forma de venta es bajo pedido, tiene muchos clientes que le piden sus productos ya que les da facilidades de pago, ella cobra los fines de semana lo cual es una ventaja ya que al cobrar realiza nuevas ventas. Trabaja los fines de semana casi todo el día con la ayuda de su esposo. La mercadería va a comprar una vez al mes a Guayaquil ya que allá hay más variedad de productos.
 
Este crédito lo va a utilizar para comprar ropa de damas y caballeros. Esta desde el inicio en el Banco Comunal y le gusta por la ayuda que siempre le dan con los créditos. 

Su sueño es comprar un carro para realizar sus ventas.
texts.en:
The “30 de Agosto” communal bank meets in the Picoaza parish of the city of Portoviejo, a place known as being a very commercial zone, for its traditional San Pedro and San Pablo festivals, and for the happiness of its people.

Rosa lives here.  She is 39 years old, in a common law marriage and has three children, ages 15, 12, and 10.  The two oldest attend school and the youngest attends elementary school.  Her husband is a private driver.

Rosa is a very independent woman who likes to earn her own income and sells all kinds of clothing to order.  She has many customers who request her products because of her easy payment terms.  She collects on the weekend which is advantageous because she makes more sales.  She works on the weekends almost all day with her husband’s help.  She buys her merchandise in Guayaquil where there is a greater variety of products.

She will use the money from this loan to buy men and women’s clothing.  She has been with the communal bank since the beginning and she likes it because of the loans.

Her dream is to buy a car so she can make her sales.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Met's Group

texts.en:
Met resides in a rural village of the Ek Phnom district, Battambang province. She is aged 32 years and a widow. She has two children to take care of, one of whom is in school. To support the family, she has been struggling in cultivating rice and watermelons, and fishing, for 15 years. Sometimes, she works for others for a wage, to earn additional income. Currently, she earns about 57,000KHR per day to meet her family’s needs, and she can save about 17,000KHR each day, after daily living expenses. 

Met has been with VisionFund for two loan cycles, while the other member of her group is just with VisionFund this cycle. The previous loans have helped her to better support her family's living conditions.

Now Met is leading her group of two, to seek a loan of 1,400,000KHR and 1,000,000KHR, respectively. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy fertilizer for her crops. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her rice and watermelons timely and fruitfully, so as to make a better living and keep her child in school.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer for her rice and watermelon crops.

loans.name: Phal

texts.en:
Phal is a 42 year old married mother with five children.  She is originally from a rural village of the Tbaung Khmum district of Kampong Cham province.  All of her children are dependents - two are still in school while the remaining three help with the family’s business. 

For the past twenty years, the main source of her family's income has come from rice farming and cassava planting.  To better support the family and earn more money, Phal's husband works for others.  Together, Phal and her husband can earn about 28,000 KHR per day to meet the family’s needs.  Of this amount, they manage to save about 13,000 KHR each day for the future. 

This is the second microloan for Phal with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund.  She has completely repaid the first loan, which helped her to improve her living conditions. Now Phal is requesting a new loan.  With this loan, she will buy fertilizer for her farmland and a decent motor for her family.  She hopes this loan will enable her to get a high crop yield from her rice paddy.  The motor will help her family in their commute.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sok

texts.en:
A citizen from a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Tbaung Khmum district, Sok is aged 39 years and married with three children, all of whom are dependents and still in school. 

To make a living and support her family, Sok and her husband have been farming rice and planting cassava as a primary business for several years. The current business earns about 25,000 KHR per day, and Sok manages to save about 10,000 KHR each day after daily expenses. 

Sok has been with VisionFund for one cycle and fully repaid the previous loan. The previous loan has helped her to better support her rice paddy in a timely way. 

Now Sok is seeking a new loan of 4,000,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to renovate her old house. She hopes this loan will enable her to have a proper house for her family to live in.

loans.use: to renovate her old house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Pheng's Group

texts.en:
Pheng, age 49, is the leader of this group of two borrowers living in a rural village in Kampong Cham province’s Ponhea Krek district. She and her husband have seven children, four of whom are still dependent on her and one of whom is still in school. Pheng and her husband earn a living through farming rice on two and a half hectares of farmland and growing cassava on two hectares of farmland. They have earned an income through this activity for 28 years. The current business earns Pheng about 29,000 KHR per day and she manages to save about 9,000 KHR each day for the family's future needs.

Pheng is requesting her second microloan with VisionFund. She and her fellow borrower are requesting a loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. Pheng is going to use her loan funds to pay for labor fees for harvesting her rice and will use a portion of it to buy fertilizer for her cassava planting. She hopes to increase more crop yield from her plantation business, improve her standard of living, and keep her child in school.

loans.use: to pay labor fees for harvesting rice

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sarim's Group

texts.en:
Sarim is age 53 and widowed with two children. She is a rice farmer who has been in the business for 35 years to make a living. She supplements the family’s income by working for others for a fee. With the current business, she can earn about 10,000 riels (KHR) per day to meet the family’s needs and is able to save about 3,000 KHR each day for future needs.

Sarim’s group consists of three members who are just [starting] with VisionFund this cycle. Sarim is leading the group to ask for a loan. She is going to use her portion to buy seeds for growing vegetables to earn additional income for the family. She hopes this loan will enable her to grow her vegetables in time to sell them for a good price to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy seeds for growing vegetables

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ou Reang Ov district

loans.name: Gift Keko Flat Group

texts.en:
Kasimu, who is in his early 30s, is married with one son who is still going to school.  He has had a Barber Shop since 2002.  He works from 8:00 am to 10:00 pm daily and is able to make a fair monthly profit.

This will be Kasimu's 10th loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  He used the previous loans to buy a plot and build a small house and to buy salon equipment, which has made the salon look attractive and have meet a high standard.  He is doing really well because he can now attract more customers. He also paid school fees for his son, covered household expenses and has paid back all of his loans successfully. He hopes for a loan to repaint the salon, to buy more salon equipment and to buy a decoder.  His dream is to one day be able to build more rooms on his house.

Kasimu will share this loan with his loan group "GIFT KEKO FLAT", which has 16 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to repaint the salon, to buy more salon equipment and to buy a decoder.

loans.name: Al-Aql Group

texts.en: The Al-aql group are 4 ladies, who applied for a loan of 120,000 YER. They live in Taiz, Yemen. Faiza is the leader of this group. She is a housewife who feels tired of meeting the household needs. She is in a bad situation but tries her best to raise her children well. She has applied for loan to buy a home appliance to use in her house.

loans.use: to buy home appliance to use for house.

loans.name: Irma

texts.en: Irma, 37 years old, is married and lives with her husband, parents-in-law, two children and the child of her sister-in-law. The family's main source of income is agriculture. They own a plot of the land, where they grow potatoes, maize and haricots. The harvested products are sold locally. Irma is a very hardworking young woman with a great desire to get ahead. Irma requested a loan for the purchase of a milk cow. The family will start a dairy business which will allow Irma to produce cheese. The cheese will be sold at the local open market and this will increase the family income. Irma plans to make some savings and invest in the further development of her farming activities.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Somam

texts.en:
Somam had a difficult time after her husband's business failed. She decided to work with her husband and to support her family for a better future. Ten years ago she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. 

However, due to lack of availability of funds she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is married and provides for her two children. She is currently in her second loan cycle and has borrowed Rs 10,000 from Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy more spools of threads with the packs of buttons, laces and zippers in various colors. This will allow her to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income.

loans.use: to buy more spools of threads with the packs of buttons, laces, and zippers in various colors .

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en: Ms. Nazia had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. She decided to initiate her own business to support her family for a better future. Two years ago, she began stitching work in her house. She stitches for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to the lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. She is married and provides for three children. She is currently in her 6th loan cycle and has borrowed 40,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation. She intends to use this loan amount to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers to create a means of increasing her revenues so that she may be able to generate a higher income.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, including cloth, threads of different colors, laces and zippers.

loans.name: Sughran

texts.en:
Ms. Sughran is 44 years old and the mother of six children. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing and health. She has had a shoemaking business with the support of her husband for many years. The man shown in the photo is Sughran’s husband. They have become famous in her community for providing the best quality shoes of various designs and colors. They maintain a regular list of customers.

Sughran has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. She is in her second loan cycle now. She requested a loan of 30,000 Pakistani rupees to buy additional material for shoes including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles, etc. In this way, they can handle the growing demand for their shoes in the market and can better support their family.

loans.use: to buy additional material for making shoes including leather, artificial leather and plastic soles, etc.

loans.name: Afshan

texts.en:
Ms. Afshan is a 33-year-old married woman and a mother of eight children. She is striving hard to meet their needs, including food, clothing, and health. Her husband is employed in a small industry, but his income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. Afshan started her business to contribute to the family income. She has been in the business of sewing for many years and is very familiar with the stitching techniques. 

She initiated her business with the support of Kashf Foundation; she took her first loan to buy a sewing machine. At present, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She requested a loan of 35,000 PKR to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc. Then she would be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She is in her third loan cycle. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good-quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of threads of different colors, buttons, needles, etc.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Ms. Naseem is a 34-year-old married woman and a mother of six children. The man shown in the photo is Naseem’s husband, whose profession is driving. He has been driving a three-wheeled auto-rickshaw for many years to meet the family expenses. Naseem has applied for a loan of 20,000 PKR from Kashf Foundation for her husband. He wants to buy new tires for his vehicle. Naseem is hopeful that this will help her husband drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. She dreams of providing quality education to her children for their bright and prosperous future.

loans.use: to buy new tires for her husband's vehicle

loans.name: Noor

texts.en:
Ms. Noor had a difficult time after her husband's business failure. Two years ago, she began a beauty parlor in her house for people living around her house. She uses her income to support her entire family. She offers many services like hair cutting, makeup and facials to her customers. She has become very famous in her street by providing best services. As customers' demands are increasing day by day, she is interested in buying a variety of cosmetics products for the parlor. However, these days she is facing a financial problem of low cash on hand. This compelled her to contact Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. 

Ms. Noor needs a loan of 20,000 Pakistani rupees (PKR) to buy more products for hair treatments and skin care and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities. She is hoping to attract more customers over time which will ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to buy more products for hair treatment and skin care and bleaching and whitening creams in large quantities.

loans.name: Maqsood

texts.en:
Mrs Maqsood is a 35-year-old, married woman. She is very talented and excels in the work of stitching. She has years of experience in this field and earns enough to lead a decent life. She has four children, three of them are school-going. She is striving hard to meet their demands, including food, clothing, and education. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family, so she started her business to contribute to the family income. 

In order to fill the customers’ orders on time, she requested a loan of PKR 20,000 to buy a stock of thread, with packs of buttons, lace, and needles. With these supplies, she should be able to meet the demands of her customers, without fail.  She hopes to grow her business, and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy a stock of thread, with packs of buttons, lace, and needles.

loans.name: Nosheen

texts.en:
Ms. Nosheen is a 31-year-old married woman. She has four children; two of them are going to school. She is striving hard to meet their demands including food, clothing and education. Her husband’s income is not sufficient to meet the daily expenditures of the family. She started her business to contribute to the family income.

Ms. Nosheen has had a sewing business for 12 years. She is well familiar with stitching techniques. By this time, she enjoys a great client list and has gained a lot of appreciation and popularity in her community. She requested a loan of 15,000 Pakistani rupees to buy stock of thread and packs of buttons, laces and needles. So then she will be able to meet the demands of her customers without fail. She hopes to grow her business and dreams of giving a good and quality education to her children through all her hard work in her business.

loans.use: to buy stock of thread and packs of buttons, laces and needles.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en:
Mrs Nasreen is a 43-year-old, married woman. She has been successfully running a small general store for two years. She is a mother of two children; one is school-going. She is motivated to provide her children with good-quality food, clothing and education.

Nasreen wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of PKR 30,000 to buy packs of salt, cookies and beverages. In this way, she should be able to meet the increasing demand at her store, consistently. She has been in association with Kashf for three years. She is expecting a boost in her earnings and dreaming of expanding her business even more, in the future.

loans.use: to buy packs of salt, cookies and beverages.

loans.name: Ana Mirian

texts.es:
Ana tiene 41 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijos. Ella vive con su hijo y su esposo que trabaja impartiendo clases de música y su hija trabaja como despachadora de productos.  Ella se dedica a realizar los desayunos en la escuela para los estudiantes y posiblemente también preparara los almuerzos.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para reparar el vehiculo que poseen para trasladar la mercadería para preparar la comida y la otra parte la utilizara para cancelar un saldo pendiente con la Fundación. Con el vehiculo en buen estado se le hace más fácil trasladar la mercadería y mas cómodamente. A ella le gustaría estudiar un curso de cocina intensivo, para que le otorguen un certificado y ser cocinera titulada.
texts.en:
Ana, age 41, is in a relationship and has two children.  She lives with her son and her husband, who works by giving music classes.  Her daughter works as a product dispatcher.

Ana makes breakfasts for the students at a school, and she will also possibly make the lunches.

The loan that she is requesting from the Fundación Campo is to repair the vehicle that they have to transport the materials to prepare the food.  She will use the other part to pay an outstanding balance with the Fundación.  With the vehicle in good condition, it will be easier and more comfortable to transport the materials.  

She would like to take an intensive cooking course in order to receive a certificate and to be a professionally qualified cook.

loans.use: to repair the vehicle that they have to transport the materials to prepare food.  She will use the other part to pay an outstanding balance with the Fundación.

loans.name: Patricia Lisseth

texts.es:
Patricia tiene 22 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos niñas, una de cinco años y otra de cuatro años de edad. Su esposo trabaja como empleado en una quesera desde hace más de tres años; ella se dedica a realizar los oficios domésticos en su casa y a la crianza de cerdos desde hace unos cinco años. Ella cometa que nunca le gusto cuidar animales, pero su esposo poco a poco le fue delegando responsabilidades hasta el día de hoy que ella misma dice que le encanta este trabajo; pues ha encontrado una forma de ingresos para el hogar, ya que de este trabajo pago un crédito para construir su casa. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar cuatro cerdos, alimento, medicina y el resto para preparar 7,000 metros cuadrados de terreno en donde cultivara pipían o maíz. Actualmente, tiene dos cerdos de 3 meses de edad, los cuales venderá y se quedara engordando los 4 que comprara con el crédito. Lo que le permitirá obtener un buen ingreso para su familia y realizara la siembra de granos para consumo de la familia. 

Su proyecto, es proporcionar el estudio a sus hijas y construir una habitación más a la casa, ya que sus hijas van creciendo.
texts.en:
Patricia is 22 years old. She is married and has two girls who are five and four years old. Her husband has worked in a cheese factory for more than three years, while she takes care of the household chores and in addition, she has been raising pigs for five years. She recognizes that she did not like to take care of the animals before, but her husband started giving her more and more responsibilities; she now says that she loves this job, since it is a good way to earn money for her family and to pay for a loan she took to build their house.

She is requesting a loan at Fundación Campo to buy four pigs, feed and medicine and also to prepare 7,000 square meters of land to grow either pipían [a type of squash] or corn. She has currently two pigs that are three months old. She will sell them and keep the ones she will buy with the money from the loan, which will result in good income for her family. The crops will be for the family’s own consumption.

Her project is to pay for her daughters’ studies and build one more room in her house, now that they are growing.

loans.use: to buy four pigs, feed and medicine, and to prepare the land for growing corn or squash.

loans.name: Kisiwani Group

texts.en:
Maria, who is in her early 30s, is married. She has been running a charcoal business for one year now.  She works from 7:00 a.m. to 7:00 p.m. daily and is able to make a small monthly profit.

This will be Maria's first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She wants to use the loan for buying more sacks of charcoal. Her dream is to one day be able to start a poultry business.

Maria will share this loan with her loan group "Kisiwani" with 11 members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of charcoal.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
Ángela María de 29 años de edad es una mujer emprendedora, que desea un mejor futuro para ella y su hijo de 4 años de edad. Labora diariamente en una casa de apuestas, pero su salario no alcanza a cubrir sus necesidades y la educación de su pequeño, por lo cual tomó la determinación de invertir parte de su salario en la compra y cría de pollos de engorde, los cuales distribuye a una tienda cercana. De esta manera Ángela combina las dos actividades. 
Con el dinero extra que genera ha podido mejorar las condiciones de vida de su familia. Su gran sueño es poder comprar vivienda propia y expandir su nuevo negocio con el propósito de dedicarse de lleno a esta actividad y tener más tiempo para compartir con su hijo. Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el que desea comprar 120 pollos de engorde, cuido y realizar algunas adecuaciones al galpón. Con esta inversión espera generar mayores ingresos y dar la cuota inicial para su vivienda.
texts.en:
Ángela María is 29 years old and is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to create a better future for herself and her four year old son.  She works daily in a betting hall but her salary is not enough to cover her needs and those for her son’s education, so she was determined to invest part of her salary and buy chickens to raise and sell to a nearby store.  In this way she can combine both activities.

She has been able to use the extra money to improve her family’s living conditions.  Her great dream is to be able to buy her own home and expand her new business so she can dedicate herself fully to this and have time to spend with her son.  She is asking for this loan so that she can buy 120 chicks to raise and make some improvements to the coup.  She will use the money to increase her income and make her first house payment.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: Arturo De Jesús

texts.es:
Arturo de 55 años de edad reside en la vereda Albania, en donde se dedica a la cría de cerdos como medio de sustento para su familia compuesta por su esposa y sus dos hijos menores de edad.
Arturo agradece a Dios por su salud y la oportunidad que le regala cada día de abrir sus ojos y tener la fuerza para trabajar y ofrecerle a su familia lo mejor. Desea poder proyectarse como un gran empresario y poder expandir la cría,  levante y venta de cerdos con el fin de mejorar su situación económica.
Con el fin de lograr su sueño se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de cuido para el engorde de 14 lechones. Espera poder venderlos a un buen precio para comprarle a sus hijos los útiles escolares para ingresar a la escuela.
texts.en: Arturo, 55, lives in a section of the village of Albania where he works raising pigs as a way to support his family composed of his wife and two minor children.  Arturo thanks God for his health and for the opportunity He gives him daily of opening his eyes and having the strength to work and offer his family the best.  He wants to be able to become a great businessman and be able to expand his litter size successfully raising and selling more pigs in order to improve his economic situation.  Aiming at reaching his dream, he’s seeking financing to buy feed to fatten up 14 pigs he hopes to then sell at a good price in order to buy his children the school supplies they need to start school.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten up 14 pigs.

loans.name: Henry Norberto

texts.es:
Henry de 26 años de edad, es un joven emprendedor que ha buscado los medios para salir adelante. Es de procedencia campesina, pero la agricultura nunca fue su fuerte por lo cual buscó otras oportunidades de empleo hasta que conoció un amigo que le enseñó el proceso de las artesanías y posteriormente perfeccionó su habilidad en un instituto. A pesar de todas las luchas e inconvenientes para montar su negocio, hoy es una realidad, cuenta con 25 referencias diferentes de productos.
Esta actividad le ha permitido mejorar su situación económica y ayudarles a sus padres con los gastos del hogar.
Su mayor sueño es poder abrir un local para comercializar sus productos y enseñarles este arte a otras personas debido a que en su municipio no existen artesanos. Henry es un fiel convencido de que su labor es más que un trabajo; es identidad Colombiana y no puede dejarse extinguir.
Con el propósito de seguir elaborando sus productos, Henry se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito para la compra de materia prima debido a que no cuenta con recursos para invertir.
texts.en:
Henry, 26, is a young entrepreneur who has looked for ways to get ahead.  He’s from an agricultural background but he had no luck with agriculture which is why he looked for other sources of employment until he met a friend who taught him crafts and he later attended courses in an institute to hone his skills.  Despite all the struggles and inconveniences to set up his business, today it’s a reality.  He has 25 different product references.  This activity has made it possible for him to improve his economic situation and to help his parents with household expenses.

His greatest dream is to open a store to sell his products and to teach this art to others since there are no craftspeople in his town.  Henry is totally convinced that his work is more than a job; it’s Colombia’s identity and cannot be allowed to die out.

With the goal of continuing making his products, Henry is looking for a loan to buy raw materials because he does not have the resources needed for this investment.

loans.use: to buy raw material that he needs for making his handicrafts

loans.name: Henry De Jesús

texts.es:
Henry de 47 años de edad, es un fiel amante a la fotografía, desde niño  siempre soñó con convertirse en fotógrafo profesional y aunque su sueño se frustró en muchas ocasiones, logró cumplirlo a pesar de la marea que jugaba en su contra. Hoy se dedica a la fotografía en un pequeño local ubicado en el municipio de Fredonia, Colombia, el cual administra y conjuga con otras actividades como la venta de papelería, dulces y licor.
Siente que a pesar de tantas frustraciones que le tocó vivir, la vida lo recompensó ofreciéndole la oportunidad de convertirse en un buen administrador y eso lo hace feliz. En la actualidad se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de surtido y licor para cubrir su stock y poder ofrecer un mejor servicio. Espera que las ventas se incrementen y le generen mayores ingresos para comprarles a sus dos hijos los uniformes y útiles escolares para el regreso a clases.
texts.en: Henry, 47, loves photography.  Since he was a boy he’s dreamed of becoming a professional photographer and although his dream was often frustrated he managed to attain it despite the uphill battle reaching it required.  Today, he works in photography in a small studio located in the town of Fredonia, Colombia that he manages in conjunction with other activities like selling office supplies, candy and liquor.  He feels that despite all the frustrations he had to go through life rewarded him by giving him the opportunity of becoming a good manager which makes him happy.  He currently needs a loan to buy basic stock merchandise and liquor and be able to provide better customer service.  He hopes that sales will increase and generate higher income so he can buy his two children their school uniforms and school supplies for the return to classes.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise and liquor.

loans.name: Reyes Eduardo

texts.es:
Don Reyes tiene 38 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Desde muy pequeño aprendió el trabajo de la agricultura junto con su padre y sus hermanos. Cuando cumplió la mayoría de edad, empezó a trabajar independientemente y con un amigo inicio a comprar y vender bovinos hace unos 10 años.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar bovinos y luego venderlos. Con la venta de los bovinos tendrá dinero disponible, para los gastos del hogar y para brindar el estudio a sus hijos.
texts.en: Reyes, 38, is married and has three children.  Since he was very little he learned to work in agriculture with his father and brothers.  When he became of age, he started to work independently and started to buy and sell cattle with a friend about 10 years ago.  The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy cattle for subsequent resale.  With the sale of cattle he’ll have money available to cover household expenses and pay for his children’s schooling.

loans.use: to buy cattle for subsequent resale.

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.es:
Magdalena de 45 años, asegura que lo más importante para ella es el bienestar de sus tres hijos menores de edad. Razón por la cual se esfuerza para generar los recursos económicos que le aseguren a su familia una calidad de vida. Diariamente se levanta muy temprano a realizar las labores del hogar y posteriormente se dedica al cuidado de pollos y a la venta de mecatos y cerveza en la sala de su casa. Estas dos actividades la han permitido garantizarles a sus hijos educación y alimento.
Hoy se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de 100 pollos, cuido de engorde y surtido, especialmente cerveza, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas y generar mejores ingresos para el sostenimiento de su hogar.
texts.en:
Magdalena is 45 years old and tells us that the most important thing for her is her children’s wellbeing, so she works hard to generate the income she needs to ensure that her family had a good quality of life.  She gets up very early every day to do the household chores and then cares for her chickens and later sells cakes and beers from her living room.  These two businesses have allowed her to feed her children and provide for their education.

She is asking for this loan so she can buy 100 chicks to raise.  She will also buy inventory, especially beers so that she can increase her sales and generate more income to support her home.

loans.use: to buy chicks.

loans.name: María Teresa

texts.es:
María de 43 años, es madre de dos hijos menores de edad, por los cuales vela a fin de ofrecerles mejores condiciones de vida. Reside en una pequeña vereda realizando oficios domésticos en una finca. Hace tres años su patrón le prestó un lote para que realizara sembrados y pudiera generar dinero extra. Con esta oportunidad María no dudó en incrementar sus ingresos, por lo cual decidió sembrar cebolla. Su mayor reto ha sido luchar contra los precios de venta debido a que son muy inestables y en ocasiones no genera una buena rentabilidad. Debido a esta incertidumbre ha optado por asumir una actividad más, elaborar arepas que vende a sus vecinos y distribuye dentro del área urbana.
Su mayor sueño es poder acceder a una parcela más grande para realizar sembrados a escala y obtener mejores ingresos que permita ofrecerles a sus dos hijos una buena educación.  A si mismo incrementar su producción y venta de arepas. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una motocicleta que le permita transportar sus arepas hasta el pueblo, una parrilla, materia prima e insumos de abono y riego para la siembra de cebolla.
texts.en:
María is a 43-year old woman and mother of two minor children, whom she watches over with an aim to provide them with a better quality of life. She lives in a small lane and does domestic work in a plantation. Three years ago, her boss lent a piece of land to her so that she could cultivate and earn some extra money. María seized this opportunity to increase her income and decided to cultivate onions. Her biggest challenge have been selling prices, which are very unstable and occasionally don't have a good return. Given to this uncertainty, she has decided to pursue another activity: to make "arepas" (corn tortillas), sell them to her neighbors and distribute them within the urban area. 

Her biggest dream is to have access to a larger plot, cultivate large scale and obtain a higher income. This would allow her to provide her two children with a good education. She also seeks to increase her production and sales of arepas. She plans to use the requested loan to buy a motorcycle to carry the arepas to the town, a grill, raw materials, and fertilizer and irrigation supplies for the onion crop.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to carry "arepas" (corn tortillas).

loans.name: José Alfredo

texts.es:
Don José tiene 30 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos de 14, 12 y 4 años respectivamente. Desde hace 8 años se dedica al oficio de estructuras metálicas, su padre fue quien le enseño. Su esposa instalo una tienda en la casa hace unos dos años, vende pupusas los domingos y lava los uniformes de los jugadores de fútbol. 


El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar mercadería para la tienda y para reparar una pulidora que necesita para desempeñar su trabajo. Con la inversión, surtirá la tienda, ya que actualmente es poco lo que ofrecen a los clientes y la demanda es bastante y no dan abasto, más adelante don José quiere comprar otro aparato para soldar.
texts.en:
José, 30, is married and has three children who are 14, 12 and 4 years old respectively.  For the last 8 years he’s been working on metal structures; his father taught him.  His wife opened a grocery store at home about two years ago and sells ‘pupusas’ [filled, grilled corncakes] on Sundays and washes football players’ uniforms.

The loan he’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy stock merchandise for the store and to repair a polisher he needs for work.  With this investment he’ll stock the store since they currently have little stock available to offer customers and demand is high and they can’t meet it.  Later on, José would like to buy another soldering machine.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store and to repair his polisher.

loans.name: Alba Nelia

texts.es:
Alba de 43 años de edad es una mujer llena de sueños por cumplir. Hace 6 años inicio en compañía de un socio la creación de una panadería, la cual ha logrado sostener en el tiempo, pero no le ha dado el resultado esperado por la falta de inversión. Motivada por la alta demanda y la poca oferta que su negocio puede ofrecer a sus clientes, Alba se encuentra solicitando un crédito para el pago de una obligación y la compra de insumos con el fin de mejorar las ventas, ya que su socio desistió del negocio y lo cedió en su totalidad.

Su mayor sueño es ver crecer su microempresa y que pueda alcanzar el punto de equilibrio, ya que de este negocio depende su estabilidad económica y la de su familia. Desea poder mejorar su calidad de vida y no tener que padecer ningún tipo de necesidad.
texts.en:
Alba, 43, is a woman with many dreams to reach.  Six years ago together with a partner she opened a bakery that she’s managed to keep open during this time but has not had the desired results due to lack of investment.  Motivated by high demand but low supply her business can offer customers, Alba is looking for credit to repay a loan and to buy supplies in order to improve sales since her partner has left the business leaving it entirely to her.

Her greatest dream is to see her micro business grow and reach stability since her and her family’s economic stability depends on this business.  She wants to be able to improve her quality of life and not have to suffer any type of want.

loans.use: to buy baking supplies.

loans.name: Alberto De Jesús

texts.es:
Alberto de 55 años de edad se ha dedicado a las labores del campo desde su niñez, allí aprendió a sembrar la tierra y a ganarse el pan de cada día. Después de la muerte de su padre, heredó una pequeña parcela en donde decidió sembrar café, actividad que le ha permitido generar el sustento para su familia.  Su gran sueño es poder ampliar el área de cultivo  para aumentar sus ingresos y mejorar la calidad de vida en su hogar. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de abonos y fungicidas con el propósito de sacar una producción de calidad y con mejores opciones de venta, que le permitan generar mayores ingresos que beneficiarán a su familia.
Uno de sus grandes retos ha sido sacar sus cultivos adelante frente a las inclemencias del clima que en ocasiones amenaza con destruir el sembrado.
Desea poder ofrecerle a su hijo menor la oportunidad de ingresar a la universidad para que se prepare y tenga mejores oportunidades.
texts.en:
Alberto, 55, has worked in the fields since childhood; he learned to plant and to earn his daily bread there.  After his father’s death he inherited a small parcel of land where he decided to grow coffee, an activity that’s made it possible for him to generate his family’s support.  His great dream is to expand the growing acreage in order to increase income and improve his home’s quality of life.

He’s currently asking for a loan to buy manure and fungicide to produce quality crop yield with better sales options that will lead to higher income that will benefit his family.  

One of his great challenges is to produce harvest despite the bad weather that sometimes threatens to destroy his crops.  He wants to be able to offer his youngest son the opportunity of entering university so he can become prepared and have better opportunities.

loans.use: to buy manure and fungicide.

loans.name: Cesar Baudillio

texts.es:
Cesar de 42 años de edad, es considerado en su municipio como un hombre trabajador y disciplinado. Cuenta que inició en el negocio de la venta de Gas propano como vendedor, ganando comisión por ventas, al ver que el negocio era rentable decidió invertir sus ahorros en esta actividad. En la actualidad genera empleo a 3 personas que le ayudan con las ventas y la distribución.
Su mayor anhelo es poder ampliar su capacidad de venta y consolidarse su empresa. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de gas, con el fin de cubrir la demanda de su localidad. 

Sus dos hijos de 9 y 5 años de edad han sido su mayor motivación, “es por ellos que laboro fuertemente cada día con el propósito de ofrecerles un mejor futuro y mejores oportunidades”con estas palabras culmina Cesar su historia.
texts.en:
Cesar, 42, is considered in his town to be a very hardworking, disciplined man.  He relates that he started his business selling propane gas as a vendor earning sales commissions.  Seeing that the business was profitable, he decided to invest his savings in it.  He currently generates employment for three people that help him with sales and distribution.

His greatest dream is to be able to expand sales capacity and to become a well-positioned business.  Because of this he’s looking for a loan to buy gas in order to meet local demand.

His two children who are 9 and 5 years of age have been his greatest motivation.  Cesar concludes his store with these words: “I work hard for them every day aiming at providing them a better future and better opportunities.”

loans.use: to by propane.

loans.name: Maria Lucelly

texts.es: Lucelly de 59 años de edad, es sinónimo  de pujanza y valentía, después de sufrir la separación con su esposo y con tres hijos a cargo, el menor de ellos con síndrome de down, está mujer lucho con fuerza y sin desistir por sacar a su familia adelante. Optó por solicitar un crédito y dedicarse a la venta de ropa, actividad que no le demandaba mucho tiempo y que podía realizar debido a que su hijo menor requiere de cuidados especiales que solo ella puede brindarle. “Dios ha sido siempre mi mayor amigo y fiel padre, gracias a su amor y misericordia, nunca les ha faltado a mis hijos el pan para comer” con estas palabras Lucelly expresa su gratitud con la vida por las oportunidades que Dios le ha dado para laborar y sacar a su familia adelante. Su mayor sueño es poder mejorar su condición económica y ofrecerle a su hijo una vida digna y feliz. Por esta razón se encuentra solicitando un crédito que invertirá en la compra de mercancía y una vitrina para adecuar mejor su negocio en la sala de su casa, con la esperanza de un presente mejor.
texts.en: Lucelly is 59 years old and is synonymous with strength and courage, after having suffered separation from her husband.  She has three children to care for.  The youngest has downs syndrome and this women worked really hard to get her family ahead.  She decided to ask for a loan and sell clothing, a business that does not require much time and that she can do, given her youngest son’s special needs that only she can provide for.  “God has always been my greatest friend and loyal father.  Thanks to his help and mercy, my children have never been in need of their daily bread.”  With these words Lucelly expresses her gratitude for life because of the opportunities that God has given her to work and get her family ahead.  Her greatest dream is to improve her financial situation and provide her son with a happy and dignified life.  For this reason she is asking for a loan that she will use to buy merchandise and a display case to improve her business in her living room.  She is hoping for a better life.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Victor Daniel

texts.es:
Víctor de 21 años de edad es un joven emprendedor que se dedica al negocio familiar, creado por su padre después de una crisis económica. Labora diariamente de 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde y posteriormente se dirige a la universidad. Sus ganas de ver a su familia unida y con una mejor condición económica es su mejor aliciente para seguir luchando por convertir el negocio en una gran fami-empresa. En la actualidad se encuentra en búsqueda de un crédito que invertirá en la compra de legumbre y surtido en general con el fin de aumentar el volumen de ventas y obtener mayores ingresos que le permitan mejorar la condición de vida en su hogar. 
Su mayor sueño es convertirse en un gran administrador con el propósito de crear su propio negocio y abrir nuevas sucursales que permitan emplear a otras personas.
texts.en:
Victor is 21 years old and he is a young entrepreneur who works the family business that his father started after a financial crisis.  He works daily from 8:00 am to 2:00 pm and then attends university.  His desire to see his family united with better financial conditions is his best reason to keep working to transform his business into a grand family company.  He is looking for a loan that he will use to buy vegetables and general merchandise so that he can increase his sales and obtain greater income that will allow him to improve the conditions in his home.

His greatest dream is to become a great manager and create his own business and open branches so that he can provide jobs for others.

loans.use: to stock his store.

loans.name: Fé Y Alegría  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Fe y Alegría se encuentra constituido por 9 socias y 1 socio quienes día a día trabajan en diferentes actividades económicas las mismas que les permiten mejorar su estabilidad económica y sacar adelante a sus familias. Viven en la ciudad de Cuenca, esta ciudad se encuentra bañada por 4 ríos los mismo que le dan el nombre la Santa Ana de los 4 ríos, es desde Diciembre de 1999 Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, su arquitectura colonial le traslada a quienes la visitan al pasado, su gastronomía es muy variada y cautiva el paladar de sus visitantes.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Trancito, forma parte de este banco comunal desde hace 2 años, le gusta la banca comunal porque en cada reunión se unen cada vez los lasos de amistad con todas las socias.

La Señora. Trancito tiene 45 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 4 hijos de 27, 24, 22 y 18 años de edad, sus dos primeros hijos son casados y viven independientes, su tercer hijo trabajo y le ayuda económicamente, su último hijo pasa en casa. Su esposo labora en su hogar ya que se encuentra jubilado, no tienen casa propia por lo que viven arrendando. 

Doña Trancito es una mujer luchadora y emprendedora ya que hace 3 años trabaja en la preparación y venta de comida, labora de lunes a viernes desde las 7 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, por las tardes trabaja como empleada privada desde hace 8 años. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una vajilla y víveres para la realización de sus productos.
texts.en:
The “Fe y Alegría” communal bank is made up of nine ladies and one gentleman who work day to day in different businesses that allow them to improve their financial stability and get their families ahead.  They live in Cuenca, a city bathed by four rivers, the same ones who give it the name “Santa Ana of the Four Rivers.”  It’s been a World Heritage Site since December 1999.  Its colonial architecture transports visitors into the past and its food is varied and captures its visitors’ pallets.

Trancito is one of the group’s members and has formed part of this communal bank for the past two years.  She likes it because the bonds of friendship strengthen with each meeting.

Trancito is 45 years old, married, and has four children, ages 27, 24, 22, and 18.  Her two oldest are married and live on their own.  Her next youngest son works and helps her financially, and her youngest lives at home.  Her husband works in the home since he’s retired.  They live in a rented house.

Trancito is a hardworking, enterprising woman who prepares and sells fast food from Monday to Friday from 7:00 am to 2:00 pm.  In the evenings she works as a private employee and has for eight years.

She will use the money from this loan to buy dishes and ingredents to prepare her products.

loans.use: to buy dishes and ingredents.

loans.name: Las Minas  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
El banco comunal Las Minas se encuentra conformado por 11 socias y 1 socio quienes viven en la comunidad de Las Minas por la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, esta parroquia cuenta con varios lugares para disfrutar de la naturaleza gracias a su geografía accidentada, su arquitectura es una mezcla de lo moderno y lo antiguo. Su gente es amable, gentil y aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos, se dedican a labores del campo como es la agricultura, crianza de animales y muchos salen a la ciudad a laborar en diferentes actividades que les permiten aportar a la economía de sus hogares.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Rosa Lucrecia, tiene 53 años de edad, vive en unión libre  y no ha concebido hijos, su esposo es sastre, la casa en la que vive es propia.

Doña Rosa Lucrecia se dedica  a los quehaceres de su hogar y a la agricultura, siembra hortalizas y verduras las que luego vende en un mercado de la ciudad, también se dedica a la cría de cerdos, pollos, cuyes y ganado. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la construcción de un nuevo galpón para pollos, también va a comprar alimento para sus animales. 

Su meta es agrandar su negocio.
texts.en:
The “Las Minas” (The Mines) communal bank has 11 female and one male member who live in the community of Las Minas in El Valle Parish, Cuenca.  This parish has several places where nature can be enjoyed thanks to its fractured topography.  Its architecture is a mixture of the modern and the ancient.  Its residents are kind, gracious and still retain the culture and traditions of their peoples.  They work in the fields in agriculture and animal husbandry and many go to the city to work in various jobs that make it possible for them to contribute towards their home’s economy.

One of the members of this group is Rosa Lucrecia, 53, who lives in a free union and has had no children; her husband is a tailor and the house they live in is theirs.  Rosa Lucrecia does household chores and works in agriculture growing vegetables that she then sells in a market in the city; she also raises pigs, chickens, guinea pigs and cattle.

She will use her loan to build a new chicken coop and will also buy animal feed.  Her goal is to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy animal feed and build a chicken coop.

loans.name: Conchán  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Conchan es un banco comunal que está conformado por 8 mujeres que viven por los alrededores de la parroquia del Valle en Cuenca, lugar que goza de verdes praderas y campos para relajarse disfrutando de la naturaleza, esta parroquia a tenido un gran progreso comercial, su gente aun se dedica a la crianza de animales y a la agricultura. Las socia son personas amables y de un corazón cálido que siempre están en la lucha  para mejorar su estabilidad económica y ofrecerles a sus hijos un mejor futuro. 

Una de las socias de este grupo es  la Señora. Carmen, se encuentra realizando el segundo crédito en conjunto con sus vecinas y amigas del banco comunal Conchan. 

La Señora. Carmen tiene 44 años, es casada y fruto de su unión conyugal ha concebido 3 hijos de 24, 4 y 2 años de edad, su primer hijo está casado y vive  independiente, su segundo hijo está estudiando en la escuelita. Su esposo es sastre, la casa en la que vive es propia.
 
Doña Carmen al igual que su esposo se dedica al arte de la costura, lleva 8 años que tiene su negocio y se dedica al arreglo de todo de tipo de prendas de vestir y también a la confección, trabaja de lunes a sábados sin un horario fijo. 

Su crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de una maquina de coser. 

Su meta es agrandar su taller hasta tener operarios.
texts.en:
Conchan is a community bank made up of eight women who live in the parish of Valle in Cuenca. This region is blessed with green meadows and countryside in which you can relax and enjoy nature. This parish has experienced much commercial growth, but its people still make a living raising animals and farming the land.

The members of the bank are warm, kind-hearted people who never stop fighting to improve their economic stability and offer their children a better future.

One of the members of this group is Señora Carmen. She is requesting her second loan with her friends and neighbors from the Conchan community bank.

Señora Carmen is 44 years old, married, and has 3 children aged 24, 4 and 2 with her husband. Her eldest son is married and lives independently. Her second son is studying at primary school. Her husband is a tailor, and the home in which she lives is her own.
 
Like her husband, Carmen makes a living dressmaking. She has had her sewing business for the past eight years, repairing all types of clothing as well as making new clothes. She works from Mondays to Saturdays without fixed hours.

Carmen will invest her loan in buying a sewing machine. Her goal is to grow her business until she can employ assistants.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine.

loans.name: Khan's Group

texts.en:
Residing in a rural village of the Kror Kor district in Cambodia’s Pursat province, Khan is 39 years of age and married. She is blessed with four children, two  of whom are still dependent (her daughters).

To earn a living, Khan farms rice and plants vegetables. Having been in the current business for more than 20 years, Khan earns approximately 10,000 KHR per day and saves about 5,000 KHR, after deducting daily expenses. This will be Khan’s second time requesting a loan via Kiva Field Partner, VisionFund. The past loan has had a huge positive impact on her as well as on her business: through the previous loan, Khan was able to expand her rice-growing business by buying more plots of farmland.

Khan is now leading a group member who has been with VisionFund for three loan cycles already to take out a loan in the amount of 1,500,000 KHR in total. As group leader, Khan plans on using her loan portion to purchase fertilizer to help keep her rice-growing business in good shape. Khan expects to earn more income from her rice-growing business after receiving the requested loan portion and, hopefully, be able to build up her savings to purchase a water pump to continually supply sufficient water for her rice-growing business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer.

loans.name: Chan Ey

texts.en:
Chan Ey lives in a rural village in Sampov Meas district in Cambodia’s Pursat province.  She is married and takes care of her young son who is still too young to attend school.

Chan Ey farms rice and raises pigs to support her family.  Each day, she earns 25,000 KHR and saves 15,000 KHR after paying for daily expenses. Chan Ey has been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for two loan cycles and has successfully increased her working capital.  Now she is seeking a 3,000,000 KHR loan to purchase a rice mill machine which will allow her to smoothly operate her rice-growing business.  

In the future, she dreams of expanding her pig-raising business and sending her son to good school.

loans.use: to purchase a rice mill machine.

loans.name: Pov's Group

texts.en:
A 33-year-old married mother of four (two schoolchildren and two children below the age of schooling), Pov is a local villager residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. She can provide for the rest of her family with support from her husband through rice farming and planting some cash-crops, including beans and sesame. She has engaged in this business for 12 years and is able to earn about 24,700 KHR per day.

Now, Pov joins Kiva Field Partner, VisionFund, as a second-time borrower. Her past loans have helped her to better support her living conditions at a good, gradual pace. Now, she is in a group of three and she is a leader. She and one of her fellow members are seeking 1,200,000 KHR each, while the remaining member is applying for 1,000,000 KHR.

Pov is going to spend her portion of the loan on buying seeds and insecticide, and paying for labor fees. She hopes to grow her cash-crop on time and receive more yield with a high selling price so that she can maintain her living conditions and keep her children in school.

loans.use: To buy seeds and insecticide, and to pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Koeurn

texts.en: Koeurn is a local farmer who grows rice as the main income source for her family. She is a 30-year-old mother with three children, one attending school and the others too young for school. The rest of her family is living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province. Her business, which she has been engaged in for 10 years, earns her about 33,000 KHR per day. For her, the main business challenge is the lack of working capital to support her rice farm. Therefore, she is seeking a new loan from Kiva partner VisionFund to overcome her challenge. She repaid her first loan already and feels empowered that she can promote a higher standard living for her family, especially her children. In this second loan with VisionFund, she is seeking 1,600,000 KHR to pay the reaping fee on her three hectare farm and to buy five sacks of fertilizer to reserve for the upcoming planting season. She hopes to gain more crop output and sell at a high price so as she can improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: To pay rice crop reaping fee and to buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Nhoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Nhoeurn, 45, is a rural villager living in Battambang province’s Moung Russey district (Cambodia), where rice farming is one of the common income-generating activities in the neighborhood. 

Not different from other villagers, Nhoeurn overcomes her family’s financial hardship via rice cropping and corn growing. Besides helping on the farm, her husband also uses his spare time to work for others for a fee for extra income. Nhoeurn has been engaged in her current business for ten years. 

The past three cycles ago was Nhoeurn’s first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). It has enabled her to steadily improve her living conditions. For this cycle, she is a leader in a group of two who are applying for 4,000,000 KHR each. 

Nhoeurn is going to use her portion to pay for the harvesting fee for her corn field. She hopes to collect her yield on time. Then she can restart replanting her corn seasonably to make more income.

loans.use: to pay for the harvesting fee for her corn field.

loans.name: Sarem

texts.en:
Aged 46 and living in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Sarem is a farmer who is responsible for three of her six children as they are still students in the local public school. She and her husband manage four hectares of rainy season rice cultivation and two hectares of sesame planting. The current business, which she has been with for 10 years, earns her about 40,000 KHR per day.

Sarem has never been with Kiva Field Partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she applies for her first loan in order to buy one hectare of farmland. She hopes that this purchase will help her to enlarge her sesame planting scale and generate good income for her children’s sake and to sustain her living.

loans.use: To buy one hectare of farmland to grow sesame.

loans.name: Khom

texts.en:
Khom, a mother of one school-aged child, residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, is a local farmer who grows rice on two hectares of land and does sesame planting on one hectare of farmland as her primary source of income. To supplement the family income, her husband also works for others for a fee after helping on the farm. With seven years of experience in this business, Khom is able to earn up to 37,800 KHR per day.

Khom has completed two loan cycles now and already fully repaid the loans. The past loans have upgraded her lifestyle gradually and supported her business step by step with a decent income. Now, she is a third-time borrower with Kiva Field Partner, VisionFund. She is seeking a new loan in order to buy one additional hectare of farmland to enlarge her cash-crop growing business. She hopes to double her income from her current business so that she can gradually better her standard of living.

loans.use: To buy one additional hectare of farmland to enlarge her cash-crop growing business.

loans.name: Saum's Group

texts.en:
Saum is 34 years old and a local farmer with four children, all of whom are in school. For the past 12 years, she has grown a variety of cash crops such as sugarcane, beans, and sesame. Saum's husband also supports the farm. She has successfully repaid her first loan with VisionFund that improved her living standards and provided for her children's education. 

Saum is the leader of a two-person loan group requesting a 4,000,000 KHR loan for each member. She will use her portion of the loan to buy fertilizer to improve her crop husbandry. Saum hopes to triple her crop yields to improve her income and maintain her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Seun

texts.en:
Originally from Moung Russey district of Battambang Province where rice farming is the common business in the neighborhood, Seun is also a local farmer who overcomes her family's financial burdens by growing rice as the primary source of income. To better support the family, her husband also works as a paid worker for extra income. She has five children, two of whom are students. Engaging in this business for 12 years, she is able to earn up to 46,500 KHR per day.

Seun is a fourth-time borrower with Kiva Field Partner, VisionFund. The prior loan has helped her to sustain her living in a gradual manner. For this cycle, she is seeking 4,000,000 KHR. She is going to use her portion to buy sesame seed and to pay for plowing fees. Moreover, she will use a portion of her loan to buy equipment to support both of her sons' business, running a small place to fix motorbikes in the local area. She hopes to grow her cash crop and support her sons soon.

loans.use: To buy sesame seed and to pay for plowing fees.

loans.name: Sary

texts.en:
Living in a wooden house located in Pursat province’s Kror Kor district, Sary is now 32 years old and widowed. Sary is a rice farmer who has engaged in the business for several years. She also raises pigs to earn additional income. The current business earns her about 18,000 KHR per day to support her family’s needs, and she saves about 10,000 KHR each day.

This is the first microloan for Sary with VisionFund. She is applying for a loan of 2,500,000 KHR. With this loan, she is going to build a decent house for her family. She hopes that this loan will enable her to have a decent house for her family to live in.

loans.use: To build a decent house for her family.

loans.name: Nga

texts.en: Nga is requesting a new loan to buy a new pan and ingredients for making pancakes. This purchase will help her to better attract and satisfy her customers. Her previous loan enabled her to improve her business. She hopes that her new loan will assist her in increasing the size of her food stall and increasing sales, and will also help her to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a new pan and ingredients for making pancakes

loans.name: Mungunchimeg

texts.en:
Mungunchimeg is 23 years old and lives with her husband in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. The couple married one year ago, and her husband provides taxi services to local people. The family resides in a traditional Mongolian ger (portable felt dwelling) on a plot of land. Mungunchimeg studies traditional bone setting at a medical college, and she will graduate in the next two years. Sometimes she helps her husband by providing taxi services in his absence. She acquired driver’s license in 2010 and in September 2011 they began their taxi service. The taxi service income covers her medical college tuition fees and the family’s other expenses. 

Mungunchimeg is requesting a loan of 1,500,000 MNT. The money will be used for two separate purposes. The first is the purchase of four winter tires for their automobile, which generates their main source of income. The second is purchasing insulation materials, carpet, and a computer for their home. As a result of this loan, the family can render their taxi service without worrying about the well-being of their automobile and they can live in a comfortable and warm place.

loans.use: to purchase 4 winter tires, carpet, and a computer

loans.name: Manuel De Jesus

texts.es: Miguel de Jesús de sesenta y ocho años de edad vive junto a su compañera de vida y sus hijos en casa propia, él se dedica a la venta de queso, crema y requesón, además para complementar los gastos del hogar vende pupusas y recipientes de aluminio, tiene varios años con el negocio y eso le ha regalado mucha experiencia valiosa que le permite obtener muy buenas  ganancias, se ha hecho de clientela fija que lo prefiere porque elabora los lácteos mas exquisitos de la zona, con material de primera calidad, a precios accesibles pero sobre todo con un servicio excelente; Miguel es un hombre entregado a su labor, luchador, ama su labor y sabe que eso le ayudara a alcanzar el éxito por eso todos los días se esfuerza al máximo por superarse, su venta es de la mas conocida tiene mucha demanda por eso quiere aprovechar para realizar una nueva inversión y le ha solicitado a INTGRAL un crédito que le permita comprar maiz, lácteos por mayor y aluminio. Miguel de Jesús tiene buenas referencias de pago asegura que podrá saldar la deuda y a la vez tiene la esperanza de ofrecerle a su familia una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: Miguel de Jesús is 67 years old and lives with his wife and children in a home of his own.  He sells cheese, cream, and cottage cheese.  He also sells pupusas and aluminum containers so that he can earn enough to pay the household expenses.  He has had this business for several years and has gained much valuable experience that allows him to have good earnings.  He has steady customers who prefer to buy from him because he makes the best milk products in the zone, with high quality materials, and at good prices.  Above all he provides excellent service.  Miguel is dedicated to his work and he works hard, loves his work, and knows that it will help him reach success.  His sales are among the best known and he has great demand, so he wants to take advantage of this and make a new investment.  He has requested a loan through INTEGRAL that will allow him to buy corn, milk products, and aluminum in bulk.  Miguel de Jesús has good payment references, is certain that he will be able to get out of debt, and has hopes for offering his family a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corn, milk, and aluminum.

loans.name: Magdalena
