texts.es: El Sr. Hugo sigue con la misma actividad de la fabricación de artesanía de plomo, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que lo utilizo en fabricación de artesanía, ahora en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de plomo para realizar artesanía en miniatura ya que se acerca la feria de las alasitas tradicionales en esta época  y es ahí donde expone y vende su arte.
texts.en: Hugo continues making lead art.  He says that things went really well for him with the previous loan which he used for making art.  Now he is asking for this loan to buy lead to make miniature art, now that the traditional seasonal fairs are approaching and this is where he exhibits and sells his art.

loans.use: to buy lead to make art.

loans.name: José Norberto

texts.es:
Don José tiene 51 años de edad, esta acompañado y tiene cuatro hijos de los cuales solo dos viven con él. Desde muy temprana edad realiza trabajos agrícolas, empezó junto a sus padres y hermanos. Cuando se acompaño, inicio a trabajar de manera independiente; también empezó a comprar y vender animales. Los insumos agrícolas para sus cultivos, los adquiere en una ciudad que esta a cuatro kilómetros de su casa, luego para trasladarlos debe de pagar un vehiculo para llevarlos a casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar dos vacas lecheras. Con esto espera mejorar los ingresos de la familia, así como la alimentación ya que incluirá la leche y sus derivados, su propósito es poseer más vacas lecheras para vender el producto.
texts.en:
Jose is 51 years old, is married, and has four children.  Only two live with him.  He has been doing farm work from a young age and began with his parents and brothers.  When he married he began working on his own and also buys and sells livestock.  He buys his supplies in the city located four kilometers from her house.  He then must pay for a vehicle to take them home.

He is asking for this loan through Fundación Campo to buy two dairy cows.  With this he hopes to improve his family income and be able to feed them better, including milk and its derivatives.  His goal is to have more dairy cows so he can sell the products.

loans.use: to buy dairy cows.

loans.name: Cruz Absalon

texts.es: Don Cruz un humilde señor originario de la concordia, Municipio de Jinotega, es cliente Kiva él está muy agradecido con su segundo crédito porque le ayudo a pagar los costó de producción de su siembra de repollo. Utilizo su segundo préstamo en la compra de insumos como abono, fertilizante, y poder pagar mano de obra de su siembra con el objetivo de incrementar sus cosechas. Es por esta razón que él está solicitando su tercer financiamiento para seguir invirtiendo en la compra de fertilizantes, abonos, ureas y pago mano de obra. Con el objetivo de  obtener un mejor rendimiento de su cosecha para vender a un buen precio y obtener mejores ganancias, sus planes futuros es mejorar la infraestructura de su casa.
texts.en: Mr. Cruz is a humble man from Jinotega.  He is a Kiva borrower and is very grateful for his second loan because it helped him pay for the production costs of his cabbage crop.  He used his second loan to buy supplies such as compost and fertilizer and pay for farm labor so that he could increase his harvest.  He is asking for a third loan so that he can buy fertilizer, compost, urea, and pay for labor.  He wants to get a better return on his harvest so that he can sell it at a good price and increase his earnings.  His plans for the future are to improve the infrastructure of his home.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies.

loans.name: Marisabel

texts.es: La Sra. Marísabel tiene 22 años tiene dos hijos que tienen  las edades de 4 y 2 años,  ella se dedica  a la  la venta y  crianza de cerdos en la zona de Piñami, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La Sra. Marísabel va a usar este préstamo para la compra de cerdos para su negocio, su razón para solicitar este préstamo es la falta de capital para la compra de cerdos, la Sra. Marísabel enfrenta retos en su negocio que son mejorar su calidad de vida y  va a utilizar los beneficios para mejorar la calidad en la alimentación de sus cerdos,  su deseo es poder tener una granja donde pueda criar cantidad de cerdos para que de esta manera pueda mejorar su estabilidad económica.
texts.en: Marísabel is 22 years old and has two children, ages 4 and 2.  She sells and raises pigs in the Piñami zone.  This will her her first loan through the institution.  Marísabel will use this loan to buy pigs for her business.  She is requesting this loan because she doesn’t have the money she needs.  Marísabel has challenges in her business, such as improving her quality of life and improving the quality of her hog’s food.  She wants to have a farm where she can raise pigs so that she can improve her financial stability.

loans.use: to buy pigs.

loans.name: Santos Porfirío

texts.es:
Don Santos tiene 57 años de edad, es casado y tiene tres hijos. Él se dedica a la agricultura y a la crianza de ganando; además es pastor de una iglesia evangélica desde hace 15 años. El trabajo agrícola lo aprendió de su padre desde muy pequeño. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar tres bovinos para repasto y para comprar sácate que es su alimento. Con la inversión, estaría asegurando una fuente de ingresos para la familia, pues esos animales los venderá y comprara otros y así sucesivamente para continuar con su trabajo. También, continuar con sus cultivos de maíz y hoy desea cultivar ajonjolí y ahorrar para comprar su propio terreno.
texts.en:
Santos is 57 years old, married, and has three children.  He is a farmer and raises livestock.  He has also been the pastor of a church for 15 years.  He learned the farm work from his father when he was very young.

He will use the money from the loan he is requesting through Fundación Campo to buy cows and grass to feed them.  This investment will secure a source of income for the family because he will sell these animals and continue his work.  He will also keep up his corn farming and wants to raise sesame and save up to buy his own farmland.

loans.use: to buy cows and feed.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es:
Antonia de 48 años de edad, originaria de  Estelí, soltera, madre de 1 hijos de 19 años, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio a la edad de 40 años, con capital propio, dinero que su padre le dio para que estableciera su propio negocio de pulpería, la cual se siente muy satisfecha porque le genera ingresos a diarios, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su hija, sus expectativas es hacer crecer su pulpería.
Antonia solicita el financiamiento para comprar granos básicos, galletas, gaseosa, aceite, frijoles, jabón, etc. ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudaría a comprar toda la mercadería en general que aún no tiene en existencia, con el propósito de aumentar el inventario de su negocio.
texts.en:
Antonia is 48 years old and originally from Estelí. She is a single mother of a 19-year-old child. Antonia is a merchant who owns a convenience store. She started in the retail trade at the age of 40, using her own capital. The money was given to her by her father so that she could establish her own business. She is very satisfied with the daily income generated from her business. Her daughter helps her with the business. Her expectation is to grow her convenience store.

Antonia is requesting this loan so that she can buy basic grains, cookies, sodas, oil, beans, soap, and other items. She believes the loan will help her buy all the merchandise that she currently does not have. Her plan is to increase the inventory of her business.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, cookies, sodas, oil, beans, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: La Sra. Reina tiene 34 años tiene cuatro hijos que tienen  las edades de 3, 6, 10 y 14 años,  ella se dedica  a la  venta de artículos de primera necesidad como abarrotes, dulces, refrescos y variedad de artículos naturales en su tienda de barrio que se encuentra en localidad de el Torno,  este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución, La  Sra. Reina va a usar este préstamo para la compra variedad de productos naturales  por mayor para surtir su tienda  y  de esta manera brindar variedad de productos a sus clientes,  su razón para solicitar este préstamo es seguir mejorando en su  negocio, La  Sra. Reina va a utilizar los beneficios para seguir comprando productos y así mejorando sus ingresos, ya que esta época es de mucha demanda,  su deseo para su negocio es tener un almacén y así brindar un  mejor servicio a su clientela.
texts.en: Reina is 34 years old and has four children, ages 3, 6, 10, 14.  She sells primary needs products such as groceries, candy, soft drinks, and a variety of natural products in her neighborhood store in Torno.  This will be her first loan through the institution and she will use the money to buy natural products in quantity so that she can offer a variety of products to her customers.  Her reason for requesting this loan is to improve her business and continue buying products and improving her income, since she has great demand during this season.  Her desire for her business is to have a store so that she can provide better service to her customers.

loans.use: to buy natural products.

loans.name: Mario Del Carmen

texts.es:
Mario es cliente Kiva, de oficio agricultor, se dedica a la siembra de hortalizas, él se siente satisfecho con su segundo crédito ya que le ayudo a cultivar una manzana de repollo y pagar mano de obra en  su siembra, obteniendo buenos rendimientos y calidad de su cosecha incrementado sus ventas y de esta manera pudo obtener mejores ganancias, utilizo su segundo  préstamo en la compra de insumo y pago de mano de obra para cultivar  1 manzana de repollo, ya que la demanda de sus productos de hortalizas ha ido creciendo. 
Es por este motivo que está solicitando su tercer  crédito Kiva,  para comprar de insumo, fertilizantes, abonos y pago de mano de obra para sembrar ½ manzana de repollo  para vender, ya que él considera que obtendrá buenos rendimientos de su cosecha y se lo pagaran a un buen precio, su siguiente paso es ampliar el área de siembra.
texts.en:
Mario is a Kiva customer and a farmer by trade.  He raises vegetables and feels satisfied with his second loan because it helped him harvest a plot of cabbage and pay for field labor.  He made a good profit and the quality of his harvest increased his sales.  He used his second loan to buy supplies and pay for labor to harvest a plot of cabbage because the demand for his vegetables has been increasing.

For this reason he is asking for a third loan from Kiva to buy supplies, fertilizers, compost, and pay for labor to be able to plant half a plot of cabbage to sell.  He believes that he will obtain good profits from his harvest.  His next task will be to expand his farming area.

loans.use: to buy supplies and pay for labor.

loans.name: Martha Carolina

texts.es:
Martha de 42 años de edad, originaria de Estelí, soltero, madre de 2 hijos, de oficio comerciante, es dueña de una pulpería. Inicio su actividad laboral con capital propio, la cual poco a poco fue surtiendo con productos que aún no tenía en  existencia, ella se siente bien porque dice que sus ventas han  incrementado, ya que de esta manera ha podido tener mejores ingresos,  este ha sido su primer negocio, del cual ha podido salir adelante con las ganancias que le genera este negocio, sus expectativas es ampliar su pulpería.
Ella está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar  granos básicos, gaseosa, arroz, aceite, jabón, papel higiénico, etc. ya que ella estima que este crédito le ayudara a incrementar sus ventas agregando toda la mercadería que aún no tiene en inventario, sus planes futuros es poder mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio para darle una mejor presentación.
texts.en:
Martha is 42 years old and from Estelí.  She is single, the mother of two children, and a merchant by trade.  She owns a general store and started with her own money and stocked her store little by little with products she didn’t have.  She feels good because she says that her sales have been increasing and in this way she has been able to increase her income.  This is her first business and she has been able to get ahead with the earnings from it.  Her goal is to expand her store.

She needs this loan to buy basic grains, soft drinks, rice, cooking oil, soap, bathroom tissue, etc.  She estimates that this loan will help her increase her sales and add all the merchandise that she doesn’t have in inventory.  Her future plans are to improve the infrastructure of the place she has her business, so that she can present it better.

loans.use: to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house.

loans.name: Sin Límites  (Cuenca) Group

texts.es:
Sin Límites es un banco comunal conformado por 7 socias y 1 socio quienes son todas amigas y vecinas que tienen diferentes trabajos pero un mismo objetivo que es el de mejorar su estabilidad económica y sacar en adelante a sus familias, son mujeres de un gran carisma, entusiastas y siempre nos regalan una sonrisa. Viven por un hermoso sector de la ciudad de Cuenca, ciudad que es conocida como la Atenas del Ecuador, su arquitectura colonial le dio el nombre de Patrimonio Cultural de la Humanidad, la gastronomía típica es muy variada, su gente aun mantienen la cultura y tradiciones de sus pueblos.

Una de las socias de este grupo es la Señora. Hortensia, tiene 37 años de edad, está casada y en su unión conyugal ha concebido 2 hijos de 14 y 10 años, su primera hija estudia en el colegio y su segundo hijo en una escuelita de la ciudad. Su esposo es de profesión técnico y labora en el arreglando equipos de oficina, no tiene casa propia por lo que vive en casa de un familiar.

Doña Hortencia se dedica al comercio, vende una gran variedad de productos pero lo más que vende es chocolates artesanales, suministros de oficina y algunos artículos más, esta actividad la desempeña hace 6 años y vende recorriendo por las tiendas y negocios de sus clientes, trabaja de domingo a domingo sin un horario fijo.

Su nuevo crédito lo va a invertir en la compra de chocolateles artesanales, cuadernos, lápices, esferos, papel, etc. para continuar creciendo en este negocio. 

Su meta es tener un local propio y poder vender su mercadería desde allí.

La foto pequeña es de una socia que no pudo estar presente cuando se tomo la foto del grupo.
texts.en:
“Sin Límites” is a communal bank made up of seven women and one man;  all friends and neighbors who have different businesses but the same objective of improving their financial stabilities and getting their families ahead.  They are ladies of great charisma and enthusiasm who always reward us with a smile.  They live in a beautiful sector in Cuenca, a city known as the Athens of Ecuador.  Its pre-colonial architecture made is a World Heritage Site.  The typical food is very varied and its people maintain their culture and traditions.

Hortensia is one of the members.  She’s 37 years old, married, and has two children, ages 14 and 10.  Her older daughter attends high school and her younger son attends school in town.  Her husband is a technician and repairs office equipment.  They don’t have a home of their own so they live with a relative.

Hortensia sells a variety of products but what she sells the most of are artesian chocolates, office supplies, and a few other things.  She has been doing this for six years, sells to stores and neighborhoods, and works seven days a week without a set schedule.

She will use this loan to buy artesian chocolates, notebooks, pencils, pens, paper, etc. to continue growing her business.

Her goal is to have he own shop so she can sell her products from there.

The small photo is of a member who could not be present when the photo was taken.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Alban

texts.en:
Alban and Nertila are a couple in their thirties who have two children, three and two years old. The whole family has been photographed here. They live in suburbia of a little town in northern Albania. 

Some five years back, being talented at paving tiles, Alban started his own business in the field. He has managed to keep himself busy ever since. “I compete with quality; this is probably the reason that I don’t see any slowdown, because some others who practice this trade have already gone out of business,” Alban said.

“I want to buy a construction crane now with this loan, to speed up the process and avoid injuries, because until now I have been carrying all materials around and to the floors in my hands and I have felt exhausted after all and have injured my feet,” Alban added.

loans.use: To buy a construction crane

loans.name: Age

texts.en:
Age is 52 years old and lives in a little town in northern Albania. For the past ten years, she has been selling used clothes and other new items, like socks, at lower prices. “I just earn a small income for myself. Thank God I make my own living,” Age said. Not only does she sell such items, but she also makes beautiful embroideries and sells them to gift stores and others upon request.

Age is applying for a loan to purchase items to resell. She is respected by people who have known her for a long time now. “She is such a loving lady who never says no in helping others. She is a good-natured person," said someone at the market.

loans.use: To purchase used clothes and items at lower cost to resell

loans.name: Enverije

texts.en:
Enverije is in her early 60s and lives in the southeastern part of Albania where winters are very snowy. She is married and has three children who are married and have their own families as well. 

The region where she resides is famous for growing golden and red delicious apples, and they have a brand name. So, Enverije has been involved in this type of agriculture for the last ten years, growing apple trees and selling the harvest. She has been working alone, without any help, because her husband has been ill for the past years.

Enverije is requesting this loan to buy organic treatment for the trees, in order to spray them against bugs and also to treat them before the caterpillars begin to leave their nests.

loans.use: To buy organic treatment for the apple trees

loans.name: Santos Benigna

texts.es:
La Señora Benigna  es una persona muy honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con su esposo  y  sus 3 hijos en una col al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es una  chiclera.
Doña Benigna  el préstamo lo necesita para la compra  de chicles, bombones, confites, chocolates, churros, galletas, refrescos, etc. Con el préstamo  espera  que sus ventas aumenten debido a que contara con capital  fresco que ofrecer a los clientes. 
Doña Benigna  espera cubrir sus necesidades y así mismo desea que su situación de  vida y la de familia mejoren con esta inversión.
Doña  Benigna  espera  que en 1 año  su negocio crezca y se convierta en un mini mercadito y así poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos  a que se conviertan en personas de bien.




Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero   2013
texts.en:
Benigna is an honest, responsible, and hardworking lady who lives with her husband and three children in a southern Honduras town.  She sells snacks.

Benigna needs this loan to buy chewing gum, bon bons, candy, chocolates, churros, cookies, soft drinks.  She expects her sales to increase because she will have fresh inventory to offer her customers.

Benigna expects to cover her needs and also wants her family’s quality of life to improve with this investment.

Benigna expects her business to grow within one year and become a mini market so she can continue supporting her children so that they can become persons of means.

loans.use: to buy merchandise.

loans.name: Martha Azucena

texts.es:
La señora  Martha es una persona responsable, trabajadora y honesta, vive  con su hijo en una comunidad de Choluteca al  sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la venta de  comida  desde hace  más de 5 años. 
Doña Martha el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carne de res, pollo, condimentos, papas, pataste, chile verde, cebolla, arroz, frijoles, sal,  etc. Con el préstamo espera que las ventas en su comedor aumenten al tener más de  variedad de productos que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Martha espera cubrir un poco las necesidades  que tiene y con esto mejorar  su situación  económica y la de su familia. 
Doña Martha en unos años espera que su negocio siga  creciendo  y se convierta en uno de los negocios  más grande de la zona, así también  que su hijo  se convierta en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.



Choluteca, Honduras –  Enero   2013
texts.en:
Martha is a responsible, hardworking and honest  person. She lives with her son in a community in Choluteca in southern Honduras. Her business has been selling food for more than 5 years. Martha needs the loan to buy beef, chicken, condiments, potatoes, pataste, green chiles, onions, rice, beans, etc. With the loan, she hopes the sales in her eatery increase by having more variety of products to offer her customers. 

Martha hopes to pay for her necessities and improve her and her family's financial situation. Martha hopes to grow her business in a few years and making it one of the biggest ones on the area. She also wants her son to become a upstanding person with better opportunities in life. 




Choluteca, Honduras –  January  2013

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, condiments, potatoes,  pataste, green chiles,onions, rice, beans, salt, etc., for her business.

loans.name: Paraiso Nuevo Group

texts.es: El Banco de emprendimiento PARAISO NUEVO está  compuesto por ocho integrantes todas mujeres,  la presidenta del  banco es la Sra. Ruth tiene 29 años casada tiene 2 hijos que tiene la edad de 11 y 2 años,  ella se dedica a la venta de comida  en la localidad de Zanja Honda,   Este préstamo es su primera  secuencia dentro de la institución la Sra. Ruth va a usar este préstamo para Invertir en la compra de insumos para la elaboración de sus comidas, como arroz, fideo, papa y aceite por mayor Su razón para solicitar este préstamo por la falta de capital, la Sra. Ruth va a utilizar los beneficios en seguir comprando insumos, para la elaboración de sus comidas, la Sra. Ruth es una persona muy trabajadora se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo  brindado ya que esta es la única actividad que le permite mantenerse.
texts.en: The communal bank "PARAISO NUEVO" ["New Paradise"] is made up of eight members, all of them women. The bank's president is Ruth, who is 29 years old and married. She has two children, aged 11 and 2. She works selling food in the community of Zanja Honda,  This is her first loan cycle with the institution. Ruth will use this loan to invest in buying ingredients on a wholesale basis to prepare her foods, such as rice, noodles, potatoes and cooking oil. Her reason for requesting this loan is a lack of capital. Ruth will use the profits to continue buying ingredients to prepare her foods. Ruth is a very hard-working person. She feels happy and grateful to the institution for the support provided, since this is the only work she has to support herself.

loans.use: to invest in buying ingredients to prepare the food she sells.

loans.name: Sandra Yaneth

texts.es:
La señora Sandra  es una persona muy responsable, honesta y trabajadora, vive  con  su  esposo y  sus 3 hijos en una comunidad de Choluteca, al sur de Honduras su negocio es una pulpería. 
Doña Sandra el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de carnes, refrescos,  pan azúcar, café, arroz, frijoles, queso, leches, agua, galletas, salsas, pastas, sal,  etc. Con  el préstamo espera tener más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes.
Doña Sandra su negocio se encuentra ubicado en una  zona  muy  comercial,  espera que con los ingresos obtenidos mejore un poco su situación económica  y la de su familia. 
Doña Sandra en el futuro espera que su negocio sea una de las pulperías  más  grandes de la zona, gracias a la inversión hecha en la misma y sueña con ver a sus hijos convertidos en persona de bien y con mejores oportunidades  en la vida.




Choluteca, Honduras  –  Enero  del  2013
texts.en:
Sandra is a very responsible, honest and hard-working person. She lives with her husband and their 3 children in a community of Choluteca, in southern Honduras. Her business is a neighborhood store. 

Sandra needs the loan to buy meat, soft drinks, bread, sugar, coffee, rice, beans, cheese, milk, water, cookies, sauces, pastas, salt, etc. With the loan, she hopes to have more products to offer her customers. 

Sandra's business is located in a very commercial area. She hopes that with the income she obtains, her family's economic situation will improve a little.

In the future, Sandra hopes that her business will become one of the largest stores in the area, thanks to the investment made in it. She also dreams of seeing her children become successful, with better opportunities in life.

Choluteca, Honduras  –  January 2013

loans.use: to buy meat, soft drinks, bread, sugar, coffee, rice, beans, cheese, and other items to stock her business.

loans.name: Maria Electa

texts.es: La Sra. Maria  tiene 34 años, ella es de profesión farmacéutica, tiene su farmacia en una zona muy concurrida de la ciudad de Santa Cruz, este préstamo es su primera secuencia dentro de la institución,  La Sra. Maria  va a usar este préstamo para la compra de medicamentos   al por mayor,  La Sra. Maria enfrenta retos en su negocio que es la demanda que hay de nuevos medicamentos  y va a utilizar los beneficios en una mejor atención y comprando variedad de medicamentos como también productos de limpieza personal, La Sra. Maria  se siente feliz y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado en la otorgación del crédito ya que este le permitirá surtir su farmacia y mejorar sus ingresos económicos.
texts.en: Maria is 34 years old and she is a pharmacist.  Her pharmacy is in a very well-frequented area of the city of Santa Cruz.  This is her second loan with the communal bank.  Maria will use it to buy medicines in bulk.  She is facing challenges for her business as there is demand for new medicines.  She will use the profits to offer better service and to buy a variety of medicines and personal hygiene products.  Maria is happy and grateful to the communal bank for the support provided in the form of loans.  This will help her to stock her pharmacy and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy medicines in bulk.

loans.name: Jorge Luis

texts.es: Don  Luis Tiene 5 años de trabajar como taxista, es contador público pero debido al desempleo actual del país no ejerce su profesión, tiene un hijo de 15 años, en conjunto con su esposa trabajan a diario no importando los horarios todo para sacar a delante a su hija, la esposa  labora en un  casino en turno nocturno lo que le ha facilitado su trabajo como taxista ya que la apoya  a llevarla a altas horas de la noche de regreso a casa, con este nuevo crédito piensa comprar juego de dirección del carro para tener mayor seguridad al andar en las calles con pasajeros ya que esto es una responsabilidad del conductor y el desea que sus clientes viajen seguros.
texts.en:
Luis has been working as a taxi driver for 5 years. He is a public accountant, but due to the level of unemployment in the country at the moment he is not working in his chosen profession. He has a son who is 15 years old. Both himself and his wife work every day and are willing to work all hours, all for their daughter to get ahead. His wife works night shifts in a casino. His work as a taxi driver is a help to her as he can drive her home very late at night. 

With this new loan he is thinking about buying a navigation system for the car. This will provide greater security as travels through the streets with passengers, as he has the responsibility as the driver and he wants to ensure that his clients travel safely.

loans.use: to buy a car navigation system

loans.name: Aura Velia

texts.es:
Aura de 45 años de edad, originaria del Municipio del Mal paisillo, León, soltera,  con conocimiento académico de tercer año de secundaria,  madre de 3 hijos, mayores de edad, todo son independiente, de oficio comerciante, se dedica al negocio de pulpería y venta de sopa. Inicio en el ámbito del comercio, con capital propio, a la edad de 34 años, la cual buscaba como ganarse la vida vendiendo sopas los días domingo, para obtener una mejor fuente de ingresos, ya que ella se siente muy satisfecha  porque este negocios le genera ganancias a diarias, cuenta con clientes fijos, actualmente es dueña de una pulpería y los fines de semana siempre se dedica a vender sopa, en el negocio recibe el apoyo de su mama.
Sus expectativas es ampliar su negocio de pulpería. En esta ocasión  ella está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar, pollo, arroz, papa, cebolla, azúcar, aceite, papel higiénico, frijoles, jabón, pasta dental, etc. ya que ella estima  que este crédito le ayudara a surtir el inventario de su negocio, con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas para que le genere muchas ganancias, sus planes futuro es establecer una fritanga para hacer crecer  el negocio, una de sus metas es aumentar sus ingresos para poder pagar el préstamo y luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Aura is 45 years old, single, and originally from the town of Mal Paisillo, León. She studied up to the third year of high school, and has three grown-up children. 

She is a shop-keeper, working in her grocery store and selling soup. She began her business with her own money at the age of 34. She did so to make a living, selling soup on Sundays to earn more money.

She feels very satisfied because this business makes her money every day, she has regular customers. She currently owns her grocery store and sells soup every weekend. Her mother helps her out with her business.

Her goal is to expand her grocery store. On this occasion, she is requesting a loan to buy chicken, rice, potatoes, onions, sugar, oil, toilet paper, beans, soap, toothpaste, etc. She believes that this loan will help her to stock her shop in order to increase her sales and make higher profits. 

Her future plan is to set up a fried food stall to expand her business. One of her aims is to increase her earnings so that she can pack back the loan and request another.

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, potatoes, onions, sugar, oil, toilet paper, beans, soap, toothpaste, etc.

loans.name: G.s. Guasaule N#5 Group

texts.es:
El señor Anselmo es una persona honesta, responsable y trabajadora vive con  sus 3 hijos en una  comunidad  de Choluteca al sur de Honduras. Su negocio es la Compra y venta de semilla maní.
Don Anselmo el préstamo lo necesita para la compra de mas semillas de maní, con el préstamo espera  que sus ventas  aumenten debido a que contara con más producto que ofrecer a sus clientes que a diario le visitan.
Don Anselmo espera poder cubrir sus necesidades y así mismo desea que su calidad de vida y el de su familia mejore un poco. En unos años espera  que su negocio este posicionado como uno de los más reconocidos de la zona y poder seguir apoyando a  sus hijos para que se conviertan en personas de bien y con mejores oportunidades en la vida.
Don Walter  su negocio es una  compra y venta  de semillas desde hace 15 años. 
Don Ángel su negocio es la compra  y venta de gallinas desde hace 12 años en los diferente caseríos cercanos a su comunidad.




Choluteca, Honduras – Enero  del 2013
texts.en:
Anselmo is an honest, responsible and hard-working person. He lives with his 3 children in a community of Choluteca in southern Honduras. His business is buying and selling peanuts. 

Anselmo needs the loan to buy more peanuts. With the loan, he hopes that his sales will increase, because he will have a greater quantity of the product to offer his customers, who come to him every day. 

Anselmo hopes to cover his necessities, and at the same time he wants his quality of life and that of his family to improve a bit. In a few years he hopes that his business will be positioned as one of the most recognized in the area, and he will be able to continue supporting his children, so that they will become successful, with better opportunities in life. 

Walter's business is buying and selling seeds, which he has done for 15 years. 
 
Ángel's business is buying and selling chickens, which he has done for 12 years in the various settlements near his community. 

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2013

loans.use: to buy peanuts for his business.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy trousers, vests, shorts, skirts, blouses, sweaters etc. for their business.

loans.name: Elbia Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Elbia tiene 54 años de edad, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, junto con su hija, quien la apoya  en  su actividad,  su negocio es venta de perfumería y cosméticos actividad que realiza desde hace 12 años.
Doña Elbia en la comunidad donde vive, su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante en varias aldeas y caseríos aledaños, le distribuye su producto a muchas personas con las cuales trabaja desde hace muchos años.
Doña Elbia el crédito lo necesita para la compra de listic, desodorantes, cremas, lociones, brillos, talcos, bases, tintes,  etc. El impacto esperado con el financiamiento, es poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, gracias a que  tendrá más variedad de producto y así mismo contrarrestar la demanda que tiene.
Doña Elbia sus planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio y llegar a tener una tienda de cosméticos y perfumería mas grande, también generarse mejores ingresos para mejorar un poco su  calidad de vida y la su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras - Enero del 2012
texts.en:
Señora Elbia is 54 years old and lives in the south of Honduras with her daughter, who helps her with her business. She has sold perfumes and cosmetics for the past 12 years.

Elbia sells her products door-to-door in villages and farmhouses in the community in which she lives. She distributes her goods to lots of people with whom she has worked for many years.

Elbia needs the loan to buy lipstick, deodorant, cream, lotion, lip gloss, talcum powder, foundation, hair dye, etc. for her business. She hopes that the loan will help her to meet her customers' needs, since she will be able to offer more products and meet the demand for her products.

Elbia's plan for the future is to continue expanding her business and set up a bigger cosmetics and perfume store. She also wants to make a larger profit to improve her and her family's quality of life.


Choluteca, Honduras - January 2013

loans.use: to buy lipstick, deodorant, cream, lotion, lip gloss, talcum powder, foundation, hair dye, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Daisy

texts.es:
La señora Daisy tiene 46 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, vive con su hijo quien la apoya en su actividad comercial. Su negocio es venta de productos variado.
La señora Daisy tiene 46 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, vive con su hijo quien la apoya en su actividad comercial. Su negocio es venta de productos variado.
Doña Daisy realiza el trabajo desde hace 20 años en su comunidad donde vive. Su negocio lo hace de manera ambulante y  distribuye su producto a muchas personas de su comunidad y de aldeas aledañas a los cuales les vende sus productos desde hace muchos años. 
Doña Daisy el crédito lo necesita para la compra de pan, leche, huevos, salsas, pastas, aguas, queso etc. El impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas crezcan, debido a que contara con mucho más producto y de esta manera satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes.
Doña Daisy los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio y generarse mejores ingresos para tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto para ella y su familia.




Choluteca, Honduras - Enero del 2013.
texts.en:
Daisy is 46 years old. She lives in the southern part of Honduras. She lives with her son, who supports her with her commercial activity. Her business is selling a variety of products. 

Daisy has been doing this work for 20 years in the community where she lives. She carries out her business in a mobile manner and distributes her products to many people in her community and to more distant towns, where she has sold her products for many years. 

Daisy needs the loan to buy bread, milk, eggs, sauces, bottled water, cheese, etc. The impact she hopes for with the loan is that her sales will grow, since she will have much more product and thus she will satisfy the needs of each one of her customers. 

Daisy's plans for the future are to continue to grow with her business and generate a better income, so she can have a better quality of life for herself and her family. 

Choluteca, Honduras - January 2013.

loans.use: to buy bread, milk, eggs, sauces, pastas, bottled water, cheese, etc. for her business.

loans.name: Veneranda Janeth

texts.es:
Veneranda de 50 años de edad, originaria de León,   es una humilde comerciante quien se dedica  a la venta de ropa, soltera, madre de 2 hijos, ella debido a su condiciones de pobreza en la cual fue criada  solo finalizo su tercer año de secundaria y es por lo cual no quiere que sus  hijos tengan el mismo futuro. Ella Inicio a la edad de 45 años vendiendo ropa de forma ambulante, necesitaba un medio del cual subsistir   y poder ser independiente generando ingresos por sí misma. Luego decidió hacer un carretón de madera para poder vender su ropa y establecer un  lugar estable en la calle del mercado para poder vender su ropa, este ha sido su primer negocio, el cual le genera ganancias a diarias.
Sus expectativas es que su negocio crezca y poder salir adelante como empresaria. Está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar más ropa tales como, blusas, vestidos, faldas, pantalones, toallas, calcetines, short, etc. Con el objetivo de incrementar sus ventas, sus planes futuro es llegar a  obtener un tramo en el mercado para poder establecer una tienda de ropa, una de sus metas es poder cancelar este préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro para seguir invirtiendo en su venta de ropa.
texts.en:
Veneranda is 50 years old and from Leon.  She is a humble merchant who sells clothing.  She is the single mother of two children who was only able to complete the third year of middle school, given the poor conditions she grew up in.  She doesn’t want her children to have the same future.  She started selling clothing on foot at age 45 because she needed a way to be independent and generate income at the same time.  She later decided to build a cart so she can sell her clothing and set up in a stable location in the market so she can sell clothing.  This is her first business and it generates a daily income. 

She expects her business to grow so she can get ahead as an entrepreneur.  This will require financing to buy more clothing such as blouses, dresses, skirts, pants, towels, socks, shorts, etc.  Her future plans are to obtain a spot in the market where she can set up a store and increase her sales.  One of her goals is to be able to repay this debt so she can request another and be able to continue investing in her clothing business.

loans.use: to buy clothing.

loans.name: Leonel Alonso

texts.es:
Leonel de 43 años de edad, originario de León, casado, padre de 3 hijos entre las edades de 13, 17 y 20 años, de oficio comerciante, se dedica a la venta de repuesto de moto, del que es propietario hace más de 5 años. El inicio sus actividades a la edad de 38 años con capital propio, dinero que fue ahorrando  con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio de su anterior trabajo, el cual lo  pudo invertir  en el taller de repuestos de motos, el cual se siente muy satisfecho de las ganancias obtenidas en su negocio, cuenta con clientes fijos, en su negocio recibe el apoyo de sus hijos.
Sus expectativas es hacer crecer su negocio. Es por esta razón que Leonel está requiriendo el financiamiento para comprar cadenas, llantas, anillos, valineras, neumáticos, luces para moto,casco, aceite para moto, etc. ya que el estima que este crédito le ayudara a invertir más en su negocio, comprando todo los repuestos que aún no tiene en existencias, con el objetivo de brindar un mejor servicios a su clientela, sus planes futuro es poder mejorar la infraestructura del local en donde tiene su negocio, una de sus metas próximas es cancelar el préstamo para luego volver a solicitar otro.
texts.en:
Leonel, 43, is originally from León. He is married and has three children who are 13, 17 and 20 years old. Leonel is a salesman; he has had a store where he sells spare parts for motorcycles for more than five years. He started this business when he was 38, with his own savings from his previous job. He collected the money with a lot of effort and sacrifice. He opened a spare parts store/workshop and he feels happy with the profits he makes. He has loyal customers and his children help him.

He plans to expand his business. For this reason, Leonel is requesting a loan to buy chains, tires, rings, ball bearings, inner tubes, light bulbs for motorcycle, helmets, lubricants, etc. He believes this loan will help him to invest more in his business, since he can now buy all the spare parts he has run out of and thus offer his customers a better service. His plans for the future are to make some improvements to his workshop. From a short-term perspective, he aims to pay this loan and request a new one.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for his motorcycle workshop, such as chains, ball bearings, helmets and lubricants.

loans.name: Adriana Patricia

texts.es:
Adriana de 34 años, es madre soltera de 4 hijos menores de edad. 
Su sueño más grande es brindarles una buena educación y garantizarle una vida digna a su familia. Gracias a la oportunidad que Dios le regaló de crear su propio negocio ella consigue lo necesario para vivir y darles a sus hijos alimentación y una vivienda donde alojarse. Adriana se levanta muy temprano para realizar las labores del hogar y enviar sus hijos al colegio, posteriormente se desplaza por los barrios de su localidad en búsqueda de clientes para la venta de su mercancía, de esta manera Adriana se ha convertido en un gran ejemplo para millones de mujeres solteras en nuestro país que tienen que ser padre y madre a la vez. En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de nueva mercancía que le han solicitado, espera que con esta inversión sus ventas e ingresos mejoren.
texts.en:
Adriana, age 34, is the single mother of four minor children.  Her biggest dream is to give them a good education and to promise them a decent family life.  Thanks to the opportunity of creating her own business that God gifted her with, she got what she needed to live, to feed her children, and a house in which to live.

Adriana gets up very early to do the household chores and to send her children to school.  She later travels through the neighborhoods in her area searching for customers to whom she can sell her merchandise.  In this way Adriana has become a great example for millions of single women in Colombia who have to be father and mother at the same time.

She is currently requesting a loan to buy new merchandise that customers have requested from her.  She hopes that with this investment her sales and income will improve.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes.

loans.name: Ángela María

texts.es:
“Para superarse sólo se necesitan ganas y disciplina, pilares fundamentales para alcanzar el éxito” con esta frase doña Ángela de 39 años de edad,  manifiesta como alcanzó su sueño de convertirse en estilista. 
Laboró por varios años como empleada doméstica, y al tiempo estudiaba belleza en una academia de su municipio. Después de terminar su estudió, laboró por un tiempo mas, hasta que logró reunir el dinero necesario para montar su negocio. Hoy es bastante reconocido en su sector por su excelente trabajo. Su calidad de vida ha mejorado considerablemente y uno de sus hijos ha podido acceder a la educación superior. Su mayor sueño es que su negocio siga creciendo, por lo cual se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de una estantería e insumos para la venta de productos en su salón de belleza.
texts.en:
"To improve oneself, one only needs the desire to do so and discipline: fundamental pillars for success."

With this phrase, Ángela, 39 years old, demonstrates how she followed her dreams and became a professional stylist. She worked for several years as a housekeeper while, at the same time, studying in a beauty academy in her city. After she finished her studies, she worked for a little while longer until she had saved enough money to open her own business. Now, Ángela is very well-known in her area for the excellent work she does. Her quality of life has considerably improved and one of her children was admitted to a university. 

Ángela's biggest dream is for her business to keep growing. She is requesting this loan in order to buy shelves and beauty products to sell in her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy shelves and beauty products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy food to sell.

loans.name: Blanca Yised

texts.es:
Blanca de 27 años de edad es una fiel representación de que con disciplina y esfuerzo es posible alcanzar las metas. “Lo importante es no rendirse, se debe seguir adelante aunque la oscuridad sea intensa, siempre con la convicción de que al final del túnel estará brillando una luz para guiarnos”. Con esta frase Blanca cuenta como su gran sueño de tener negocio propio  se convirtió en realidad, a pesar de los momentos difíciles que bebió padecer a causa de su precaria situación económica. 
Labora en su tienda de ropa todos los días de 9 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde. Con esta actividad ha podido brindarle a su hijo de dos años de edad una mejor condición de vida. 
En la actualidad se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía (jeans, camisas, sandalias, accesorios), con el fin de aumentar sus ventas y poder generar los recursos necesarios para el sostenimiento de su hogar, debido a que su negocio es su única fuente de ingresos.
texts.en: Blanca is twenty-seven and a prime example that discipline and efforts can lead you to your goals. "What is important is to not give up, one must keep going even in the deepest darkness, and believe that there is a guiding light at the end of the tunnel." This is Blanca's explanation on how she made her great dream of having her own shop come true, in spite of the difficult moments she had to live through because of her financial situation. She works at her clothes shop every day from nine in the morning to six in the evening. This business is what enabled her to bring her two-year-old son a better quality of life. She asks for a loan to buy merchandise (jeans, shirts, sandals, and accessories) in order to increase her sales and generate the income necessary to cope with household expenses, seeing as her shop is her sole source of income.

loans.use: to buy clothes to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy ingredients for the preparation of empanadas and buñuelos

loans.name: Daniela

texts.es: Daniela de 22 años de edad, es una joven emprendedora y segura de lo que desea en la vida. A pesar de no contar con el apoyo de su familia por la precaria situación económica en la que se encuentran, ella no abandona su sueño de ser una gran administradora de empresas. Por esta razón Daniela decidió dedicarse a la venta ambulante de sombreros con el fin de generar los recursos necesarios para pagarse sus estudios. Con esfuerzo y dedicación ella labora diariamente de 10 de la mañana a 6 de la tarde con el propósito de ahorrar y pagar su primer semestre. Daniela agradece la posibilidad de trabajar y conocer el mundo laborar. Hoy se encuentra solicitando un crédito para la compra de mercancía con el fin de incrementar sus ventas y generar mayores ingresos.
texts.en: Daniela, a young entrepreneur of twenty-two, knows what she wants from life. In spite of not having her family's financial support due to their poor economic circumstances, she refuses to let go of her dream of becoming a great businesswoman. This is why she chose to peddle hats in order to earn enough money to pay for her studies. She works every day, with great determination and sparing no efforts, from ten in the morning to six in the evening, her goal being to save money and pay for the first semester. Daniela is thankful for having the possibility to work and to learn about the working world. She asks for a loan in order to buy merchandise to increase her sales and improve her income.

loans.use: to buy hats to sell.

loans.name: Naira

texts.en:
Naira, age 50, is engaged in a family agricultural business. She lives in the Lanchkhuti district with her husband, father, and son. The family owns two milk cows whose milk is used for cheese production. The family also has farmland where they grow nut trees and maize. They sell the harvested products locally at a good price. Naira is a very hard-working woman and has gained a rich experience in her business. Her father is provided with a retirement pension. 

Naira has requested a loan in order to purchase a milk cow. With this investment, she will be able to produce more dairy products. This will increase the income of the family, which will allow them to improve their living conditions. 

Naira is grateful for your support.

loans.use: to purchase a milk cow

loans.name: Baadur

texts.en:
Baadur is 41 years old and lives in the village of Vaka, Khashuri District with his wife, two sons, daughter-in-law and an infant grandchild. Baadur’s elder son works at the sugar factory and gets a monthly salary. Baadur earns a living growing vegetables. The family owns agricultural land with an area of 2 hectares, which is used for growing potatoes, haricot and maize. Harvested products are sold locally to wholesalers. Additionally, Baadur and his sons work as seasonal workers in local farmers’ fields.

Baadur requested from Credo an agricultural loan in the amount of 1,500 Laris. With this money he will purchase potato seeds. He hopes that he will have a good season and get the planned amount of harvest. The profit earned will be used for covering the family’s daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase potato seeds

loans.name: Mortula

texts.en:
Mortula, age 66, is engaged in a family agricultural business. She lives in the village of Tsotskhnara with her retired husband, her son, her daughter-in-law, and a 15-year-old grandchild who attends the local school. 

The family is involved in the animal husbandry business and have three calves and two milk cows, whose milk is used in cheese products. In addition, Mortula grows nuts, haricots, maize, and strawberries on the family-owned land. She works hard to ensure a good harvest. She has gained rich experience in her work.

Mortula has requested a loan in order to purchase an additional calf and a milking cow. With this investment, she will be able to produce and sell more cheese. She intends to expand her business in order to earn a better profit. She will reinvest her profits into her agricultural business as well as being able to spend more on the family’s daily needs. 

Her goal is to improve the living conditions of the family.

loans.use: to purchase a calf and a milk cow

loans.name: John

texts.en:
John  is a 37-year-old married man with three children ranging from one to 13 years old. For the past 12 years, he has operated a dry cleaning business. John's business is located in a semi-urban area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes himself as versatile and able to adapt to many life challenges. John's major business challenge is the delay of customer payment after they have received cleaned clothes. 

John is requesting a 50,000 KES loan to buy a dry cleaner. This will be his fifth loan with SMEP DTM. John hopes to open another similar outlet in a nearby neighborhood within five years.

loans.use: to buy a dry cleaning machine

loans.name: Nargas

texts.en: Ms Nargas is a 43-year-old married woman and a mother of five children. She has been running a business making balloons for four years. She makes colorful balloons in various sizes and sells them to the people of her community. She initiated her own business by buying materials to make balloons to support her family when her husband was the only breadwinner at that time. With the passage of time, her sales increased, as did her income. This has all happened due to her courage and determination. In order to cope with the customers’ demands, she needs to purchase raw materials such as stocks of synthetic rubber and packs of organic dyes for pigment. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 35,000. It would help her to purchase the required material to inflate her sales. She wishes to spend part of the profits on the expansion of her business.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials such as synthetic rubber and  packs of organic dyes

loans.name: Zuhra

texts.en:
Ms Zuhra is a 50-year-old vigorous married woman. She has been running a business of hand-embroidery for the past five years. She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong. However, business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband is employed in a small factory, but he does not earn enough to support his family well. Zuhra’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

She is a mother of seven children. She wants to grow her business, so she requested a loan of Rs 35,000 to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand. She shared her dream of running a training center for girls of her village. She would teach embroidery skills, so she can help her expand her business help others earn money for themselves. She is also interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as threads, sequins and pearls in large quantities

loans.name: Seeman

texts.en:
Seeman, age 43, runs a milk sales business. She initiated her own business 20 years ago by buying a buffalo. She started this venture because she needed to supplement her husband's income in order to sustain her family's needs. She and her husband have eight children.

Over time, Seeman's sales have increased and so has her income. She now has three buffaloes in milk. Her business has flourished due to her courage and determination. Because of her work, she is respected in her home and she helps her husband in all family and financial matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared her feeling of achievement from being able to send her son to college for further studies. 

She would like to supplement money she has saved with a loan in the amount of Rs 20000 in order to purchase another buffalo. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase a buffalo

loans.name: Elizbith

texts.en:
Ms. Elizbith is a 50-year-old married woman and the mother of six children.  She has been operating a business, selling milk for the past 20 years with the support of her husband.  She currently has two buffaloes and she sells their milk to many of her neighbors, along with butter and cheese that she makes from it.  She looks after the buffaloes and performs the task of collecting milk from them while her husband sells it to different places on daily basis.  They are happily working together to support their family. 

She needs to earn more to meet everyday expenditures including food, clothing and education.  In order to increase her profits, she has requested a loan of 30,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers.  She hopes to increase her capacity to produce milk, which will ultimately help generate more cash.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater  to more customers.

loans.name: Jamila

texts.en:
Ms Jamila is a 33 year-old-married woman. She is very enthusiastic about her business of selling fruit. She is doing it with the support of her husband. In this way, she manages to earn a reasonable amount of money to support her family. She is a loving mother of six children, and is responsible for their food, health, and education. She is striving hard to fulfill their basic necessities through her business. 

For the improvement for her business, she contacted Kashf Foundation and requested a loan of Rs 30,000 to purchase sacks of oranges, apples, and melons at lower rates from the market. She hopes to get an increase in her earnings by consistently meeting the market demand.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of oranges, apples, and melons at lower rates from the market so she can resell them.

loans.name: Rehana

texts.en:
Ms Rehana is a 34-year-old married woman, the mother of three children. She has been running a beauty parlor in her house for the past seven years, and she offers many services to her customers. Through providing the best services, she has become very famous on her street. 

To cope with the increasing demand of her customers, she is interested in buying additional varieties of cosmetic products for the parlor. However, these days she is facing the financial problem of low cash in hand. This has compelled her to contact Kashf Foundation to apply for her first loan. 

She needs a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy hair care products and skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities. She is hopeful to cater to more customers. 

With the help of the loan, she will not only purchase a variety of products, but will also able to meet her household expenditures.

loans.use: to buy hair care products and skin products and creams for bleaching and whitening in large quantities for her salon.

loans.name: Nazia

texts.en:
Ms Nazia is a 36-year-old married woman. She got married early, and faced many problems in running her house. Her husband is employed in a small general store and earns insufficient income to provide his family with bread and butter. Two years ago, she started a business of making paper envelopes to support her family. She makes envelopes in various sizes, and sells them to people in her community and in the local market. She has attained a regular list of customers, and makes enough to contribute to the family income.   

Nazia has three children; she is motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food, and clothing. She has improved her business to meet their day-to-day expenses. It’s her second year with Kashf Foundation, and she is happily running her business with their support. 

Now she has requested for a loan of Rs 15,000 to buy bundles of paper at lower rates from the market. She hopes to have an increase in her sales, and desires to use the earned profits for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy bundles of paper at lower rates from the market to make envelopes to sell.

loans.name: Humaria

texts.en: Ms Humaria is a 22-year-old single lady. In order to contribute to the family income, she started her own hand embroidery business with her brother. The man shown in the photo is Humaria’s brother who assists her in completing customers’ orders on time. Humaria has gained three years of experience in this field and has attained a regular list of customers. She makes unique embroidery patterns for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 15,000. She intends to use this loan to buy raw materials including cloths and threads of different colors plus packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material to create a means of increasing revenues so she may be able to generate a healthier source of income. She wishes to spend part of her income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloth and threads of different colors and packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material.

loans.name: Nadia

texts.en:
Ms Nadia is a 31-year-old married woman and the mother of three children. She had a difficult time after her husband's business failed, so she decided to work to support her family for a better future. Two years ago, she began to work on hand-embroidery in her house. She works for the people living around her house and uses the income to support her entire family. However, due to lack of availability of funds, she is unable to meet the daily demands of her customers. 

For this reason, she contacted Kashf Foundation and applied for a loan of Rs 25,000. She intends to use this loan to buy raw material including cloths and threads of different colors and packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material to create a means of increasing revenues and generate a healthier source of income. She is currently in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history. She wishes to spend part of the income on the betterment of her family members.

loans.use: to buy raw material including cloths and threads of different colors and packs of sequins, pearls and glittery material.

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Ms Kousar is 37-year-old married woman, and the mother of six children. She has been running a business of flour grinding for many years. She started her own business by buying a flour grinding machine to support her family; prior to that, her husband was the only bread earner. With the passage of time, she has become famous in her community for providing good quality flour, and has maintained a regular list of customers. 

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family, as well as financial, matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her children to school for further studies. 

She has some savings, and has applied for a loan of Rs 20,000 to purchase another machine to provide the best quality service to her customers. She is in her 2nd loan cycle with Kashf Foundation. She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. 

She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase another machine to provide the best quality service to her customers.

loans.name: Haleema

texts.en:
Ms Haleema is 29-year-old married woman and the mother of four children. For the past three years, Haleema has been running a business of hand-embroidery. She started her own business to support her family; prior to this, her husband was the only bread winner. With the passage of time, she has become famous in her community for providing unique embroidery patterns. This has all happened due to her courage and determination.

Because of her work, she is respected in her home. She helps her husband in all family, as well as financial, matters. While talking to the Kashf officer, she shared the feeling of achievement she got by sending her children to school for studies.  She has some savings, and applied a loan of Rs 25,000 to purchase spools of threads in various colors and packs of sequins, pearls, and glittering material for embellishment. She is in her second loan cycle, with a good repayment history.  

She expects a boost in her business income as she expands her business. She is very thankful to Kashf for its support.

loans.use: to purchase spools of threads in various colors with the packs of sequins, pearls, and glittering material for embellishment.

loans.name: Saira

texts.en:
Ms. Saira is 27 years old.  She is a vigorous, married woman who has three children.  She has been running a business, doing embroidery by hand for many years.  She is passionate about her work and client demand is strong.  But, she is frustrated by business challenges combined with family expenditures nearly every day.  Saira’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household. 

Saira wants to grow her business.  She has requested a loan of 20,000 PKR from the Kashf Foundation in order to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.  She is in her second loan cycle with a good repayment history.  

Saira also shared her dream, which is to run a training center for girls in her village.  She would teach them embroidery skills so that they could both help her expand her business and earn money for themselves.  In addition, she is interested in opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as spools of thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand.

loans.name: María Concepción

texts.es:
Maria tiene 43 años de edad, esta acompañada y tiene dos hijas. Ella es una persona trabajadora que se dedica a la crianza de especies menores, como: pollos y cerdos. Esto lo aprendió gracias a su madre que le enseño a trabajar y ha ganarse la vida. Hoy en día también se dedica al cuido de ganado de repasto. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar ganado bovino para engordarlo y posteriormente venderlo. De esta manera, continuara con su trabajo, para generar ingresos para su familia e ir adquiriendo más ganado, ya que quiere llegar a poseer unas 10 vacas lecheras y que sus hijas se superen día a día para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en:
María is 43 years old and has a partner and two daughters.  She is hard-working and makes a living raising young animals, such as chicken and pigs.  She learned this trade from her mother, who taught her to work and earn a living.  She now looks after cattle on a private farm.

The loan the María is applying for from Fundación Campo is to buy cattle to fatten up and to later sell.  Through this she will continue working to generate income for her family and to acquire more cattle.  She wants to have around ten dairy cows and she wants for her daughters to do well every day so they can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy cattle to fatten and sell on.

loans.name: Mariana

texts.es: La Sra. Mariana sigue con la misma actividad de la elaboración y venta de comida, cuenta   que le fue muy bien con el crédito que lo utilizo en la compra de insumos, ahora incremento sus ventas, en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de insumos por mayor, como abarrotes y aceite por mayor para la elaboración de sus comidas.
texts.en: Mariana continues with the same activity making and selling food.  She comments that she did very well with the previous loan that she used to buy ingredients; her sales increased.  On this occasion, she’s asking for the loan to buy ingredients like grocery items and oil at wholesale to prepare her dishes.

loans.use: to buy ingredients at wholesale.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: La Sra. Martha sigue con la misma actividad de la confección y arreglo de prendas de vestir,  en esta ocasión solicita el crédito para la compra de hilos y encajes por cantidad para la confección de sus prendas, cuenta que le fue muy bien con el crédito ya que tiene mucha clientela y tiene pedidos que entregar.
texts.en: Martha is still working as a seamstress, making and mending clothing.  On this occasion she is requesting a loan to buy thread and lace in bulk to make her products.  She says the previous loan was very helpful since she has many customers and orders to deliver.

loans.use: To buy thread and lace for her sewing business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy fabric, accessories and other materials to make a variety of dress styles.

loans.name: Flor Beatriz

texts.es:
Flor tiene 29 años de edad de estado civil Unión Libre tiene dos hijos vive con el esposo y con los hijos en el Recinto Mina de Piedra perteneciente al Cantón Ventanas Provincia de Los Ríos. 

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Flor se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y aumentar la produccion le gusta mucho festejar las fiestas del carnaval.
texts.en:
Flor, 29, lives with her common-law husband and two children in Recinto Mina de Piedra, which belongs to the Ventanas Canton in the province of Los Ríos.  She is a member of the communal bank 30 DE NOVIEMBRE, which is in the same location, and she earns a living as a crop and livestock farmer.

Flor grows corn and raises animals such as chicken and pigs.  She plans to use the loan to buy supplies such as fertilizer and insecticide for her crops, as well as balanced feed for her animals.  She buys the supplies in the city of Ventanas.

Her goal is to buy cropland and increase production.  She enjoys the carnival festivities.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and insecticides for crops and balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a grill to make pupusas.

loans.name: Delia Maria

texts.es:
DELIA MARIA tiene 54 años de edad es casado tiene un hijo, vive con el hijo y con la esposa en chimbo Provincia de Bolívar.

DELIA MARIA se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz. Solicita el crédito para comprar una refrigeradora, abono y urea. Con la ayuda del crédito podrá compra el refrigerador y fertilizantes para la agricultura.

Los defaíos a los que se enfrenta son las plgas y el mal clima. El sueño es mejorar el nivel de vida. En el tiempo libre le gusta caminar.
texts.en: Delia María, 54, is married and has a son; she lives with her son and husband in Chimbo, Bolívar Province.  Delia María works in agriculture growing corn.  She’s requesting the loan to buy a refrigerator, manure and urea.  With help from the loan she will be able to buy the refrigerator and fertilizer for agriculture.  The challenges she faces are infestations and bad weather.  Her dream is to improve her standard of living.  She likes walking in her free time.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator, manure and urea.

loans.name: Elizabeth Del Carmen

texts.es:

Pertenece a la Ventanilla 30 DE NOVIEMBRE se encuentra ubicada el  recinto MINA DE PIEDRA perteneciente al cantón Ventanas se dedica a labores agrícolas y pecuarias. 

Elizabeth se dedica a la agricultura a la siembra de maíz y la crianza de animales de corral como pollos y cerdos. Con el crédito podrá comprar insumos como: fertilizantes, abonos, insecticidas para evitar las plagas y enfermedades, además alimento para los animales balanceados. Las compras las realiza en la ciudad de Ventanas. 

El sueño es comprar terreno para seguir sembrando y aumentar la produccion le gusta mucho festejar las fiestas del carnaval y salir de paseo con los hijos a utras ciudades.
texts.en:
Elizabeth, age 39, is divorced and has two children.  She lives with the children in the Mina de Piedra neighborhood in the Ventanas canton in the Los Ríos province.

She belongs to the 30 De Noviembre communal bank, which is in the Mina De Piedra neighborhood in the Ventanas canton.  She works in agriculture and with livestock.  Elizabeth grows corn and raises barnyard animals like chickens and pigs.  

With the loan she will be able to buy supplies like fertilizers, manure, and insecticides to avoid pest infestations and illnesses.  She will also buy balanced feed for the animals.  She will make her purchases in the city of Ventanas.

Her dream is to buy land in order to continue planting and increasing her production.  

She really likes to celebrate the Carnival festivities and going for walks in other cities with her children.

loans.use: to buy supplies like fertilizers, manure, insecticides, and balanced feed.

loans.name: Elda Ely

texts.es:
La señora Elda tiene 37 años, vive en la zona sur de Honduras, vive con su esposo quien la apoya en cada una de su actividad. Su negocio es venta de abarrotería en general,  trabajo que realiza desde hace 10 años en su comunidad donde vive. 
Doña Elda su negocio se encuentra en un punto estratégico, donde la fluidez de personas es grande porque se encuentra ubicada en  calle principal y esto hace que sea muy visitada. el crédito lo necesita para la compra de maíz, frijoles, carnes, pan, lácteos, pollo, refrescos, azúcar, arroz, frijoles, salsas, etc. 
Doña Elda el impacto esperado con el crédito, es que sus ventas crezcan, ya que comprara  mucha más variedad de productos y así satisfacer las necesidades de cada uno de sus clientes, los cuales visitan su negocio desde muy temprano. 
Doña Elda los planes a futuro es seguir creciendo en su negocio y ser uno de los mejores en su comunidad al mismo tiempo tener una mejor calidad de vida con su familia.



Choluteca, Honduras - Enero del 2013
texts.en:
Elda, age 37, lives in the southern region of Honduras.  She lives with her husband, and he supports her in each of her activities.  Her business is selling general groceries, which she has been doing for ten years in the community where she lives.

Her business is in a strategic location where there are a lot of people passing by because it is located on a main street.  This makes her business very busy.

She needs the loan to buy corn, beans, meats, bread, dairy products, chicken, soft drinks, sugar, rice, beans, and salsas, etc.

The impact that Elda hopes for from the loan is for her sales to grow because she will buy a much greater variety of products.  This way she will meet the needs of each one of her customers, who start visiting her business very early.

Elda’s future plan is to keep growing in her business and to be one of the best in the community.  At the same time she plans to have a better quality of life with her family.

Choluteca, Honduras – January 2013

loans.use: to buy corn, beans, meats, bread, dairy products, chicken, soft drinks, sugar, rice, beans, and salsas, etc.
